The Job Overview

We are seeking an account manager to join our team. You will be in charge of prospecting, qualifying, and closing sales regarding new company business. Account manager duties will include maintaining existing accounts, developing new accounts, and coordinating with the sales team.

A successful account manager should have excellent communication and relationship-building skills as well as the ability to work independently with minimum supervision.

Responsibilities

Below are some responsibilities that account managers are expected to assume:

Plan, execute, and manage client accounts and projects
Collaborate with clients to determine product or service requirements
Develop project plans to meet client goals and objectives
Build relationships with clients to ensure brand and project success
Create a pleasant experience for clients by coordinating with marketing and customer service to provide solutions
Provide regular updates, respond to inquiries, and address any client concerns in a timely manner
Coordinate and facilitate regular client meetings
Monitor and manage project performance
Oversee the development of new client relationships
Ensure client satisfaction and retention

Job Qualifications and Skill Sets

Below are the qualifications expected of an account manager:

Minimum of 2 years experience in Amazon Vendor Central/Seller Central
Minimum of 2 years experience in business analysis or a related field
Exceptional analytical and conceptual-thinking skills
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Excellent technical and communication skills
Experience using customer relationship management (CMS) software
Competency using Microsoft Office Suite
A track record of following through on commitments
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills

Our work environment includes:

Modern office setting
Growth opportunities

Project Manager

Job Description:

This position will coordinate between different teams within the company: sales, warehouses, procurement, logistics, finance, etc. Candidates will serve as first point of contact for communications with different teams to receive demands and requests. Candidates will be required to anticipate and identify problems accurately in a usually intense environment and provide reasonable problem-solving advice to COE Team Leader. Candidates will use data analysis skills and techniques to provide thorough analysis of the company’s everyday operations and draw conclusions about business trends based on such analysis. Candidates are expected to complete analytical reports to help the company’s decision-making progress.

To be successful in this role, you are expected to have superior skills in quantitative analysis and modeling. You are also expected to have great organizational and communication skills. You need to be a hard-working person who is used to working under stress. You need to be able to deal with sophisticated issues in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment. You also need to be a detail-oriented person with a great memory.

Job Responsibilities

1.Warehouse Coordination

Connect the warehouse teams in the U.S. and the procurement and logistics teams in China
Coordinate between the front-end sales and the back-end support team, enhance the communication and feedback procedures among teams
Help the company reduce cost and improve efficiency

2.Data Analysis

Data collection and analysis
Use data to describe and visualize the current conditions and future trends of the company’s business operations
Help business department monitor, identify and analyze problems during everyday operations and provide solutions on a timely basis
Use data analysis and the conclusions drawn from it to provide references for the company’s decision-making process

3.Remediate gaps of exceptional/edge cases

Coordination and communication between all related parties to remediate potential disputes between sales regarding business operations
Help the COE team to achieve a fair resolution that adds value to the company
Monitor the exceptional/edge cases and help establish a procedural system to convert exceptional use cases to standard ones for easier resolutions
Dive deep into the root causes and document the lessons learnt for future references

4.Quality Assessment

Ensure the effectiveness and quality of the warehouse’s daily operations
Help establish and polish the company’s quality assurance system

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree or above with background in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Data Science and other related fields
Fluent in both Mandarin Chinese and English
Proficiency in Office tools, especially Excel, at a level sufficient for business analysis
3+ years of project management experience
Strong knowledge and experience in business operation systems and financial reporting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to express thoughts clearly, logically and succinctly

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Proficiency in quantitative analysis tools like R, MATLAB, STATA, SPSS, SQL
Proficiency in programming languages like Python
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification
Have experience of successfully navigating through fast-paced environment accompanied with ambiguity like startups

Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar:

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.

At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

The Division Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.

#CB #LI-VR1

Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirement:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred.
MBA would be helpful.
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred.
Experience in the homebuilding industry would be helpful.
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to work in excess of eight hours per day in the confined quarters of an office. Also requires the ability bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and/or carry items less than 25 pounds. Finger dexterity in operating a computer keyboard and calculator. Requires sitting at a computer monitor for extended periods of time, completing paperwork and to receive/return phone messages.


Additional Requirements:
Demonstrates skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives.
Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise and relatable examples.
Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions.
Engages and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Ability to adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Prioritize and plan work activities, use time efficiently, set goals and objectives and develop realistic action plans.
Think critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem solving situations.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness, look for ways to improve and promote quality, apply feedback to improve performance and monitor own work to ensure quality.
This position outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the Associates. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

The Telematics Manager will be responsible for the remote monitoring and reporting of Vermeer Texas-Louisiana, Compact Construction Equipment, and other partners equipment assets. The individual in this role will work cross-functionally within the company as well as with external supplies to support key business objectives and drive valuable outcomes. This highly visible role will be accountable for the overall product health as it relates to data, data accuracy, and total number of assets reporting. The Telematics Manager will demonstrate alignment with the company’s mission, vision, and values, collaborate with key internal and external resources, and participate in ongoing self-development. This position directs and manages positions within the Telematics Team.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

Develops, evaluates, and influences effective and consistent productivity and teamwork to ensure the delivery of premium products and support to our partners.
Models, promotes, reinforces, and rewards the consistent use of company mission, vision, and values.
Owns the strategic execution for asset and equipment telematics.
Collaborates and contributes to the hardware technical specification for connected products and services.
Collaborates with internal stakeholders to ensure hardware provides required data for desired outcomes and reporting needs.
Identifies and adopts modern technologies, tools, & processes as needed.
Manages supplier relationships, hardware obsolescence, and transitions.
Partners with leadership across business area to develop technology visions and associated business value and financial plans.
Captures business processes, requirements, and capabilities, features, and data requirements for new and existing software product solutions.
Maximizes the investment and capabilities of the purchased or proprietary software products supporting their business area.
Collaborates with others to create and maintain a three-year technology roadmap for solutions supporting their area. Elevate impediments / issues in a timely manner.
Drives accountability with third party service providers and/or product.
Identifies opportunities to leverage applications across the organization to minimize duplicate systems within the organization. Serves as a change agent, guiding others in transformation.
Maintains documentation and standard-operating procedures (SOPs) related to usage of software products.
Communicates with stakeholders on current initiatives and research industry trends to improve business systems processes.
Track sales and set goals with telematics renewals and extended warranty sales.
Set goals and meet expectations associated with solving customer telematics issues.
Develops employees, encourages all aspects of employee career growth, testing, certification, and manufacturer training events. Conducts meetings to communicate Company information, provide guidance and direction to ensure customer satisfaction, share competitor and market penetration information and status of profit goals
Represent the company at any factory, vendor, or industry events.
Follows all safety rules and regulations while performing work assignments and adheres to all policies and procedures as directed in the employee handbook.
Performs all other duties as assigned by management in a professional and efficient manner.

Skills and Experience

High school or equivalent required.
Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience
Experience in IT, business analysis, process improvement, business operations, QA, and logistics, and/or project and product management required.
Vendor management experience preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge in key functional product areas, including user experience, technologies, architectures, and data analytics.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex concepts into simplified solutions in a straightforward and understandable manner to multiple stakeholders.
Ability to liaise between all business stakeholders to ensure collaboration and coordination
Highly organized. High energy, stamina, and enthusiasm.
Proven record improving business and vendor performance by taking a customer-focused holistic approach to understanding business processes, controls, and workflow through an organization.
Ability to execute in a fast pace, rapid iteration environment while balancing multiple priorities
Strong project management and organizational skills, with ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to make important decisions in a rapidly changing environment.
Ability to successfully pass required background check and pre-employment drug testing.
Certain positions require a valid driver's license and ability to meet requirements of the Company Driver Policy; Company will review motor vehicle records annually for all employees for whom driving a motor vehicle is an essential job function or when employees must obtain and drive rental vehicles whileconducting company business.

The Sales Analyst will assist with sales reporting and analytics, sales planning/budgeting, and help with sales data management efforts to create seamless reporting for sales insights and decision-making. This role will be responsible for monitoring various sales initiatives and performance on a regular basis, to maximize performance and revenue, identifying and executing actionable sales improvement initiatives. The analyst will also bring together sales performance and KPI data to help develop the annual sales plan. In addition, the individual in this role will support cross-functional teams including marketing, finance, network, customer service, product, and IT to share the necessary data for making key business decisions.

The position’s goal is to proactively identify trends and factors that will impact actions across product, marketing, and sales. The individual must have a data-driven outlook and a keen understanding of how to analyze disparate data sources around market trends which include competition, customers, product projections, and opportunities.

This person will support the VP Sales Operations to provide in-depth market data analysis and ongoing assessment of market/customer trends to support the Logix Fiber Networks strategy and planning.

Competencies:

· Strong analytical skills and a desire to learn more regarding using data for business recommendations.

· Solid communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to author a range of high-quality deliverables.

· Exceptional MS Excel and PowerPoint skills.

· Working knowledge of CRM systems (i.e. Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce, Hubspot) and the ability to draw insights and make recommendations from the data.

· Advanced knowledge of Tableau.

· Experience querying large relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, DB2, etc).

· Good interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively with colleagues at various levels of the organization.

· Able to organize/manage multiple priorities and projects coupled with the flexibility to quickly adapt to ever changing business questions and needs.

Logix Culture:

Each team member has a responsibility to support and operate in alignment with our culture and company values. The behaviors and actions for each value may be different depending on the team member’s role and are critical to both the success of team members and the company.

Duties/Responsibilities:

· Provide ongoing support for sales reporting and analytics in order to identify growth, targeting, and sales opportunities to help grow the business.

· Create forecasts and projections making use of competitive analysis, past performance metrics, and other indicators to predict future growth and trends.

· Report sales performance on regular basis through key performance metrics, reports, and models for multiple sales channels and make recommendations for improvements.

· Develop segmentation of customer and prospect data base to deliver efficient targeting and sales into key customer profiles.

· Assist with projects such as sales territory refinements, network construction targeting, near and off-net conversion efforts, sales incentives, program ROI, and other activities critical to driving sales.

· Provide support on the CRM platform usage, improvements, and data interpretation.

· Assist with sales planning and budgeting models based on performance and future sales expectations.

· Monitor trends both within and outside the business and identify key areas for improvement or exploration.

· Report on new product assessments and marketing efforts to ensure efficient efforts and drive targeted results.

· Work collaboratively with members from sales, sales operations, solution engineers, marketing, IT, finance and others to ensure effective reporting, analysis, cross-project communication, and issue management.

· Help build, deploy, and track prototype solutions to demonstrate ideas and build value.

· Assist with ad-hoc reports or business presentations to communicate results and learnings as needed by senior management for investors, board members, and other parties.

Required Skills/Abilities:

· Analytical skills in sales planning and analysis with demonstrated examples.

· Fast learner to get up to speed on our business, data sources, systems, etc.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Proven experience improving the efficiency of an analytics function and its effect on organizational performance.

· Innovative, forward thinker and solid abilities in relationship management.

Education and Experience:

· Experience: 5+ years of experience in sales / analysis / consulting / data management.

· Undergraduate Degree in Business or quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, etc.).

· Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook required

· Telecom, data center or other technology experience a plus.

Physical Requirements:

· Prolonged periods of working at a desk and on a computer.

Job Title: Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst

Pemex Deer Parkis a highly complex refinery located 18 miles east of Houston in Deer Park, TX. It is part of the Pemex group, a fully integrated oil company in the Americas, working across the entire value chain: exploration, production, industrial processing/refining, logistics, and marketing. The refinery’s rated capacity is 340,000 barrels per day and has the feed flexibility to process multiple grades of crudes to produce the high-quality transportation fuels the world needs. The Pemex site is co-located with other 3rd party chemical facilities, allowing for further integration and optimization of the refinery and its products. Pemex Deer Park provides a diverse and inclusive work environment that employs approximately 1000 employees with another 1000 contractors on site. We set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors and offer challenging and fulfilling job opportunities in a number of fields. We take great pride in our ability to ensure the health and safety of our workers and the environment while being a good neighbor and having a positive impact on the local community where we work.

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation depending on experience and an extensive benefits package including:

Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided.
Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching.
Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection.
Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts are offered.
Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and 9/80 Flexible Working Schedule, including limited ability to work remotely.

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

We seek a Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst who will support the IT Enterprise Digital Solutions Manager to drive alignment between IT and the business. Your role will include working with a variety of teams leading activities and projects related to RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics. Your objective is to find daily continuous improvement opportunities, including understanding their business processes, requirements, and use of each application. As the Business Systems Analyst, you will assist in project planning, coordination with vendors, and follow-up on support efforts our remote support teams are giving. From a site perspective, you will link the business and our different IT teams, translating business needs into technical solutions. You will also establish IT Application best practices at the site. We expect you to seek to understand the Refinery business and oil and Gas practices and feel comfortable working in a Plant-type environment. Creativity and customer-centric attitudes are fundamental in this role.

To be successful, you must have:

Understanding of common applications used at a Refinery
Understanding of applications and processes where Value can be created
Strong technical abilities in application design, configuration, implementation, and support
Should have working knowledge of RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centred Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics
Understanding of standard business processes in a Refinery or the Oil & Gas industry
Understanding of key ‘pain points’ in typical IT Applications environment
Ease / Proficiency in understanding complex business processes and translating them into technical solutions.
Experience developing “how to use” type documents
Experience creating an applications inventory and portfolio
Team leadership skills: able to lead, communicate, and interact with offsite Support teams
Experience having worked in similar roles or environments
Comfortable working at a Refinery or have worked in similar type plants.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) among IT, digital, and business stakeholders
Comfortable in a multi-tasking type environment

Preferred Experience in the following software:

Operator Technical Monitoring (Intellatrac / Aveva – Mobile Operator)

Your responsibilities as the Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst will include:

Stakeholder Management

Interacts with business stakeholders, their engagements/projects, understanding needs and / or requirements
Represents Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental team needs to be incorporated into the overall Enterprise Architecture
Handles and manages a portfolio of Applications within the mentioned Teams
Actively participate in Business and IT team discussions, bringing in best practices to and from the site

Value Generation & Protection

Maintain & support portfolio of Applications
Define when to purchase (OTS), use current application, or internal development.
Work with businesses to define and document business processes
Lead any new application projects, deployments, and enhancement
Contribute to the creation of knowledge-based articles used for Support
Lead the offsite Applications Support teams
Vendor management and engagement
Contract management, license management
Understand, plan, and deploy application upgrades/patches
Contribute to budget management for Applications – control spend
Definition/control of Application Support Desk KPIs
Define / Modify end-user service model – escalations, levels of service, feedback from end users
Contribute to IT communications – prepare and communicate for specific applications working with IT Operations lead
IT Policies and procedures – define, deploy, and enforce the correct use of applications.
Interact with all IT Teams – coordinating daily activities and projects

Description


Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.

As a Business Intelligence Support Specialist, you will provide support for Valero’s business intelligence tools and systems. You will foster relationships with business users to ensure their information needs are being met and provide timely resolution to their issues. You will help design, implement and support enterprise reporting solutions to our core business units. This role primarily uses SAP HANA, BW and Business Objects to support business intelligence needs of the business by working in close collaboration with other teams, end-users, and other IS departments to meet the company’s goals.

Key Competencies

Problem Solving
Initiative
Results Orientation
Interpersonal Skills

Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

Thrive in a close-knit culture that values teamwork and collaboration.
Enjoy working independently and taking on new challenges.
Be motivated and enjoy making positive impacts as a part of a collaborative team.
Embrace continuous growth and learning new technologies and techniques as the environment evolves.
Proactively seek out opportunities to get involved and add value.
Build strong relationship across IS and business teams.
Bring an attention to detail with strong problem-solving skills.
Provide top quality customer service.
Stay organized and multi-task effectively.
Communicate effectively through oral and written methods.

This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.

Qualifications


Minimum Requirements required:

A Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.
5+ years of technical experience utilizing SAP BW and/or SAP HANA.
Experience with Analysis for Office (AO) or other Reporting Tools.
Understanding of SAP BusinessObjects and Microsoft Power BI development, configuration and performance tuning.

Preferred Requirements:

Refinery industry experience.
Customer support experience.
SAP S/4HANA experience.

Benefits

Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program
100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting

Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch
Sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking/hiking on the greenbelt

Job Title: Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains System Manager
Job Description:
Diligent Delivery Systems is hiring a full-time Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains and Accounting Manager. The individual will be tasked with managing our system, supporting upgrades, identifying process improvements and leading system integration efforts.

There will be heavy data analysis using Excel and Access and assisting the Information Technology Department with administering an in-house developed SQL-based ERP system and other third-party systems, which all interface with the Accounting system (Dynamics Great Plains).

This function includes ensuring that all operational transactions are captured accurately and interfaced timely with accounting systems, while maintaining data integrity. This function provides support to the Accounting Department under the direction of the CIO for primary data flow and special analysis and data management projects. The Manager also interfaces with the Accounting Department and servers as a liaison between Accounting and IT.

This position is in-office, M-F and no remote or hybrid work schedule is considered.

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY-NO RELOCATION PACKAGE AVAILABLE.

Key points and requirements to the position are:

· Administer Microsoft Dynamics GP system to ensure a secure and stable application.

· Maintain interfaces between custom ERP applications and GP. Ensure systems correctly integrate and communicate.

· Support deployment of new ERP applications and ensure GP is prepared on the backend.

· Identify opportunities to leverage GP capabilities in support of business goals and objectives.

· Support development, administration and project work that relates to GP.

· Improve and expand GP's reporting capabilities using Smartlist, Excel Reports, SSRS, Crystal Reports, and ad-hoc SQL queries.

· Responsible for implementing, upgrading and customizing GP with systems in place and new deployments.

· Understand the processes of various corporate and operational departments within the company in order to translate those needs into IT solutions

· Support the corporate and operations users when issues arise with their systems and work with the users to understand the issues

· Team environment; good interpersonal skills required, working alongside colleagues as well as independently

· Fast-paced environment; constant deadlines and sometimes switching tasks midstream

· Independent, positive thinking and adapting to changing circumstances

REQUIREMENTS:

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics (Great Plains) is required
Bachelor's degree in technology, Accounting or related discipline
Familiarity with accounting processes and flow of data on the General Ledger and financial statements
Must be well-organized, have a strong attention to detail, and have the ability to work on multiple projects with changing priorities
Familiarity with Business Analysis skills such as process flow documenting
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (and to a lesser extent Microsoft Access)·
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical people
Ability to work full-time regular office hours with extended hours required during crunch time on projects
Transportation and/or Freight experience a plus

About Us

Diligent Delivery Systems is an established nationwide logistics company servicing thousands of clients across many industries. We utilize thousands of vendors to conduct physical deliveries on behalf of our clients with a focus on domestic final-mile ground delivery, warehousing and fulfillment across the U.S., providing a critical point-of-sale delivery to our clients.

Primary Role and Responsibilities

Business Strategic

The vCIO should discover what the client’s business does to earn revenue, how it operates internally to achieve that revenue and what their business goals/plans are near and long term.

Technology Strategic

The vCIO should discover what the client's applications are and what the business purpose is for the applications that they are using, i.e. how does this application/system help them accomplish their business goals. In addition, to help a client take advantage of the technology they have to meet their business objectives.

Business and Technology Strategic Communication

The vCIO must be able to communicate to the CITOC Professional services team and the MSP Engineering team what he/she has discovered in the Business and Technology strategic analysis.

Standards Alignment, Roadmap and Budget

The vCIO, in conjunction with the Technical Alignment Engineer, is to submit to the Professional services team any discrepancies that have been found between the client’s environment and the CITOC's I.T. Standards and Best Practices. Once the Professional services team has created scopes of work and proposals for the client, the vCIO will submit and explain to the client any quotes generated from that process. In addition, from the Technical Alignment engineer and the Professional team’s work the vCIO is to define a technical roadmap and an I.T. budget for the client. The vCIO needs to be able to explain, in layman’s terms, to the client what the standards and best practices are and why the business needs them. Lastly the vCIO needs to be able to explain in layman’s terms each quote and what business objective that they achieve.

Liaison

The vCIO manages the “business” relationship with the client and helps them achieve their business goals. He is the liaison between the Professional and MSP teams and the client. Tactical technical issues that a client communicates to the vCIO must be handed off to the Technical Alignment engineer or Service Management.

Required Skills

Complete understanding of CITOC’s Standards and Best Practices along with the ability to explain to the client in layman’s terms what they are and why they are necessary.

Complete understanding of CITOC’s recommended I.T. Policies and the ability to explain to the client in layman’s terms what they are and why they are necessary.

The ability to explain in laymen’s terms a proposed solution, how it works and how it benefits the client’s business.

The ability to explain to CITOC engineers, the client's Line Of Business applications, what data they create and what it consists of.

Communication - Ability to communicate verbally and in writing clearly and concisely; edits work for spelling and grammar; varies style to meet needs; presents numerical data effectively.

Business Ethics - Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works with integrity and is ethical; upholds organizational values.

Analytical Skills – Business analysis of a client’s environment.

The ability to listen without pre-judgement; the ability to hear what a client or fellow employee is saying.

vCIO Tasks

Business Analysis – The Client’s business, operations and use of technology.

Standards alignment

Lifecycle budgeting

Technology Business Review (QBR)

Review of reactive tickets

Creation of a client meeting agenda

Proposal requests from the Professional services team

Creation of a Technical Roadmap from the Professional services and Technical Alignment engineer input

Initial creation of User Forms

Perform the Kickoff Meetings

Creates I.T. policy templates for client use

Owns the business relationship

Join our Commodities and Global Market’s Business Credit Team in Houston as a Junior Business Credit Analyst.

In this role, you will cover a portfolio of North American trading counterparties and actively communicate with the various trading desks to fully understand the risk nature of the transactions requiring analysis and approval. You will research, gather information and prepare credit review memos that are commensurate to the potential trade exposure and the credit quality of Macquarie’s counterparties. Traded products included will be North American physical and financial power, emissions, oil and natural gas.

Being a collaborative team member who builds open dialogue-based relationships will help you succeed in meeting with existing and potential clients as part of the due diligence process to gain a better understand of the client’s financial position and operations. You will utilize your persuasive communication skills (both written and verbal), combined with confidence when being challenged as you will liaise with the traders/marketers and respond to trading requests daily. Your ability to maintain accurate attention to detail, handle pressure and competing priorities in a deadline driven environment is critical to your success in this role.

Additional Responsibilities include:

Trade documentation initialization, review and negotiation of credit risk and other risk clauses.
Financial analysis and credit underwriting, including an understanding of complex corporate structures.
Credit exposure calculation and credit limit management, including ongoing communication with the corporate credit group and senior business management to obtain timely trade approvals.
Real time, on-going and self-initiated monitoring of counterparty and related industry developments including the annual review of existing credit limits.
Proactively engage with business units and colleagues to understand underlying needs and opportunities and identify innovative solutions in a timely manner.

This role requires a bachelor’s degree and qualifications in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or other quantitative disciplines. Experience in broader credit risk analysis and possessing a high degree of ownership, delivery and timeliness are highly desired. North American energy trading market knowledge, although not required, would be beneficial to have.

The variety of work offers unmatched learning and development opportunities working with an established and experienced Credit team.

If you have 2-3 years of experience with credit risk in financial markets, possess strong numerical and analytical skills, and see yourself as having a high degree of initiative, achievement drive, and an inquisitive nature, apply today.

Job Title: Business Strategy Analyst I - Bank Operations Analytics
Job Description:
Why USAA? Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity
As a dedicated Business Strategy Analyst I, you will support, enable, and propose solutions to the strategy and analytics needs of Bank Operations. This outstanding opportunity will enable the Strategy Analytics professional to collaborate with other professionals across operations and other areas in the banks in the translation of business needs into analytically driven strategy proposal requirements and the fulfillment thereof.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX or Phoenix, AZ. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Collaborates with stakeholders to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Assists experienced Business Strategy Analysts and other subject matter experts with refining hypotheses and identifying business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Leverages advanced data-driven problem-solving techniques to manipulate and interpret business results. Translates findings into insights for strategy management and execution.
Prepares materials that help communicate the significance of the strategic insights to senior leaders and other key stakeholders. May participate in key stakeholder meetings.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.); OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting, or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.)
Experience identifying business needs and developing strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Demonstrated experience using data analytics to formulate data-driven insights.
Experience performing data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).

What sets you apart:
1-3 years of data analytics or science experience using SQL, SAS, and visualization tools (Tableau) preferred.
1-3 years of MDS experience, or Loss Control/Recovery experience in a large financial institution.
Ability to quickly develop an understanding of front-line end-to-end business processes and drivers of potential operational optimization.
Critical and strategic thinking ability and understanding of operations processes and strategies, especially as applying to Loss Control and Recovery within a large financial institution.
Excellent verbal and written communication and social skills required with ability to present sophisticated and critical issues to management.
US military experience or a military spouse/domestic partner.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:
Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $78,670 - $150,330 .

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

For more details on our outstanding benefits, please visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

Applications for this position are accepted on an ongoing basis, this posting will remain open until the position is filled. Thus, interested candidates are encouraged to apply the same day they view this posting.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.

Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Job Title: Lead Analyst – SAP PRA Business Systems - 2310002255 - Dallas, TX
Job Description:
Summary:

Energy Transfer, is currently seeking an SAP PRA specialist to support their PRA system. The PRA system is heavily customized and will require skills to reverse engineer processes and trouble shoot custom and standard SAP PRA issues. The project went live 6 months ago and requires production support. This position is part of the Accounting and Finance organization and supports the Crude Oil Acquisition and Marketing segment of the Organization. The position will involve working closely with Division Order, Regulatory, Deal Capture, and IT.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Serve as SAP PRA system specialist for the business
Designated by a Business Application Owner to be the business liaison for a specific application function
Should be able to analyze tickets that come in, understand if the solution needed is a code fix, process change or an issue with the master/transaction data.
Understand the customizations in the system by reading documents, debugging and recreating data in the test system
Fix issues arising in the PRA interfaces
Able to resolve issues in Valuation, Payments and other PRA modules in a timely manner
Escalated support of Users, Super Users, and SME's
Work with the Functional Analysts, Technical Analysts, and other technical resources as necessary to resolve issues
Should be able to replicate issues in the test system and reverse engineer processes with minimal supervision
Strong debugging skills will be very helpful
Business requirements definition and prioritization
User acceptance testing coordination (or execution)
Assessment of business process improvement recommendations and prioritization
Proactive business process and application improvement recommendations
Work alongside business as liaison to IT for PRA trouble shooting
Gain knowledge of all marketing contracts, division order processes, and regulatory requirements as they relate to SAP PRA
Prepare and analyze metrics as it relates to the various back office functional teams
Assist management in the creation of system reports
Able to adapt to rapidly changing priorities

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:

Minimum of 5 years of working in SAP with strong knowledge in SAP PRA
Knowledge of check write process in PRA
Experience troubleshooting issues arising in valuation
Knowledge of Contractual Allocations and related processes
Needs to understand the Ownership process, knowledge of cross reference setup and how each PRA module relates to other modules
Able to understand customizations in the system and become comfortable working with them quickly
Strong Analytic skills to understand the root cause of issues
Ability to debug programs to identify the issue will be very helpful as the system is very customized will be very helpful
Experienced in a customized SAP system which requires a lot of troubleshooting
Able to recreate issues in the test system
Analytic and data analysis skills required, especially MS Excel
Strong communication skills
Highly detailed oriented
Able to prioritize and multi-task

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2 - 5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5 - 8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

Plano 7 (31067), United States of America, Plano, Texas

Manager, Product Management - Auto Finance

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

What you’ll be doing...

This Director position will be responsible for end to end delivery of multiple Digital Service (Mobile & Home) programs on the web, mobile, app and cloud based platforms for Verizon. Responsibilities include Digital Marketing, Customer Experience / Omni Programs for Base Customer Support Digitally. The leader will be responsible for building a highly motivated and talented team, coaching and mentoring them to deliver high quality products and services. The Director will partner with business units to establish goals, influence and effectively communicate the vision set by Senior Leadership.

This position can be located in other valid Verizon locations.

Responsibilities

End to end delivery and support responsibility for all Verizon FIOS, Mobility & 5G FWA (Fixed Wireless Access) e-commerce solutions & Systems.

End to end delivery responsibility for Digital Marketing, Customer Experience & Omni programs delivery on web, app & other 24X7 on premise or cloud platforms.

Responsible for production defects (experience, functional, accessibility, & performance) fixing, support and troubleshooting of various platforms.

Establish objectives, create road maps, and align with key partners and stakeholders to ensure delivery of company goals.

Lead technology direction, facilitate key decision points, convert requirements into working product outcomes and drive integration with various Verizon and vendor systems.

Lead the design and architecture support for tactical and transformative ecommerce 24x7 solutions.

Drive SRE implementation including ideation, business case, architecture, design, stakeholder management, development, trials and delivery using industry standard processes and tools.

Partner with onshore and offshore design team to create and optimize UI, UX, usability and functional experience of digital sales and cross channel experience.

Lead creation of “minimum viable product”, prioritize critical tasks and enable test and learn approaches to iteratively deliver technical and business solutions.

Lead design of load and scalability testing and successful execution of testing & tuning.

Deliver results within budget, time, quality and strategic and tactical key performance goals.

Document and comply with software quality, data security and compliance processes.

Create proposals and present effectively to a diverse audience; manage stakeholders.

Hire, retain, develop high performing motivated talent and leaders both onshore and offshore. Manages teams in both direct and matrix structures. Manage multi-skilled global contractors and employees.

Drive employee satisfaction and engagement for the Digital organization.

What we’re looking for...

You’ll need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems, or related field.

Accelerated degree preferred.

Required knowledge of sales, eCommerce, Digital experience and Retail operations.

Must have demonstrated experience in partnering with Business and IT teams at multiple levels to drive alignment and delivery of complex problems.

Even better if you have:

Software Engineering and Development experience, including leading IT teams through Business Analysis, Project Management, and digital technologies.

A history of embracing and incubating emerging technology and open source products

Ability to collaborate with various partners in the tech, startup and academic ecosystems

The ability to seed and extend innovation into the greater organization to develop key talent, consistent with that of a leading technology company

Technical Leadership: the ability to choose the right technologies and inspire your teammates to deliver quality software solutions

Strong presentation skills to communicate complex concepts effectively.

Strong experience in SRE, Microservices, Cloud, Web ,Native (IOS/Android) & related Digital technologies.

Experience with relevant project and program delivery experience. Systems Administration or Engineering background preferred.

Experience with technology leadership, including solid understanding of technology selection, architecture, and full stack implementation.

Delivery experience in highly available and massively scalable ecommerce systems and services. Including Experience supporting mobile web and/ or native systems.

Direct people management experience, including leadership of diverse global teams. Experience leading senior talent, mentoring and coaching.

Experience with metrics instrumentation and leveraging digital analytics to drive experience and performance improvements. Strong experience with A-B testing and multi-variant trials.

Experience in troubleshooting & supporting mission critical 24X7 production systems, lead real-time high stake risk mitigation plan and drive timely decisions

Experience in business process transformation, user experience optimization.

Experience in Agile Process & methodologies.

Experience managing Medium to large scale ecommerce applications.

Experience building and leading a team in the development and rapid delivery of next-generation digital products

Implement MVP solutions that will drive long term technical strategy

Review, contribute to, and oversee the code and architectural patterns designed by senior-level engineers on your team

Collaborate with product managers and other partners to build a product strategy and roadmap

Collaborate with architects, other teams, product owners, and software engineers to drive the implementation of new applications

Take ideas and concepts, and visualize them in ways such that they are communicated effectively and compellingly for internal leaders, partners and customers

Understanding of ways to lead a team developing in an Agile environment

The incumbent will create standards, policies, processes, and procedures. They will also conduct business process analysis/design, needs assessments and cost benefit analysis related to the impact of the business.

Writes detailed business requirements and functional specifications for Agile development teams
Manages the approval process for the requirements/stories
Become subject matter expert in the assigned company application portfolio; Understand the underlying business logic and processes to help design solutions to new requirements and solving business problems

As a Business Analyst, you will evaluate and participate in solution alternatives with application development teams while ensuring business solutions meet corporate standards
Negotiates technical and non-technical solutions that satisfy the business users and conform to the technical architecture
Evaluate and make recommendations to improve organizational effectiveness and that may reduce cost
Work with the Quality Assurance team to derive test strategy, in creating and reviewing test cases and support functional testing

BS/BA degree or equivalent business and technical experience
The ideal candidate will have 10+ years working in IT SDLC
3-5 years of experience in Business Analysis and Project Management of Financial/Banking applications preferred
Agile/Scrum requirements and project management using a tool such as JIRA
Intermediate to advanced skills in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Ability to create flowcharts, sequence diagrams and UI mockups

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will work with Technology Services, Fusion Teams, IT infrastructure teams, developers, testers, vendors, and business users to ensure rapid thorough analysis of complex business needs, applying analytics techniques and developing solutions to drive strong outcomes. You will recommend, design and create technical solutions to solve business problems and to increase business efficiency. Creates, updates and maintains reporting solutions utilizing Power BI for multiple business partners.

Provides great service and technical support of issues, including data validation and maintaining reporting accuracy
Provides ad hoc query and reporting to business requests, as needed
Interfaces with Business Units, Client Services Desk, vendor and other IT areas to develop reporting solutions

Why USAA? Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.

We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service. They’re what guides everything we do – from how we treat our members to how we treat each other. Come be a part of what makes us so special!

The Opportunity
As a dedicated Business Intelligence Analyst I, you will support the military benefits team, specifically in assisting the business with data support for benefits and protections afforded by the Servicemember Civil Relief Act.

Analyzes sophisticated business problems and incidents using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to analysts and decision makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Builds specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. May participate in consultation to users and in cross functional teams to address business issues. Prototypes solutions for displaying information based on business needs.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position will be based in the San Antonio, TX Office. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Independently participates in collecting sophisticated business requirements by partnering with customers to define the business problem and data needs.
Applies an intermediate understanding of multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions, which may include data visualization, data transformation, or data collection.
Works closely with IT execution teams on the development of analytic infrastructures, data engineering, or related business intelligence efforts. Includes collaborating on the design and implementation of technical standards and governance practices.
Applies data visualization standard processes - often selecting the right data ‘tool for the job’ - to identify and interpret trends or patterns while following standard Enterprise branding.
Understands the value of prototyping, usability, and the end-user experience to improve the impact of the final data visualization product (dashboard, report, insight, or analysis).
Acts as a trusted data visualization advisor to the partner/end-user in order to drive business value. Develops advanced knowledge to influence relevant data, information, and application architecture decisions.
Actively participates in industry, COE, or other discipline-relevant groups/panels to stay ahead of industry trends and share standard processes with team.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are optimally identified, measured, supervised, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other business-related subject area; OR 4 years of related experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.) OR advanced degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.).
Experience identifying and implementing innovative approaches to address business problems and solutions.
Experience developing business deliverables that leverage business intelligence platforms, data management platforms, or SQL-based languages (Tableau, Business Objects, Snowflake, Hadoop, Netezza, NoSQL, ANSI SQL, or related).
Proven ability to build business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor, leadership, and EMG levels.
Demonstrated advanced communication skills with the ability to deliver presentations to all levels of management.
Proven ability to embed intuitive story telling within business intelligence solutions.

What sets you apart:
Advanced SQL knowledge; complex query experience.
Proven ability to dissect business requirements into data insights.
Ability to work independently with new data sources.
Experience with large account/transaction level data sets.
Working Tableau knowledge preferred or other visualization tools.
Working SAS knowledge.
Snowflake experience.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

What we offer:
Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location. The salary range for this position is: $78,670 - $141,570 .

These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.

Higginbotham, a privately held, independent insurance and financial services firm that ranks within the top 20 nationwide, has an immediate opening for a Business Analyst in our Fort Worth, TX office.

The Business Process Analyst’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of all IT-related business, financial, and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. This includes researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. The Business Process Analyst is also responsible for proactively generating and compiling reports based on his or her findings, complete with recommended improvements to – or new requirements for – business processes and operational procedures. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments and to assist in implementing new computer systems.

Essential Tasks:

Chart existing business processes in order to define current business activities for the development of procedures and models.
Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems or procedures for partners.
Develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging existing processes.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in operating systems across the organization.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of process analysis in order to define impact, outcome criteria, and measure-taking actions.

About Austco

Austco is a global manufacturer of hospital and clinical communications hardware and software. We make innovative products that help nurses and caregivers as they care for their patients. Established in Perth, Australia in 1986, Austco builds the most advanced nurse call and clinical communications technology in the world.

Austco's corporate head office is located in Melbourne, Australia. Our international offices are in the USA, Canada, the UK, Singapore, and New Zealand. The R&D and Order Fulfillment business units are based in Dallas, Texas.

Primary Purpose

The Construction Project Manager for the nurse call installation will plan, organize and execute all aspects of the project cycle from post-sale to customer handover. In this role, the Construction Project Manager will be responsible for completing projects timely, on budget and according to specifications. Tasks will include, but are not limited to, creating project schedules, managing the project teams, providing invoicing and billing details, conducting site training as required and communicating project progress to senior management.

Responsibilities/Job Duties

Planning

Identifies and understands project goals, objectives, and scope to create a plan that outlines tasks, timelines and resources required.
Develop contingency plans to plan for scheduling uncertainties.

Documentation

Create Gantt charts using MS Project.
Record meeting minutes and provide project updates, weekly.
Material tracking reports.
Consistent usage of MS Project, Work, Excel Outlook and Visio.

Management

Continuously monitor project dependencies and schedules.
Manage any issues that arise such as missed deadlines, cost overruns and scope creep.
Liaise with engineers, general contractors, electrical contractors, etc.
Attend project site meetings.
Oversee change notice processes.
Ensure installation work maintains at a high-quality level.
Manager progress billing schedules.
Motivate and lead the project teams.
Measure customer satisfaction rates at the end of each projects; capturing customer feedback in order to gain, maintain and improve long-term customer relationships.

Evaluating and Reporting

Track and report project team hours.
Analyze project profitability.
Communicate project status to senior management.
Project invoicing and budgeting.

Prior experience in a construction environment (5+years).
Prior experience with low voltage systems, install (5+years).
Prior experience working directly with internal and external clients/vendors.
Prior experience working directly with General Contractors.
Technical project manager experience, preferred.
Understanding of invoicing and billing for projects, where applicable.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple competing projects.
Must be able to travel (up to 50%).
Background in business skills, management, budgeting and analysis.
PMP Certification preferred

Values/Competencies

Customer service focused.
Must have strong leadership and communication skills.
Strong documentation development.
Possess a strong sense of integrity and honesty.

Behaviors

Demonstrate time management skills to ensure deadlines are met.
Highly organized, detail and solution oriented.
Possess a positive attitude and is polite in nature.
Demonstrate strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and support team development.
Ability to inspire and motivate others.
Self-motivated and take initiative.
Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced, and rapidly changing environment.

Job Title: Epic Business Analyst III - Grand Central
Job Description:
Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

BASIC PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF POSITION
The Sr Sales Process Optimization Analyst will support the organization by focusing on: Report Development, Quality Control, and Product Management, Process Improvement and automation. They will also be responsible for enhancing and maintaining Power BI and Data Visualization tools. Develop and establish reporting to track and maintain operations. Up-to-date monitoring of operations with the goal of implementing continuous improvements.

Work collaboratively with Management Team to evaluate, design, execute, and monitor business processes across all departments ensuring that the outcomes align with strategic goals.

Data extraction, creation, manipulation of multiple files and or databases
SQL/PL SQL code tuning and Query optimization.

Analyze reporting requirements, study existing reports for layout, formula and calculations, derived values, restrictions, attributes, and variants.
Support informed decision-making throughout the company by ensuring high data quality & integrity, building reports & dashboards, and conducting analyses on historical data.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business preferred.
