Job Summary:
Our Client, a global leader in the distribution of pipe, valve, and fitting products, is looking for a Business Analyst (with finance, documents, and warehouse professional experience) to join our ERP implementation team. Oracle Fusion ERP will require implementation of B2B integrations (XML/EDI) with banks and A2A integrations (document management and warehouse) within Our Clients application landscape MuleSoft. The ideal candidate will possess strong financial acumen, technical expertise, and exceptional problem-solving skills.

Key Responsibilities:
1. B2B Bank Integrations: Manage the integration of financial systems with various banking platforms, including electronic banking interfaces, online payment gateways, and treasury management systems.
2. A2A Application Integrations: Lead the integration of document management and warehouse applications with ERP (Oracle Fusion) and MuleSoft.
3. Data Analysis: Analyze financial data, transactional information, and related reports to identify opportunities for process improvement and ensure data integrity.
4. Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of integration processes, best practices, and workflows to ensure consistency and knowledge transfer within the team.
5. Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough testing and validation of integrated systems to ensure compliance with regulatory standards, data security, and operational reliability.
6. Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve any issues related to applications and bank integrations promptly, working closely with internal teams, vendors, and financial institutions.
7. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with financial regulations and data security standards. Assist in the development and maintenance of risk management protocols.
8. Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, customers, and vendors to facilitate smooth integrations, gather requirements, and manage project timelines.
9. Training: Provide training and support to internal finance and operations teams on integrated systems and best practices.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Information Systems or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a B2B or e-commerce environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of B2B integration tools and platforms.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.
Understanding of finance, order processing systems and supply chain processes.
Project management skills.
Ability to adapt to changing technology and industry trends.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) and API integration.
Experience with Oracle Fusion ERP
Experience with document management applications like OnBase
Experience with middleware applications like MuleSoft, webMethods, etc.
Familiarity with pipe, valve, and fitting products or the industrial distribution industry.

Our client, headquartered in the “Silicon Hills” of Austin, Texas, offers an experience as unique as the city in which it operates. The firm supports more than 1,700 independent financial advisors in delivering comprehensive securities and investment advisory services to their clients. With a culture rich in reinvention and advisor advocacy, they have developed integrated business management technology that, combined with its personalized consulting services, offers exceptional scale and efficiency.

As the company continues to grow, they are looking for a dedicated Director of Business Intelligence to join the team, who will report to the VP of Data Governance and Analytics. Our client's enterprise-level business intelligence team, which you will head, is responsible for developing strategic analytics capabilities, facilitating self-service, and delivering value through information assets that are purpose-driven. You will be managing a technical team of experienced business intelligence developers and analysts who will provide strategic insights in all sectors.

What YOU get to go DO at this award-winning company:



Lead the development of a big new data ecosystem that allows governed self-service analytics in an iterative, design-thinking approach. This ecosystem will enable the company to analyze data and provide efficient reports, dashboards, and scorecards.
Develop relationships with partners to identify information needs and improve growth through analytical solutions.
Design scalable and sustainable data and analytics infrastructures, frameworks, and solutions to ensure and support data-driven decisions.
Establish visualization guidelines and best practices across the organization for both the BI team and experts in areas including Compliance, Finance, Sales, Marketing, Product, and Technology organizations.
Lead complex analytics initiatives, gather and develop requirements, manage communications and timelines with the team.
Evaluate current procedures, encourage the creation of automated and scalable solutions that reduce manual labor and encourage self-service, and provide group assistance with ad hoc data and analytics requests to comprehend results and opportunities.
What you NEED to SUCCEED in this challenging role:

Bachelor's Degree required; Master's Degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
3+ years managing teams and partnering with cross-company departments.
5+ years' experience with an enterprise Business Intelligence solution (PowerBI, Tableau, or equivalent).
Experience with Tableau required.
SQL programming, data manipulation and transformation knowledge.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based enterprise data warehouse solutions (e.g., Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Snowflake) preferred.
Experience implementing and leading BI / Analytics teams within an Agile environment.
Financial Services experience preferred.
What’s in it for you at this growing company?

A world-class team of professionals, casual work environment, and rich culture.
Career path, training support, and opportunities for advancement within.
Award-winning, a stable leader in their market space and still growing.
Full health, vision, dental. 401(k) plans along with a host of voluntary plans such as car insurance, legal services, and more.
A brand-new state-of-the-art building in Southwest Austin with a basketball court, volleyball court, baseball field, walking trails, unlimited coffee, tea, and sparkling water!

Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes

System One is looking to hire a Business Analyst for an enterprise-level company in Spring, TX. This position is hybrid, 3 days in-office, 2 days work-from-home. Candidates will need to be a US Citizen or have their Green Card. Job Capsule The Business Analyst role analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of project stakeholders, whether external customers or end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering and compiling user requirements to convey to the development teams throughout the software lifecycle. The Business Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Business Analyst also plays a pivotal role in ensuring the team’s understanding of business requirements. Job Duties/Roles Collaborates with product/project managers and project sponsors to determine scope and vision. Conducts interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, work flow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods. Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics. Works with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize collected requirements. Assists in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts. Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards. Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team. Works with project managers to manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary. Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements, verbally or through written documentation, to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required (KSAR) Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development. Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, SharePoint, and AdobeXD preferred. Experience with Agile, Scrum, Kanban and Waterfall methodologies. Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products in an enterprise environment. Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language. Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into systems issues and products as required. Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing and managing resources. Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work well with others Minimum Years of Experience Minimum of five (5) years previous work-related experience in the aforementioned tasks. Required/Preferred Education Requirements Bachelor’s degree or recognized equivalent, from an accredited university, in business administration, computer science, finance, or information systems or equivalent industry experience is preferred.

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire


This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

The IT Business Systems Analyst will focus on the practice management facilitation of our ITSM Practice and streamlining through continuous improvement with toolsets. Champion of our team’s ticket metrics in Service Now, ticket prioritization, and ITSM (Incident, Problem, & Change) reporting management process.
Manage our Application Heath score cards and monthly KPI’s.
Support the teams Knowledge Management Practice & CMDB.
Support audit (SOX & Security) procedures.

Relevant IT related training/certifications (ITSM / ITIL) preferred

Strong Foundation around ITSM
Strong Foundation around ITIL
Experience with Service Now & Reporting

Requirement gathering skills capturing the problem and solution

Able to work effectively in a complex, diverse environment with multiple and changing demands

Demonstrates superior inter-personal skills, conflict resolution, and negotiating skills
Ensures open communication across project teams

DSV Air & Sea is seeking an analytical team-oriented Analyst. This is a full-time position and is a great opportunity to develop your career within the transportation logistics industry.




As a Analyst, you will be part of our Marketing and Global Tender Management team and will assist in analyzing, tracking, optimizing and reporting on client pricing requests. You will also be responsible for a variety of department tasks which include and are not limited to internal rate procurement, rate development, response development, working with global stakeholders, extensive work using Microsoft Excel, managing timelines, and stakeholder inputs.




Ideal candidates will be organized, strategic thinkers, quick learners, and extremely analytical. Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel are a MUST. Additionally, applicants must have excellent communication and time management skills, and be able to work efficiently in a small team environment and manage multiple projects at once. You will be part of a department that is tasked with providing analysis, insights and process enhancements through rigorous examination and manipulation of data using Microsoft Excel. You will be a key contributor that will collaborate cross-functionally across various departments of the Company to understand business stakeholder requirements.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Compiling & pre-populating pricing inputs using Microsoft Excel VLOOKUP techniques.

Develop formulas using Microsoft Excel

Handle project and tasks assignments in a timely manner

Develop and analyze detailed reports, charts, and shipment simulations to illustrate variances, overall spend calculations, and other using Microsoft Excel formulas.

Provide comprehensive analysis of KPIs and trends to increase profitability

Work with multiple departments to improve efficiency of processes

Diagnose and assist with time sensitive issues relating to data and timelines

Learn & gain transportation knowledge in all modes of transport in order to demonstrate knowledge & decision making methodologies during future assignments/projects.




OTHER DUTIES

Performs other duties as required.




SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES (IF ANY)

N/A




MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS




2-4 years of relevant professional experience

Strong data analysis and modeling skills

Comfortable working with large data sets

Expertise with Microsoft Excel

Degree or Course work in Statistics, Mathematics, Social Sciences, or Business related field.

Air or Sea or general Freight Forwarding experience preferred.




SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES




Computer Skills

Have strong computer skills and be proficient in MS Word, Access, and specifically Microsoft Excel.

Microsoft Excel – Must have advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Must be able to seamlessly write & combine complex and nested formulas, and should know how to debug them, audit them and creatively implement formula solutions fitting the requirements.

Knowledge of macros is a plus




Language Skills

English (reading, writing, and verbal)

Secondary Foreign language a plus




Mathematical Skills

Basic math skills




Other Skills

Strong affinity for technology and numbers.

Willingness to learn and work closely with others to understand the organization.

Ability to work flexible hours in order to meet project deadlines and to project-manage tight timelines as required.

Have strong interpersonal and communication skills. Be able to communicate on all levels within an organization.

Ability to strategize, analyze, and optimize around data

Excellent time management skills and strong attention to detail are essential

Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Desire to learn and grow!




PHYSICAL DEMANDS




While performing the duties of this job, the employee uses his/her hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, or crouch; talk or hear. The employee uses computer and telephone equipment. Specific vision requirements of this job include close vision and distance vision. Work is generally sedentary, with no specific need for physical coordination or effort. May require physical effort associated with using the computer to access information, or occasional standing, walking, lifting needed to carry out everyday activities. Hours can be extensive as well as occasionally staggered for multi-shift access. Minimal travel (approximately 10%) may be required for this role domestically and internationally.




WORK ENVIRONMENT




While performing the duties of this job, the employee rarely is exposed to fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.

About PROENERGY
Based in Sedalia, Missouri, PROENERGY is a global peaking-power solutions provider with operational experience on every continent. The company offers vertically integrated aeroderivative power services, including engineering, construction, operations, repair, maintenance, research, and true, turnkey power generation facilities that include the complete balance of plant.
Our Footprint
We are primed for the Energy Transition with permanent service locations in Missouri, Texas, and Argentina. Our world-class Missouri headquarters is purpose-built to meet peaking-power needs. It sits on 90 acres in Sedalia and features more than 900,000 sq. ft of facilities and equipment, including the only independent Level-IV aeroderivative depot in North America and a hydrogen-ready string-test facility that enables full-speed, full-load testing. Our Houston, Texas, office is a strategic satellite positioned near our own peaking-power installations.
Our Philosophy
We take care of our people and strive to make a positive difference for the world. We offer competitive pay, excellent benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life/Disability Insurance at minimal cost to the employee, 10 paid holidays, paid time off and a 401K plan. If you are looking for a rewarding career and possess the specialized knowledge and quality-oriented problem-solving skills, we encourage you to apply today.
Position Summary
The Data Analyst will gather, analyze, and compile data needed to 1) support the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process to drive supply chain material and parts planning, and 2) Provide information and insights regarding PROENERGY's customer segmentation, buying behaviors, market sizing, and commercial pipeline. A successful candidate should have experience with data sciences and be comfortable processing and analyzing data. Work closely with senior management in developing reports and dashboards that help drive business intelligence in planning and managing the Sales & Operations Planning process, Strategic business objectives, and commercial / sales planning through the interpretation of findings.
Position Responsibilities
Gathers data from a variety of sources including company data, industry and field reports, public information, or purchased sources.
Assesses commercial pipeline data to develop S&OP needs by analyzing related products volumes and timing.
Develop reports, dashboards, and tools that use the gathered data to identify current performance to goals/KPIs, support decision making processes such as pricing that can support actionable recommendations.
Maintains current knowledge of industry and business trends through communication with professional organizations, suppliers, customers, competitors, and other informed individuals.
Summarizes financial and economic data reports for review by executives, managers, clients, and stakeholders.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Required Qualifications
Ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with an emphasis on Data Sciences or Business or Marketing, Market Research or Related Field with a minimum of 5 years’ experience
Proven experience utilizing and developing Tableau reports and dashboards, extensive experience with data analytics in Microsoft Excel.
US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.
Successful candidate will need to satisfactorily complete pre-employment drug screen and background check
Desired Qualifications
Previous experience in the industrial, power or energy industry
Experience with various survey statistical analysis tools
Extensive knowledge of standard research methodologies, data analysis techniques and marketing procedures
Experience performing research studies from start to finish
Familiar with advanced statistical analysis and research methodologies, along with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), Tableau, various survey tools and syndicated data sources
Technical competence (understand software, hardware, networks, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to multitask efficiently

Business Intelligence Developer


Iodine is an enterprise AI company that is championing a radical rethink of how to create value for healthcare professionals, leaders, and their organizations: automating complex clinical tasks, generating insights and empowering intelligent care. Powered by the largest set of clinical data and use cases available, our groundbreaking clinical machine-learning engine, Cognitive ML, constantly ingests the patient record to generate real-time, highly focused, predictive insights that clinicians and hospital administrators can leverage to dramatically augment the management of care delivery.


Summary/Objective
Iodine Software equips medical care teams with the most innovative tools to solve some of their toughest problems in clinical documentation. By leveraging technology like Natural Language Processing, and ground breaking technologies like Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, our platform drives significant improvements in how hospitals document patient health conditions, in turn positively influencing team performance and patient outcomes.


What You’ll Do
Iodine Software is looking for a Business Intelligence Developer with a strong analytical prowess and a passion for problem-solving and numbers. This contributor will use query and analysis tools to define and track key performance metrics related to the effectiveness of different areas of our business. This individual will also be responsible for summarizing and communicating, both written and verbally, findings to various internal customers.


Identify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and then follow-up on all results
Work with our internal database to build and optimize the underlying data set required to run various reports
Work with account managers to report on key performance indicators and help identify areas of improvement for our clients
Perform ROI analysis on various programs to help determine performance and success
Analyze healthcare data sets and medical records to compile analysis reports
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Work with our client success teams to identify ways to improve user experiences and outcomes.


What You’ll Need
Minimum Requirements (Education, certifications and experience):
3-5 years experience with data analytics in the healthcare industry
Master’s degree in Data Analytics (preferred) or Bachelor’s Degree
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Experience with scripting languages such as Python and/or R
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
Experience with Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts, data modeling)
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Capable of working independently as well as part of a collaborative team
Outstanding problem-solving skills with a proactive approach towards assigned projects


Preferred Requirements:
Experience with working electronic medical records, healthcare payor data and claims data highly preferred
Statistical modeling experience
Proficient in R and Python strong plus
Knowledge of Shiny and/or Looker


See Something, Do Something
At Iodine, we are incredibly privileged to be entrusted with an enormous amount of Protected Health Information (PHI) amounting more than 90 million lives. Inherent to our culture is the need to live up to that trust in everything we do. Security is a primary responsibility shared by every Iodine employee and we expect everyone to honor that responsibility. That includes abiding by our security policies, being constantly vigilant to possible risks to the privacy and safety of the information given to our care and bringing forward any concerns about security.


What You’ll Get
This is a unique opportunity to join a close-knit, rapidly growing team and help us improve a key piece of the organization. You will have the opportunity to drive the strategy and direction of our product for our users. You will join a passionate and ambitious team, with a proven record of success building multiple companies. Learn more about us at www.iodinesoftware.com

**You must be currently authorized to work full-time in the United States on a permanent basis**

Job Title: Industrial Equipment Sales, Compressor Technique - El Paso, TX
Job Description:
Industrial Equipment Sales, Compressor Technique - El Paso, TX
Functional area: Sales
Country: United States
City: El Paso
Company name: Atlas Copco Compressors LLC
Date of posting: Nov 12, 2023


Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations.

Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.


Your Role


Product Sales – The Sales Representative prospects, sources, and maintains quality customers in assigned area. A requirement of this role is to achieve or exceed assigned sales goals by developing action plans and schedules to identify specific sales prospects, targets, and/or markets and to project number of contacts to be made. The Sales Representative manages, calls on, and sells products directly to customers in assigned area and will actively engage in planned prospecting activities geared at increasing the customer base. They will follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity and establish rapport through maintaining regular contact with existing and new customers (particularly key accounts). Responding promptly to customer inquiries, introducing new products and upgrades, studying customer needs and coordinating customer service are abilities the Sales Representative should have.




Additional duties of a Sales Representative include:

Preparing and presenting quotes, proposals, pricing, credit terms. Overseeing customer services through quality checks and follow-up; to help in identifying and resolving customer concerns.
Maintaining a professional image at all times through personal actions and initiatives. Enhancing division and Company reputation and brand image by consistently working to implement the Company’s core values of commitment, interaction, and innovation.
Obtaining, developing, preparing, delivering, and presenting sales materials, exhibits, and promotional programs when attending exhibits, conferences, meetings, and other local, regional, and national promotional opportunities.



Training & Development– The Sales Representative is expected to continuously update their job knowledge (for both products and sales/marketing strategies and skills) by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; networking; and participating in professional organizations.




Reporting – The Sales Representative, prepares reports as assigned relative to activity, lost orders, closings, follow-up, and performance against budget. These reports may also be on special developments, information, or feedback gathered through field activity, including recommendations for product, service, pricing changes and evaluation of competitive developments.




Perform other duties as assigned.





To succeed, you will need

Skills and experience




Four year degree in engineering, business or marketing preferred or equivalent work experience .
5+ years of direct sales experience or customer service experience, industrial equipment sales preferred.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint, Word and Excel.
Must be self-directed.
Must have excellent organizational, interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills.
Have proven business analysis skills.
Territory: El Paso, TX
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license.



In return, we offer you




Attractive benefits Include:




Excellent compensation package, including a flexible benefits plan, and generous 401 (k) retirement plan with company matching.
Health insurance / Dental insurance / Vision insurance / Life & Disability insurance, along with Maternity and Paternity Leave offered.
Tuition Reimbursement of costs associated with job-related courses/ undergraduate or graduate degree.
Paid time off, 3 weeks of vacation, 8 fixed holidays and up to 5 floating holidays.
Salary base is on knowledge, skills, and experience; range of $70K - $80K plus commissions, 3-6 month commission guarantee upon hire plus quarterly bonus program. Unlimited commissions.
Car allowance $800 - $1100 / month depending on vehicle, unlimited fuel reimbursement.
First year target income $100K+

El Paso

Plano 7 (31067), United States of America, Plano, Texas

Manager, Product Management - Auto Finance

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Title: Epic Clinical Systems Analyst III - Lumens
Job Description:
Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements

The Epic Clinical Systems Analyst III ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Systems Department. This role supports the Epic Clinical applications deployed within the Harris Health System.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelors degree in an Information Systems / Clinical Informatics related field or 4 years of related IT experience in a Healthcare environment. Certification for at least one Epic Clinical Application.


Epic Lumens Module supports endoscopy workflows which include Endoscopy reporting, providing endoscopists with tools to document findings, connect them to the appropriate images, and creating procedure reports.

Epic Lumens experience preferred
Epic Radiant experience preferred
Epic Optime experience preferred

Work Experience: 5+ Years within I.T. Three (3) Years Hospital Health Care Organizations Business Analysis

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Communication Skills:
Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)
Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)
Bilingual Skills Required No
Writing /Composing (Correspondence/ Reports )

Other Skills:
Analytical, Design, Research, Statistical

Advanced Education:
Bachelors Degree Major: Bachelors degree in an Information Systems / Clinical Informatics related field

Work Schedule: On Call

Other Requirements:
Be available to work on site (after hours) as needed
Experience providing hands-on clinical patient care in a hospital or clinic setting preferred.
At least 1 year of Epic Project and/or Epic Team Lead experience preferred.
Healthcare Information Technology experience.
Understands the limitations and opportunities presented by the applications supported.
Ability to recommend process improvements based upon industry standards in addition to resolving integrated process issues.
Ability to handle multiple activities simultaneously, be able to prioritize effectively, and meet overlapping deadlines.

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

What We Can Offer You:

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

Let's Stay Connected:

Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

Job Title: Spec, Business Analyst

Job Code: IMS20231510-107519

Job Location: Greenville. TX.

Schedule: 9/80 Alt

L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do.

About L3Harris Technologies:

L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across space, air, land, sea and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 47,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.

Job Description:

The Spec. Business Analyst will join a dynamic, fast passed organization and provide financial support and management in a matrixed organization. The analyst will work with business partners throughout the organization to drive financial results, as well as work with the leadership team to identify risks and opportunities to financial goals and plans. This analyst will also be responsible for forecasting, developing and maintaining metrics and charts, and providing explanations to deviation to forecast, which requires advanced excel skills.

Essential Functions:

Collect data, allocate costs, and prepare reports that augment the company's cost accounting system.
Ensure that costs are allocated according to established procedures.
Gather historical cost data on such activities as material purchases, labor, equipment depreciation, repairs, assembly, operating expenses, etc.
Investigate cost structures for new and existing areas of the company.
Price new services or products by developing unit costs and projecting expenses.
Prepare reports that compare budgets with actual expenses. May prepare existing or projected profitability analyses.
Compile and review budgets for corporate or organizational units using actual performance, previous budget figures, estimated revenue, expense reports, and other data sources to control funds and provide for proper financial administration.
Prepare financial plans, monitor implementation of financial policies

Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study and four (4) years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. In lieu of a degree, minimum of 8 years of prior related experience.
Position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which requires US citizenship.
Must have basic knowledge of Excel, Access, Microsoft Word applications.

Preferred Additional Skills:

Soft skills (I.E. Proficient in MS Office, Strong communication…)
Must have good communication skills.
Must be able to work independently for short durations.

Lead Business Analyst

Lead I - Business Analysis


Who we are:

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 39,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.

With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com .


You Are:

UST is looking for a Lead Business Analyst who has experience in order management and fulfillment background, planning background. Good ATP knowledge and experience with GATP, DP, SNP, and CIF APO modules. Has the ability to read ABAP and debug.


The Opportunity :

Hybrid-In office/remote
Provides 24x7 support for the client's Supply Chain business partners and warehouses.
Eyes on glass monitoring from 5 am to 5 pm PST on business working days (Resources will work on an 8 hr shift in this time window on a rotation basis with a team of
Outside this window and on weekends it will be call support for critical issues, this also on a rotation basis with a team of
Work and triage issues submitted by Supply Chain Businesses, warehouses, and any issues that arise that impact Supply Chain.
Reduce the number of tickets submitted to IT that can be resolved internally to the supply chain and provide quicker resolution time to our partners based on SLAs.
Identify and drive down recurring issues.
Identify process gaps and/or areas of opportunity for industry best practices
Attend RCA calls for SCSS to ensure that the true root cause is identified, and corrective actions are put in place.
Supports device launches.
Work with businesses to get necessary approvals to ensure no impact on key business product launches/promotions
Works with warehouses on tasks required to support outage/maintenance
Provides communications and updates on unplanned outages or issues that are supply chain impacting to ensure that all stakeholders have visibility and awareness of impacts.
Engage in projects to identify areas of opportunity for recons, automation, and monitoring.
Provides insight, feedback, and input to ensure that all of the Supply Chain is covered and upstream and downstream processes are represented.
Engage in Business Validation Testing, Night of Deployment activities, Smoke testing for projects, breakfixes, and enhancements for Supply Chain business.
Engage in Knowledge Transfers with IT to provide support to Supply Chain Businesses, Warehouses, and all partners.
Perform Daily records to ensure order flow between customers, warehouses, and other data needed for Supply Chain/Order Processing.
Identify areas/gaps to implement new recons.
Create a document library and documentation for processes, work instructions, and contacts.

This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.


What you need:

Expert-level knowledge in various BA knowledge areas (recommended by IIBA or any other professional organization for Business Analysis)
Experience in developing process flow diagrams, use cases, current/future state diagrams, and functional and technical requirements in the form of user stories/as indicated by the customer
Good understanding of Software development life cycle and methodologies


Our full-time, regular associates are eligible for 401K matching, and vacation accrual and are covered from day 1 for paid sick time, healthcare, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance benefits. Depending on the role, some associates may also be eligible for stock options.


What we believe :

We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone, to champion diversity and inclusion, and to place people at the center of everything we do.

We will listen, learn, be empathetic, and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.

Humanity:

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.

Integrity:

UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.

Location: Amarillo, TX
Job Title: Business Analyst
Career Level From: Specialist
Career Level To: Senior Specialist
Organization: Functional Business Controls (50993246)
Job Specialty: Cost Analysis Accounting

What You'll Do
Primary support includes performing budget planning, estimating, cost analysis, monitoring, and reporting, along with variance analysis and other program/project and/or division control duties. As the primary financial representative assigned to the work group, the individual will be required to work closely in a matrix relationship with the programs/projects and/or division personnel and management within CNS as well as external customers (such as NNSA NPO).


Enter and/or ensure that cost estimates are complete and comprehensive for the assigned program or organization during the Annual Controlled Baseline process each fiscal year, as well as ensuring that the cost estimate changes submitted in Baseline Change Requests (BCRs) are accurate. For program support, develop specific resource demand needs for each period and future year workload schedule. For organizational support, reconcile resource availability in comparison to program mission demands. Enter and/or validate the Estimate at Completion (EAC) for each assigned project, working with program or organization financial contacts. Analyze financial transactions for appropriate charging and request necessary corrective actions. Maintain status of all budget and financial deliverables and objectives. Analyze funding availability and budget usage, and keep the program/project and/or division manager and FBO management apprised of the fiscal status and any suggestions for course correction throughout the fiscal year.


Develop and/or generate reports and graphs that enable management to make decisions regarding current and future financial direction. Maintain an early warning trend program on all programs/projects and/or divisions being supported. Identify areas for continuous improvement associated with existing processes, tools and methods. Support continuity of cost savings initiatives and productivity improvements within the assigned work group.


The individual ensures:
Timely and effective communication and coordination within the Finance and Business Operations (FBO) Division, along with timely definition and communication of financial status with the assigned program/project and/or division personnel and management
Assignments are completed on schedule through effective time management
Compliance with all applicable external and internal rules, regulations and procedures
Documentation is maintained in configuration control of all financial information
Identification and implementation of solutions for financial issues within work group being supported
Identification and support of change initiatives within area of responsibility
Support of cooperation and cohesiveness within their assigned work group



Responsibilities include maintaining safe working conditions. Maintains strict application of regulations for security and plant protection. Identifies risks to personnel and facility safety and/or mission viability; ensures implementation of prevention and mitigation measures to eliminate or reduce the risks and potential consequences.

What You Can Expect
Meaningful work and unique opportunities to support missions vital to national and global security
Top-notch, dedicated colleagues
Generous pay and benefits with a stable organization
Career advancement and professional development programs
Work-life balance fostered through flexible work options and wellness initiatives

Bachelor's degree: Minimum 5 years of relevant experience.

PhD

Reporting & Data Analyst – DomiFi and Advantage Customer Operations

As a part of the DomiFi and Advantage Customer Operations team, the Reporting & Data Analyst will be a central point of control and information for the Operations team. The Reporting Analyst will manage and execute daily, weekly, monthly report jobs and conduct regular analysis using various techniques, e.g. data analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, data mining. Works directly with department leaders to identify reporting and analytical requirements. May be required to produce ad hoc data and reports. Will lead, facilitate, and assist with implementing or developing systems and/or process to capture business operation information.

Responsibilities:

Prepare daily, weekly, monthly report and batch reports necessary for operational processes within the call center, collections, billing, and the back-office operations team.
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting that provide insights to customer care, retention, complaints, collections, and back-office/billing performance and identify and report upon trends and patterns in the dataset that impact the organization.
Act as a key contact between the Customer Operations team and Data Strategy and Operations team to enhance and automate processes and reporting.
Lead and facilitate projects as necessary.
Perform data analysis and modeling work related to other Operations activities such as forecasting and variance analysis Support ad hoc data requests for data, analysis, or both, including development of business cases.
Prepare management reports and dashboard to communicate key metrics that provide visibility into productivity and quality of department and portfolio performance.
Effectively collaborate and communicate with cross functional teams and executive management.
Participate in data governance processes required to ensure data integrity and information optimization
Training end users on new reports and dashboards.
Complete tasks as assigned.

Qualifications:

BS degree in Operations, Business Administration, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Required 1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Advanced skills in Excel and SQL Experience with data visualization tools (especially PowerBI).
Self-starter attitude and “get things done” mentality that requires little guidance to multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to handle numerous changes and tight deadlines.
Reliable and accurate work and results.
Customer-service mentality.
Experience with Python or R preferred Consumer or mortgage lending with a fundamental knowledge of the loan origination process.
Knowledge of or experience working in HVAC, home improvement, and/or renewable energy industries.
Some previous work experience in Customer Operations, Collections, or Financial Operations is preferred.

Department Summary
This position is responsible for assisting with the design, delivery, and maintenance of information solutions containing administrative data, working closely with the business to build and enhance their methods of reporting according to the overall data architecture.


Position Overview
The Business Intelligence Analyst position in Institutional Research is an excellent role for an individual wishing to join a team of hard working and future-focused data and analytics professionals. The successful candidate will work collaboratively as a member of the Data, Analytics, and Institutional Research (DAIR) team and will interact with internal and external stakeholders to support a variety of institutional research and analytic initiatives at The University of North Texas (UNT). The person in this role will assist with the ongoing development and implementation of SAS Business Intelligence tools (SAS Visual Analytics, SAS Visual Statistics) to promote the development and use of analytic dashboards (known collectively as the Insights Program) designed for wide distribution to the UNT community. The position is responsible for assisting with the design, delivery, and maintenance of information solutions containing administrative and student data. The primary functions of this role will be to 1) perform data analysis, generate analytics, and communicate results involving institutional data, 2) assist the Director of Institutional Research with building relationships with functional and technical Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to develop and design reports and dashboards to address key institutional initiatives, 3) assist the DAIR department with advancing the data landscape. The successful candidate will join a strong team of data modelers, analysts, and institutional researchers to provide direct support to internal and external stakeholders, manage relationships with data providers and end users, and assist with communication and collaboration to notify the user community of changes, enhancements and new analytics and data resources.


Additional Posting Details

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in related field and five years of professional experience in a related field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.





Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Ability to analyze data, including numerical detail, identify patterns or trends, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to present various data in clear concise forms to a variety of audiences.
Basic working knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, legal statutes, and analysis and reporting of financial data.




Preferred Qualifications
This 12 month position requires excellent writing, oral communication, and computer skills. The successful candidate will possess a strong working knowledge of SQL and SAS programming and will be required to establish and maintain effective working relationships with data providers and consumers. A Master’s Degree in a related field and two years of data analysis work experience is preferred. The person in this position will be required to comply with all UNT Computing, State, and Federal rules regarding data usage and confidentiality. Preferred qualifications include experience working in an institutional research setting, a basic working knowledge of student data sources including financial aid, admissions, and student records.

The Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC) seeks highly qualified candidates to fill the Management Analyst IV position within the Office of Access and Eligibility Services. The Office of Access and Eligibility Services is driven by its mission to connect Texans to services by helping individuals and families in need of food, medical care, cash assistance and other social services.

The ideal candidate will thrive in an environment that emphasizes: innovation through new ideas, striving for excellence by taking pride in your work, embracing our differences as a source of strength, accomplishing more through partnership, leading by example, and learning for continuous improvement.

Management Analyst IV performs highly advanced (senior-level) professional administrative and policy analysis work. Work involves overseeing and implementing organizational studies and evaluations, evaluating systems and procedures, overseeing work simplification studies, and evaluating operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Facilitates large-scale workgroup sessions with representatives across AES. Highly skilled in the development of business process mapping, business requirements, systems thinking and technical documentation. May plan, assign, and/or supervise the work of others. Works under minimal supervision, with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.





Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Reviews and evaluates new or improved business and management practices for application to agency programs or operations. Creates business case for proposed process or technology-based changes, including developing Return on Investment and Cost-Benefit Analysis documentation. Develops new or modifies existing administrative program policies, procedures, goals, and objectives. Develops solutions to organizational issues and concerns, develops organizational change strategies and plans, and/or conducts training for their implementation. (20%)

Oversees, plans, and directs organizational studies of work problems. Advises management on agency studies by identifying priorities and defining study scope, purpose, objectives, time frames, and resource requirements. Interprets historical, current, and projected data to identify problems, causes, and areas for which procedural or system changes are indicated. Reviews comprehensive technical records and reports that present and interpret data, identify alternatives and make recommendations. (20%)

Performs advanced end-to-end analysis on audit findings and operational challenges to document existing processes and offer recommendations on improvements. (20%)

May plan, assign, and/or supervise the work of others. (20%)

Supports software development for applicable systems impacted by business process changes. (10%)

Performs related work as assigned. (10%)




Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of Texas Works and Medicaid for the Elderly and People with Disabilities programs preferred.

Extensive knowledge of business process improvement, systems thinking, or related field preferred.

Extensive knowledge of organizational development and management practices as applied to the analysis, evaluation, development, and implementation of programs, policies, and procedures; of methods and procedures analysis techniques; of work simplification methods; of forms and records design and control procedures; and of statistical analysis.

Extensive knowledge in process mapping and application of business process improvement methodologies.

Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Power Apps, Power BI or similar software.

Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and other data analysis functions or similar software.

Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Visio or similar software.

Advanced skills in the use of virtual office software and equipment.

Advanced skills in interpersonal relationships, including the ability to work with people under pressure, negotiate among multiple parties, resolve conflicts, and establish and maintain effective working relationships with various level personnel.

Advanced skills in evaluating problems; developing alternative solutions; overseeing studies; developing and interpreting policies and procedures; designing programs or training; implementing policies and procedures; preparing concise reports; communicating effectively; and planning, assigning, and/or supervising the work of others.



Registration or Licensure Requirements:
Any of the following certifications are preferred, but not required:


Lean or Six Sigma certification, Prosci Change Management or process improvement related certification preferred


Certified Product Owner (CSPO), Scrum Master (CSM), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or Agile-related certification preferred.


Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred.





Initial Selection Criteria:
1. At least 3+ years of full-time professional work experience, preferably in a large, public sector, or non-profit organization applying continuous improvement methodologies. (Required)

2. Experience with performing as part of a team by contributing to the formulation of short and long-term goals, departmental and work planning, and developing effective communication strategies and relationships with others. (Required)

3. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field from an accredited university is preferred, but not required. (Preferred)

4. High level of proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite including Teams, Visio, SharePoint, project management/process improvement software and/or related tools. (Preferred)

5. Any of the following certifications:

Lean or Six Sigma certification, Prosci Change Management or process improvement related certification preferred


Certified Product Owner (CSPO), Scrum Master (CSM), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or Agile-related certification preferred.


Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred.





Additional Information:
There will be an oral interview and in-basket exercises as part of this selection process.

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager


Job Summary:

The Business Analysis Manager is responsible for leading a team of IT business analysts to support the planning, development, and implementation of technology solutions within the government sector. This position plays a critical role in understanding business needs, assessing existing systems, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that IT projects align with government objectives and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership:
Manage and lead a team of IT business analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance management.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages professional development and knowledge sharing.
Business Analysis:
Identify, document, and analyze business processes, requirements, and objectives.
Develop and maintain a clear understanding of government policies, regulations, and procedures related to technology projects.
Collaborate with business units to define project scope and objectives.
Requirements Elicitation:
Engage with stakeholders to gather, validate, and prioritize requirements for IT projects.
Create detailed requirements documentation, including functional and technical specifications user stories and functional workflows
Solution Design and Planning:
Translate business requirements into technology solutions and systems.
Work with architects and technical teams to design efficient and cost-effective solutions.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure successful project implementation.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing and validation of IT solutions to ensure they meet established requirements and government standards.
Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify defects in the systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Facilitate communication and collaboration between IT teams, government departments, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with government goals and objectives.
Compliance and Security:
Ensure that all IT solutions meet government security and compliance requirements.
Stay current with evolving regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive records of project documentation, status reports, and project outcomes.
Prepare and present reports to senior management and government officials as required.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
At least 5 years of experience in IT business analysis, with 2 years in a managerial role.
Strong understanding of government operations, policies, and regulations.
Proven experience in leading and managing IT project teams.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Scrum).
Familiarity with government-specific software and systems is a plus.
Professional certifications, such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional), PMP (Project Management Professional), or similar, are advantageous.

Sr. IT Business Analyst
Austin, TX, United States
and 1 more

RESPONSIBILITIES

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The essential duties and primary responsibilities below are intended to describe the general requirements of this job and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Other duties may be assigned.

Build awareness among business colleagues of the business analysis process as a means for selecting
appropriate technologies for business use.
Meet with colleagues to elicit their business needs that can be solved through information technology
and document those requirements.
Develop instruments for evaluating available technology solutions and determine their quality of fit to new business needs.
Review existing applications, their use cases, and the business processes they support, and report on
opportunities to economize and rationalize the portfolio of applications.
Draft business policies and procedures related to IT and participate in efforts to promulgate and train
staff.
Participate in maintaining the ongoing updates and curation of the body of IT documentation.
Participate in creating business intelligence reports and dashboards; train others to do so.
Manage vendors that are implementing or maintaining business systems for the organization.
Orchestrate change management processes as business systems are implemented or changed.
Develop messaging to advance IT process improvement.
Apply basic project management processes to IT projects, including project chartering, schedule
development, RACI charts, progress reporting; and serve as project manager as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS—EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, Business,
Communications, or related field.
Four (4) years’ experience in one of the following roles: IT Business Analyst, Technical Writer, IT Project
Manager; a master’s degree in a related field may be substituted for two years’ experience.
Experience administering software as a service applications and users.
General competence using Microsoft Word, Visio, Excel, SharePoint, and at least one commercial
business intelligence software.
OR an equivalent combination of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, and other
characteristics consistent with the required qualifications.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment with multiple competing deadlines.
Knowledge of business analysis, swim lane diagramming, business process modeling notation (BPMN).
General knowledge of software as a service systems.
Knowledge of IT contracting issues related to software as a service and IT service management.
Knowledge of major software as a service providers.
Ability to represent the agency professionally and knowledgeably as a spokesperson.
Knowledge of cooperative purchase programs available to Texas government entities.
Knowledge of business intelligence cloud services.
Basic knowledge of information architecture principles.
Skilled in writing and editing for statements of work, project proposals, user instructions, and technical documentation.
Skilled in verbal communications, such as making public presentations or speaking with stakeholders.
Ability to research and quickly synthesize information, present it persuasively, and in a variety of formats and mediums to diverse audiences.
Ability to work quickly and accurately under deadline pressure.
Ability to work after hours and on call.
Ability to work independently and establish and maintain productive relationships with the team, including contractors and vendors.

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS

This person will be responsible to work in an agile development process for teller software design and testing. This position will work with the software development team to create software requirements, as well as the research, testing, and solutions of the teller software. What you'll be responsible for:
Interacts with business units to gather system requirements and convey business requirements.
Prepares business requirements and functional specifications
