In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://spgbenefits.com/ourbenefits .

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst, Field and Support Systems
Job Description:
Business Area:
Business Ops & IT
Job Description:
At Cloudera, we empower people to transform complex data into clear and actionable insights. Powered by the relentless innovation of the open source community, Cloudera advances digital transformation for the world’s largest enterprises.
The Business Systems Analyst, CRM will work as part of the team dedicated to driving innovation based on the needs of Cloudera’s global CRM user base. You will work cross-functionally with leaders and subject matter experts to plan, design and implement robust and scalable solutions to ensure the Organization can operate efficiently and effectively and adapt quickly to change with minimal interruption.
The Business Systems Analyst will have demonstrated experience solving complex business problems and managing systems for a global organization and can succeed in a fast-paced working environment. You will also be required to oversee and guide the work tasks and deliverables to ensure successful implementations. In addition, you will need to be able to provide development teams with sufficient details to implement appropriate system customizations as well as respond to technical support issues as required.
This position will be highly visible to, and interact with, leaders within Sales Operations, the broader Field Organization, and across Cloudera and will act as an SME for Cloudera’s Federal teams. Therefore, applicants must not only possess strong analytical, technical and interpersonal skills, they must also be willing to stand in the spotlight and display both passion and competency to management...and embrace the opportunity!
To comply with FedRAMP requirements, candidates must be US citizens on US soil to be considered for this role. This is a US-Remote opportunity.
As a Business Systems Analyst you will:
Business Process Analysis & Solution Design
Proactively seek out and identify needed system enhancements
Point of contact for business stakeholders around prioritization, coordination, and escalation of projects and enhancements
Analyze existing business processes and system configurations to identify gaps
Gather and document business requirements from end users as well as supporting the prioritization process
Review best practices and elicit information regarding feature roadmap with vendors
Design solutions to optimize processes and user experience
Present to-be solutions to business stakeholders using formal design documentation, flowcharts, and example use cases scenarios
Provide developers with well defined user stories and acceptance criteria to ensure customizations are implemented according to business stakeholder requirements
Ensure system modifications adhere to the change control processes and compliance policies
Know when the best solution may not be a change in system design
Planning, execution and documentation of testing phases as required
Support monthly release management
Communicate system changes to broader user audience in advance so they understand the change and how to use it prior to implementation
Develop documentation to support end-user training and knowledge transfer within the team
Issue Triage Support
Resolve L2 support tickets as assigned and within established service level objectives
Escalate issues to to vendor technical support as appropriate
Answer user questions and direct them to training materials
We’re excited about you if you have:
Salesforce Administrator Certification is required for this role
B.S. or B.A. degree in BIS, Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of 3+ years of experience working as a Business Systems Analyst supporting Sales/Sales Operations, Support or Federal stakeholders
Demonstrated experience developing business requirements documentation, user stories and user acceptance test scripts
Subject matter expertise working with Sales and/or Sales Operations teams with a firm understanding of demand generation, pipeline management, forecasting, and/or quote-to-cash processes
Experience with diagramming tools to develop process flow charts and user experience mock ups (Miro, LucidChart, Visio, Omnigraffle)
Proficiency with G-Suite or MS Office (word processing, spreadsheets, and presentations)
Familiarity with Agile project management and development lifecycle processes
Ability to adjust and set priorities to meet deadlines
Strong verbal communication skills, including presentation skills
Strong customer service orientation
As this role supports Cloudera’s US Federal organization, Applicants will need to meet citizenship and related criteria under NIST and DFARs regulations to be able to fulfill this role
It is a plus if you have:
Experience with Jira or other support ticket management systems
Experience with Salesforce CPQ (or similar tools) is highly desirable
Experience with prospecting tools (LinkedIn Sales Navigator and SalesLoft preferred) and/or data enrichment services (D&B and ZoomInfo preferred)
Sales Cloud Consultant or Service Cloud Consultant Certification
Familiarity with SQL programming, relational database management or BI/Analytics platforms

Generous PTO Policy
Support work life balance with
Unplugged Days
Flexible WFH Policy
Mental & Physical Wellness programs
Phone/Internet Reimbursement program
Access to Continued Career Development
Comprehensive Benefits
Competitive Packages
Paid Volunteer Time
Employee Resource Groups

Position Summary

The Business Intelligence Analyst 3 works with Technology Services, Fusion Teams, IT infrastructure teams, developers, testers, vendors, and business users to ensure rapid thorough analysis of complex business needs, applying analytics techniques and developing solutions to drive strong outcomes. Activities include analyzing and creating reports using documented procedures, assuring quality and data accuracy, and delivering the reports and dashboards on time to internal customers. You will recommend, design and create technical solutions to solve business problems and to increase business efficiency. Your designs will be current, insightful, user-friendly and help drive insights from the data. Successful candidate must have strong experience in data analysis, creating, and maintaining data catalogs, data engineering as well as reporting and analytics tools. The Business Intelligence Analyst 3 will serve as liaison between departments and generate documentation for systems and applications across various platforms. Previous technical experience and technical aptitude are required.

Creates, updates and maintains reporting solutions utilizing Power BI for multiple business partners.
Creates, updates and maintains data consistency and data quality with strong data catalog and data dictionary management.

Performs other duties and activities as directed.

None

Job Title

Project Specialist III

Agency

Texas A&M University

Department

Residence Life And Housing

Proposed Minimum Salary

Commensurate

Job Location

College Station, Texas

Job Type

Staff

Job Description

Our Commitment

Texas A&M University is committed to enriching the learning and working environment by promoting a culture that respects all perspectives, talents and identities. Embracing varying opinions and perspectives strengthens our core values which are: Respect, Excellence, Leadership, Loyalty, Integrity, and Selfless Service.

Who We Are

The Department of Residence Life is housed within the Division of Student Affairs and pr ovides on-campus housing for approximately 12,000 Texas A&M University students in traditional residence halls, apartments and Corps of Cadets halls. It is comprised of 70+ full-time staff and 475+ graduate and undergraduate student staff. We offer a fun, academic-centered environment where each staff member has the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of students. You will love it here !

What We Want

The Project Specialist III for Residence Life Housing Systems reports to the Associate Director of Residence Life and shares responsibility for the overall management of multiple enterprise level software solutions. The position is also responsible for working with department leadership, third party vendors, and Division of Student Affairs IT to analyze and document the business and operational needs for the department, review potential IT solutions, then plan, develop and implement projects to meet the identified needs. Come claim this critical role as yours and embark on a fulfilling career at Texas A&M University. If this job description sounds interesting to you, we invite you to apply to be considered for this opportunity.

What You Need to Know

Salary: Minimum of $56,000, commensurate with hire's experience.

Cover Letter and Resume: A cover letter and resume are strongly recommended to be included with the application.

Required Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience

Two years of professional, non-clerical experience in data management, analysis, administration or closely related work

Preferred Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Management Information Systems

Five or more years of professional, non-clerical experience in data management, business analysis and project management related to the operational and IT needs of a functional department

Thorough understanding of IT supported applications utilizing Banner

Preferred Licenses and Certifications:

Business analysis or project management certifications such as Agile or PMI

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Ability to identify and understand operational needs of the department

Ability with or knowledge of broadly used, specialized/specialty and enterprise applications

Knowledge of MS Office and Visio or comparable flow-charting program

Experience with database structures, data analysis, SQL, and database modeling tools

Must have high level of attention to detail, strong organizational and writing skills

Knowledge of SDLC

Must be able to work and communicate with a wide variety of people such as end users, executives, IT developers and various technical staff

Ability to multi-task and work cooperatively with others

Ability to effectively facilitate meetings

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of MS Office and Visio or comparable flow-charting program

Must have high level of attention to detail, strong organizational and writing skills

Knowledge of hosted software/database solutions, project management and SDLC

Knowledge of Oracle

Ability to write, edit, test, and analyze command programs in statistical software

Ability to work with various data storage systems

Responsibilities:

Coordination and Facilitation - Works collaboratively on the development and ongoing management of multiple enterprise level housing software solutions. Coordinates the analysis and documentation of Residence Life business practices, business processes and IT needs. Facilitates meetings, conducts interviews, and performs research. Captures business requirements for IT project requests and coordinates with Division IT and third party vendors to fulfill requests. Facilitates, with Division IT and third party vendors, any approved upgrades, reconfigurations and changes to the software solutions. Coordinates user acceptance testing as approved changes are made, new features are implemented, and vendors roll out major software version updates. Manages user access and user security permissions groups. Generates and stores reports on housing data in compliance with established reporting standards. Coordinates with Division IT and third party vendors to archive or delete data per University retention schedule.

Project Implementation - Coordinates with Division IT and third party vendors the implementation of projects related to installation, configuration, maintenance and updates to major systems and system processes including housing application, camp/conference application and registration, roommate selection, room assignments, billings, early move-in/late stays, incident reports, concerning student behavior reports, programming reports, etc. Develops and writes test cases for end users to test changes made by Division IT or third party vendors. Leads end user testing of system changes.

Project Analysis & Development - Analyzes requests coming in from executive staff, management staff and end users on a daily basis. Assigns priority to requests and assigns resources to meet needs outlined in the request. Converts requests into projects as needed. Completes initial project analysis and assessment. Develops small and large project proposals, timelines and budgets as needed for change to existing systems, purchase of off-the-shelf software solutions, or other. Develops use cases, wire frames, storyboards, process flows, and data maps. Collaborates with executive staff in the analysis of business needs and prioritization for larger and more complex projects. Works independently on requests and projects where executive approval is not needed.

Business Recommendations - Translates business/operational practices and processes into requirements that can be used to identify solutions. Consults with software vendors and benchmarks against other institutions of higher education regarding best practices in the use of the housing software solutions for business processes such as applications, assignments, billings, summer conferences, room configuration, keys management, incident reporting, customer communications, security permissions, etc. Coordinates with Division IT to investigate effective solutions to meet identified business needs. Provides reports with options and recommendations to executive staff, management staff and end users based upon research and current business practices.

Training & Support - Responds to ad-hoc user requests on a daily basis and creates work tickets for requests as needed. Creates end-user procedure documentation and provides training and support for end-users of major systems. Assists staff in the development of ad-hoc reports using third party software. Consults with Division IT and third party vendors regarding systems issues and assists in implementation of system solutions. Acts as a liaison between the Department of Residence Life and Division IT and third party vendors providing IT services to Residence Life. Serve on Committees as needed. Other duties as assigned.

Failure to provide all job application data or a complete resume could result in an invalid submission and a rejected application. We encourage all applicants to upload a resume or use a LinkedIn profile to pre-populate the online application.

All positions are security-sensitive. Applicants are subject to a criminal history investigation, and employment is contingent upon the institution’s verification of credentials and/or other information required by the institution’s procedures, including the completion of the criminal history check.

Job Description:
Description

Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Senior Business Data Analyst, Revenue Cycle to work remotely within our footprint states: AK, CA, MT, OR, TX and/or WA.

This position will be a contributor to the RCS Analytics Operations team which supports efforts of the Data & Insights team. The role (and team) supports the RCS Analytics team, leadership, and its stakeholders/customers. This position is seen as an accountable Business Analyst Sr for analytics-related activities. This role also supports various administrative and customer facing activities including, but not limited to intake/triage management, artifact management, policies & procedures, effort/time estimation, product training, Data Governance & Evangelism, inventory review with customers/leadership, resource onboarding, analytics ecosystem management, etc. The role may also serve in cross functional capacity on projects and initiatives.

Providence caregivers are not simply valued – they’re invaluable. Join our team at Revenue Cycle Business Services and thrive in our culture of patient-focused, whole-person care built on understanding, commitment, and mutual respect. Your voice matters here, because we know that to inspire and retain the best people, we must empower them.

Required qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree Computer science, mathematics, statistics, information technology, health informatics, public health, or related subject. -Or-
Bachelor's Degree Data Science, Analytics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Health Administration, Public Health, Public Administration, or related discipline
2 – 3 years Revenue Cycle Experience
5 years Strong SQL programming skills. Some combination of experience with: Snowflake, SQL Server, Oracle SQL or similar platforms.
5 years Progressive experience in practicing analytics as a data analyst, report analyst, business analyst, BI developer, etc.
2 year's Experience with two or more provider-based Revenue Cycle vert
3 years Proven experience creating, managing, and validating large data sets.
Demonstrated PC skills, i.e., proficient with MS Office products including Word, Excel, Teams, SharePoint, Power Point and Outlook

Preferred qualifications:

Master's Degree Computer science, mathematics, statistics, information technology, health informatics, public health, or related subject.
Experience with EPIC: reporting data out of Epic, reviewing Revenue Cycle related account detail.
Report writing skills in Tableau or Power BI

Why Join Providence?

Our best-in-class benefits are uniquely designed to support you and your family in staying well, growing professionally, and achieving financial security. We take care of you, so you can focus on delivering our Mission of caring for everyone, especially the most vulnerable in our communities.

About Providence

At Providence, our strength lies in Our Promise of “Know me, care for me, ease my way.” Working at our family of organizations means that regardless of your role, we’ll walk alongside you in your career, supporting you so you can support others. We provide best-in-class benefits and we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone is essential, heard and respected. Together, our 120,000 caregivers (all employees) serve in over 50 hospitals, over 1,000 clinics and a full range of health and social services across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. As a comprehensive health care organization, we are serving more people, advancing best practices and continuing our more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable.

The amounts listed are the base pay range; additional compensation may be available for this role, such as shift differentials, standby/on-call, overtime, premiums, extra shift incentives, or bonus opportunities.

About the Team

Providence Shared Services is a service line within Providence that provides a variety of functional and system support services for our family of organizations across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.

We are committed to the principle that every workforce member has the right to work in surroundings that are free from all forms of unlawful discrimination and harassment.

We are committed to cultural diversity and equal employment for all individuals. It is our policy to recruit, hire, promote, compensate, transfer, train, retain, terminate, and make all other employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), national origin (including certain language use restrictions), ancestry, disability (mental and physical including HIV and AIDS), medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, marital status, age, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, and military and veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status. We will also provide reasonable accommodation to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified caregiver or applicant for employment, unless the accommodation would impose undue hardship on the operation of our business.

We are a community where all people, regardless of differences, are welcome, secure, and valued. We value respect, appreciation, collaboration, diversity, and a shared commitment to serving our communities. We expect that all workforce members in our community will act in ways which reflect a commitment to and accountability for, racial and social justice and equality in the workplace. As such, we will maintain a workplace free of discrimination and harassment based on any applicable legally protected status. We also expect that all workforce members will maintain a positive workplace free from any unacceptable conduct which creates an intimidating, hostile, or offensive work environment.

Position Description

The Department of Finance at Harris County Precinct 4 is responsible for budgeting, accounting, and procurement operations. The Accounting Analyst (Operations) plays a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of procurement processes. This position reports directly to the Finance Operations Manager and is primarily responsible for processing journal entries, executing general budget transfers and collaborating with other divisions within Precinct 4 to allocate resources effectively and provide procurement assistance. Ensures timely updates with the Finance Operations Manager and makes recommendations for needed accounting changes. This position demands adept management of competing priorities when workflow or deadlines change.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The duties listed below are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed.

Resource Allocation Coordination:
Ensure proper allocation of consolidated costs within Precinct 4’s divisions as needed.
Prepare and submit necessary journal entries to the County Auditor for entry.
Propose new or corrected allocations of costs for review with Finance Operations Manager.
Procurement Assistance:
Collaborate with Precinct 4’s staff and County’s Purchasing Agent to facilitate financial aspects of procurement activities.
Workflow and Process Management:
Analyze workflow processes and assist with the development of new processes and procedures.
Reporting and Documentation:
Provide performance-reporting metrics, correspondence, and other documentation as required.
Assist in internal audit processes, including providing documentation and explanation for general cost allocations.
Continuous Learning and Compliance:
Stay up-to-date with relevant accounting and purchasing knowledge and industry best practices.
Ensure general accounting activities comply with County policies, accounting standards, and relevant regulations.
General Support:
Establish and maintain positive working relationships with Precinct 4 staff, other Harris County departments and vendors, to address inquiries, resolve issues and foster collaboration.
Provide support for other accounts payable, budget, and purchasing functions as needed.

Harris County is an Equal Opportunity Employer
https://hrrm.harriscountytx.gov/Pages/EqualEmploymentOpportunityPlan.aspx
If you need special services or accommodations, please call (713) 274-5445 or email ADACoordinator@bmd.hctx.net

This position is subject to a criminal history check. Only relevant convictions will be considered and, even when considered, may not automatically disqualify the candidate.

Requirements

Education
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Public Policy/Administration, or related field.
Experience
Minimum of two (2) years of professional administrative, financial, analytical, or consulting experience related to the type of work being performed.
An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job will be considered acceptable.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Strong analytical and financial reporting skills to process journal entries, budget transfers, and provide performance metrics and documentation
Effective interpersonal and collaborative skills for coordinating resource allocations, procurement assistance, and resolving issues collaboratively.
Exceptional project management and organizational skills.
Mastery of MS Office 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, TEAMS, SharePoint, etc.) and of software to manage portable document format files (Adobe Acrobat).
Initiative, effective problem-solving skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent oral and written communications skills, with the ability to communicate key takeaways to diverse, nontechnical audiences.
Maintain high level of integrity, confidentiality, ethical standards - assumes personal responsibility for scope of position.
Enjoys building and maintaining relationships with staff and has demonstrated ability to engage and convene diverse stakeholder groups.
Self-starter and independent but works collaboratively.
Values continuous learning and seeks ongoing training and development.

NOTE: Qualifying education, experience, knowledge, and skills must be documented on your job application. You may attach a resume to the application as supporting documentation but ONLY information stated on the application will be used for consideration. "See Resume" will not be accepted for qualifications.

Preferences

ERP systems experience

General Information

WHAT YOU WILL GET IN RETURN:
You will be surrounded by team members who also bring “heart, hustle, and higher standards” to work each day. These leaders advance opportunity and justice as they deliver services to and advocate for the residents of Harris County. The team you will be joining is innovative, dynamic, and forward-looking. You will be given opportunities to expand your knowledge and skills, develop policy expertise, and grow in your career.

Harris County employees receive a competitive salary plus medical, dental, and vision insurance at no cost to the employee after the first two months of full-time continued employment. Vacation, sick-time, and floating holidays allow our employees to recharge and balance work and personal time. Mandatory participation in our retirement program allows employees to save for retirement. Various other benefits and discounts lead to the satisfaction and engagement of our employees.


Employment may be contingent on passing a drug screen and meeting other standards.

Welcome to ECENTA.

We at ECENTA are not only searching for employees – we search for team members for our ECENTA family. We are seeking team players with a distinct sense of responsibility as well as a sense of community. We know that in strong company, we can achieve a great deal. With us you will find more than a job – we offer you a professional home with real perspectives.

We keep on growing and search for new team members to find their place with us. Join us as a SAP Commerce Business Analyst and bring fresh ideas, a lot of curiosity and ambition into the team.

What we do.

Working as a team, we analyze and develop solutions for our customers using SAP Customer Experience products to implement their business processes. SAP Commerce is key area of expertise at ECENTA. We have deep experience in B2B and B2B2C businesses and care deeply about the success of our customers. In other words: We love and succeed in project work. From specification and conceptualization, during implementation, up until the testing and go-live: we support our customers throughout the whole project cycle. We do not dread challenges. What is more: We think outside the box to find the right solutions when others only see problems.

What we offer.

A place to work which does not relate to any conventional office job – and a lot of variety. And it is not just an empty statement. As an SAP Commerce Business Analyst at ECENTA, you will have the opportunity to travel the world and meet our customers, engage with some of the largest companies in the world and work in many different industry segments. At the same time, you will profit from the security and employee benefits coming with a position in a medium-sized company.

And you?

You are graduate with a management degree in Information Systems, Marketing or related field. You would like to kick start your career in the exciting field of digital commerce. Demonstrate your proficiency to us and join ECENTA as a SAP Commerce Business Analyst!

Bachelors or master’s in management of Information Systems, Marketing, Commerce or related degree.
Nice to have 1-2 years of work experience in digital commerce as a business analyst or working on the business side of the world managing day to day operations in e-commerce.
Nice to have 1-2 years of experience in SAP Commerce or another commerce technology like Salesforce, Magento, etc.
You have completed project work at your school or at work that allowed you to develop business analysis skills and use of tools such as Visio, and Draw.io to express a customers business flow.
You have strong analytical and process-oriented thinking skills.
You have a hunger to learn new technologies and what it means to become a business analyst.
You are capable to running workshops (virtual and in person), and helping our customers derive the right set of user stories to meet their business requirements.
You have great attention to detail. It shows in your documentation as well as your testing of the solution.
You can work well in multi-cultural and virtual team set ups.
You are business fluent and have strong communication skills.
You are willing to take an active role. Self-initiative is what drives you to obtain information and learn new things. This makes you a co-creator of the ECENTA family.
You like staying on top of things and you have a natural organizational talent. You are not afraid of creating project plans, but rather look forward to it.
You embody team spirit and would like to be active around the globe.
Stagnation is a foreign concept to you. We will encourage and foster your ambition by providing you opportunities for further qualification and professional growth.

Interested? Then apply now and become a member of the ECENTA family!

Description:

Summary The Clinical Operations Analyst is responsible for researching, documenting, and analyzing multi-faceted data with statistical, financial, and clinical emphasis. Identifies data trends, develops programs to solve problems, and assists

in presenting and implementing recommendations and solutions. Is responsible for developing, coordinating,

implementing, and evaluating data collection and reviewing related to DSRIP reporting to HHSC and E-Clinical Works.

Applies information learned in order to best identify and implement process improvements. This position serves as the

E-Clinical Works Subject Matter Expert for the Clinic System.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Documents and recommends workflow changes and functional requirements, specifications, and design solutions needed to support the business requirements for common and moderately complex problems. Does this in coordination with the appropriate clinical program / clinical service, region / division, and designated approved end-user advisory group.
Acquires and maintains a moderate understanding of the functional architecture, security, and compliance requirements of assigned systems and integration.
Utilizes appropriate tools to meet ad hoc informational needs. Understands the data model and data use of assigned systems.
Participates with information systems in basic to moderately complex issues, incidents, problems according to agreed upon service levels and according to defined standards and processes. Collaboratively works with peers, information systems, internal and external stakeholders, and vendors.
Collaborates with key clinical and business stakeholders to determine business rules, needs, specifications, feasibility (workflow and cost), and priorities for application development / configuration / acquisition requests and projects with a basic to moderate level of complexity and according to organizational standards and processes. Consults with key business stakeholders, and collaborates with information systems on selection and acquisition of 3rd party solutions.
Collaborates with key stakeholder group(s) (e.g. Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Regions / Divisions, etc.) and key IS staff in the acquisition, configuration, development, testing, and implementation of solutions (vended and internally developed) with a moderate level of complexity.
Participates in the creation and management of project plans for projects with a basic to moderate level of complexity. Consistently meets agreed upon deadlines or escalates issues, concerns, and barriers to key project leaders. Assists in the prioritization of tasks / assignments.
Participates in the development and implementation of communication plans to stakeholder groups and manages customer and stakeholder expectations.
Requirements:

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or five years of related experience in the field.

Must be proficient in all Microsoft Office programs. Must possess strong research and analytical skills, and be able to problem-solve and identify system issues. Project Management experience a must. Must be able to demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

Manager, Product Management - Auto Finance

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.


As the Lead Analyst, Sales Operations, you will be responsible for leading channel segmentation and associated data analytics for the Less-than-Truckload (LTL) business unit. You will partner with senior sales leadership to analyze customer and market data, develop and manage customer profiling processes, and identify optimum leads for our business. You will drive efficiencies in our data management processes through automation. You will use data and algorithms to help the team develop territory structures and goaling for the sales force. We’ll count on your skills and years of experience to enhance our sales force effectiveness, drive loyal customers, and lead a team to deliver exceptional results.


Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.




What you’ll do on a typical day:

Lead annual channel and account segmentation processes including account profiling and prioritization
Maintain customer market data including vertical and industry classifications, transportation spend and XPO potential, and key criteria for external reporting
Provide governance for account classification/segmentation changes throughout the year
Develop data audit processes and dashboards to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Collaborate with extended Sales Operations team and Sales Leadership to guide territory design and goaling processes to ensure equality
Coordinate with extended Sales Operations and Sales Leadership to analyze business trends at segment level (e.g. vertical, geographic, freight profile, etc.)
Drive education and cleanliness of SalesForce.com data to improve overall pipeline management
Lead reviews of existing processes to identify and implement improvements through technology or process enhancements (automating daily/weekly reports through Alteryx, creating Salesforce and Looker Dashboards for scalability)

What you need to succeed at XPO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent related work or military experience
4 years of Sales Operations experience in a business-to-business environment

It’d be great if you also have:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain Management, or Marketing
Strong executive presence and proven ability to work cross-functionally leading through data
Salesforce Administrator Certification
Alteryx Designer Certification
Availability to travel 10-15% of the time

Industrial Equipment Sales, Compressor Technique - El Paso, TX

Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations.

Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.


Your Role


Product Sales – The Sales Representative prospects, sources, and maintains quality customers in assigned area. A requirement of this role is to achieve or exceed assigned sales goals by developing action plans and schedules to identify specific sales prospects, targets, and/or markets and to project number of contacts to be made. The Sales Representative manages, calls on, and sells products directly to customers in assigned area and will actively engage in planned prospecting activities geared at increasing the customer base. They will follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity and establish rapport through maintaining regular contact with existing and new customers (particularly key accounts). Responding promptly to customer inquiries, introducing new products and upgrades, studying customer needs and coordinating customer service are abilities the Sales Representative should have.




Additional duties of a Sales Representative include:

Preparing and presenting quotes, proposals, pricing, credit terms. Overseeing customer services through quality checks and follow-up; to help in identifying and resolving customer concerns.
Maintaining a professional image at all times through personal actions and initiatives. Enhancing division and Company reputation and brand image by consistently working to implement the Company’s core values of commitment, interaction, and innovation.
Obtaining, developing, preparing, delivering, and presenting sales materials, exhibits, and promotional programs when attending exhibits, conferences, meetings, and other local, regional, and national promotional opportunities.



Training & Development– The Sales Representative is expected to continuously update their job knowledge (for both products and sales/marketing strategies and skills) by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; networking; and participating in professional organizations.




Reporting – The Sales Representative, prepares reports as assigned relative to activity, lost orders, closings, follow-up, and performance against budget. These reports may also be on special developments, information, or feedback gathered through field activity, including recommendations for product, service, pricing changes and evaluation of competitive developments.




Perform other duties as assigned.





To succeed, you will need

Skills and experience




Four year degree in engineering, business or marketing preferred or equivalent work experience .
5+ years of direct sales experience or customer service experience, industrial equipment sales preferred.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint, Word and Excel.
Must be self-directed.
Must have excellent organizational, interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills.
Have proven business analysis skills.
Territory: El Paso, TX
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license.



In return, we offer you




Attractive benefits Include:




Excellent compensation package, including a flexible benefits plan, and generous 401 (k) retirement plan with company matching.
Health insurance / Dental insurance / Vision insurance / Life & Disability insurance, along with Maternity and Paternity Leave offered.
Tuition Reimbursement of costs associated with job-related courses/ undergraduate or graduate degree.
Paid time off, 3 weeks of vacation, 8 fixed holidays and up to 5 floating holidays.
Salary base is on knowledge, skills, and experience; range of $70K - $80K plus commissions, 3-6 month commission guarantee upon hire plus quarterly bonus program. Unlimited commissions.

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire


This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

What We Can Offer You:

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

Let's Stay Connected:

Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

About the Comptroller's Office
Innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence best describes the culture here at the Comptroller's Office. We take pride in the work we do serving as Texas' accountant, tax collector, treasurer, and much more!

Culture
Our agency workforce is as diverse as the people of Texas we serve. We value our employees and take very seriously our collective commitment to public service. Personal development opportunities are strongly encouraged through available workshops, teambuilding exercises, and on the job training. We offer flexible scheduling that helps employees maintain a healthy work-life balance.

If you are seeking to gain knowledge, build your career, and network among goal-oriented professionals, this is the place for you!

General description

An IT Business Analyst for The Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts IT Division is a professional who analyzes and evaluates the business needs and requirements of various IT applications and projects. They also design, develop, and implement IT solutions that align with the agency’s strategic goals and objectives.

This position is part of a team of people who are open-minded and collaborative, adaptable, dedicated to their craft and aren’t afraid to roll up their sleeves. You would be a great fit for this role if you are self-motivated, resourceful, can deliver results to spec and work well with a team.

Work Hours
8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, 40 hours. Occasionally, work non-standard work hours to include additional hours on evenings, weekends and holidays. Hours may change based on business need.

Teleworking may be considered if certain working conditions are met. The candidate must have permanent residency within the state of Texas and must be able to meet in office requirements, which can vary among different sections (i.e. report to office 1 day/month, 1day/week, etc.). Travel reimbursements are not provided for teleworking.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree.
Two (2) years of experience performing business analysis or product owner work.
Experience utilizing Business Analysis or Product Owner tools such as Atlassian Jira, MS Word, Excel, SharePoint and Visio.
Experience writing and documenting in an IT project environment.
Experience in Agile software development methodology

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer information systems or management information systems.
Experience in development and conducting training on new and existing systems
Experience utilizing project management applications such as MS Project, Atlassian Confluence
Experience utilizing productivity applications such as Service Now, WebEx, MS Teams
Experience with CPA Systems and Business Processes

Substitutions
One (1) additional year of related work experience may substitute for thirty semester hours of educational requirement with a maximum substitution of 120 semester hours (four years).

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS (Preferred)

PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)
Certified Agile Product Owner or Scrum Master

In this role you will:

Gathers user stories/requirements from customers for both new systems and enhancements to existing systems. Schedules, facilitates and documents information from meetings with customers. May help coordinate story/requirement efforts involving multiple Business Analysts or Product Owners and cross divisional communications.
Documents user and system stories/requirements using standard methodologies and communicates stories/requirements to technical employees for design and development of systems. May help coordinate the collaboration of stories/requirements documents produced by multiple Business Analysts or Product Owners. Reviews and monitors system design and development functionality.
Coordinates, analyzes, and resolves production system defects according to defined team processes and standards.
Develops and documents test cases and scenarios used to test new systems and enhancements to existing systems. Communicate requirements and test cases to the testing team(s) to ensure the thorough testing of all test cases and scenarios.
Conducts testing of both new systems and enhancements to existing systems to ensure the system is properly tested prior to moving to production.
Performs all other related duties as assigned.

The Comptroller's Office is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity.

Position Summary:
The Business Process Improvement Analyst will lead the development of process analytics, key performance indicators and business process management methodologies. This key position will act as primary lead and interface between various stakeholders from multiple business, project management, technology services, architecture, and data services teams. This person is expected to draw from their business background and analytical expertise to define, measure, analyze, improve, and develop control processes for change management and process improvement engagements across the broader organization.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Analyzes problems and designs process improvement solutions.
Selects, collects, and analyzes data to find root causes of performance issues.
Assesses process designs for gaps and other impediments by implementing improvement solutions.
Summarizes analysis to report on key improvement opportunities to use for future state solution design.
Works with compliance and legal teams to develop and update policies and procedures.
Creates process maps, SOPs, and other solutions design documentation.
Creates metrics to track benefits of improvement implementations.
Performs change management activities including developing and delivering training and communications to support transition of improvement project changes.
Maintains progress and provides visibility into project activities to complete deliverables on time.
Runs meetings with project teams to communicate deadlines and identify issues and risks.
Maintains and communicates project plan progress, issues, and risks.
Reports status and escalates issues to leadership.
This is not a work from home opportunity.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The qualified candidate must have:
A strong background in analysis, process life cycle methodologies, familiarity with process improvement techniques, project management, and strong facilitations skills are also preferred.
Experience with developing governance documentation (Policies & Procedures, Charters, Scope Documents, Project Plans, Issue Logs, Status Reports, Risk Management Plans etc.) is preferred.
Knowledge of loss mitigation, cashiering, bankruptcy and foreclosure, borrower contact strategies, and overall loan administration functions throughout the cycle of servicing of a loan is preferred.
Comfortable understanding new regulations and how best to apply to existing business processes.
Ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and consistently meet multiple deadlines.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Strong customer-service orientation.
Ability to use good judgment.

Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment. Manages competing demands. Changes approach or method to best fit the situation. Able to deal with frequent change delays, or unexpected events.

A.) or higher in business related field from an accredited four-year college or university preferred. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Computer Skills: Working knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook). Previous experience with MSP, Black Knight/LPS and Sagent preferred.

Job Description: Project Manager/Business Analyst in Master Data

Plano, TX

Job Summary: The Project Manager/Business Analyst in Master Data is a dynamic and multifaceted role responsible for overseeing and coordinating a range of projects in these critical areas. This role requires a combination of project management expertise and business analysis skills, as well as deep knowledge of master data management.

Key Responsibilities

· Project Planning: Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables. Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and budget considerations.

· Master Data Management: Oversee master data governance and quality improvement initiatives. Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and security of critical organizational data.

· Business Analysis: Conduct thorough business analysis to understand current processes, data requirements. Identify and document business requirements.

· Team Leadership: Manage project teams, providing clear direction, motivation, and guidance to team members. Foster a collaborative and results-driven work environment.

· Risk Management: Identify project risks and develop mitigation plans. Monitor and manage potential issues to ensure projects stay on track and within budget.

· Stakeholder Communication: Maintain open and effective communication with all project stakeholders, including executives, cross-functional teams, and external partners.

· F: Ensure appropriate allocation of resources, including human resources, technology, and budget, to achieve project objectives.

· Quality Assurance: Monitor project deliverables to ensure they meet the required quality standards and that project goals are met.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; a Master's degree is a plus.
PMP (Project Management Professional) or similar project management certification is preferred.
Proficiency in project management software and tools.

About Billd




Billd is a fast-growing fintech company looking to disrupt a $1.4 trillion dollar industry. We offer industry-leading financial and technology products to empower our customers. We believe in championing the underdog because no one else does. We’re equally committed to the motivated professionals that make up the Billd family. We are proud to have been recognized as Austin's fastest-growing private company by Austin Business Journal, and one of the best to work for by Built In. As a rapidly growing company, there are numerous opportunities for internal growth and career development.


You will be challenged to be your best self and guaranteed to have one of the most professionally rewarding experiences of your career. We encourage creativity, initiative, collaboration, playfulness, and a strong work-life balance.


This role will be located in our HQ in Austin, TX. Our office is spacious, centrally located, dog friendly and always stocked with snacks and cold brew on tap! We offer a hybrid work model, where Billders are able to work from home one day per week


The Role

We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join the product and technology team at Billd. This is a high impact role, as you will be instrumental in maintaining and advancing our internal platform, which serves as the backbone for all workflows, business processes, and CRM operations at Billd. In this role, the business analyst will drive alignment across our organization on work to be done and work directly with our engineering team to ensure quality delivery.


You will work closely with cross-functional teams to proactively identify and implement new features, capabilities, and integrations that optimize business processes and uphold high standards of data integrity. Your role will involve not only maintaining the platform but also developing comprehensive subject matter expertise and creating detailed documentation to facilitate a shared understanding of the functionalities.


As the product owner within our agile scrum team, you will lead and contribute to daily standups, sprint planning sessions, and requirements reviews. Taking charge of both business and technical requirements, you will be responsible for effectively communicating these requirements to developers and coordinating seamless testing and deployment.


As the forefront disruptor in the construction fintech industry, aiming to revolutionize a $1.4 trillion sector, we are searching for a candidate who embodies a true passion for fintech and possesses the drive to solve the financial challenges within the construction sector.


What You'll Do

Develop detailed requirements for new features and functionalities, ensuring they are clearly understood by relevant business and technical teams
Collaborate with stakeholders throughout the organization to accurately capture and manage business requirements
Define clear acceptance criteria for new releases, working closely with QA to ensure they are understood and properly incorporated into the testing process
Maintain an organized and up-to-date product backlog, ensuring that it is prioritized according to business objectives, product roadmap, and stakeholder expectations
Facilitate grooming sessions within the agile scrum team to ensure the engineering team has a clear understanding of the requirements prior to technical delivery
Identify roadblocks and bottlenecks, working closely with technical teams to address and resolve issues in a timely manner
Prioritize and triage incoming requests for new features, functionalities, and bug fixes based on impact, urgency and alignment with business goals, using a systematic approach
Serve as the primary point of contact for the delivery of new releases to the platform, ensuring all relevant stakeholders are informed, aligned and trained appropriately
Monitor the platform, identifying and resolving issues, bugs, and functional gaps that may impact business operations, with a well-defined plan for resolution when required
Ensure documentation is up to date in order to establish a common understanding of the platform’s functionality



Skills and Qualifications

Natural curiosity in fintech and revolutionizing the construction industry
An innovative mindset, always looking for a better way to do things
Careful attention to detail, while never losing sight of the big picture
Impeccable follow through. You do what you say and say what you do
Demonstrated ability to lead and influence small teams of engineers towards a common goal
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to clearly explain complex topics and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong sense of responsibility and project management; driving initiatives from inception to completion while managing stakeholder expectations
Experience managing internal platforms and operational systems
Experience with Salesforce a plus
Familiarity with agile and scrum methodologies a plus
3+ years of experience in a technology delivery role creating business and technical requirements



Billd is committed to diversity and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

(Junior) Digital Oil Field Consultant at IPCOS

About IPCOS and the Digital Oil Field unit

IPCOS is a digital solutions and services provider that maximizes the performance of its customers’ assets in the international energy and chemical industries. Our IPCOS experts tailor and implement state-of-the-art and technology-independent solutions enabling customers to increase plant operations efficiency. Having delivered more than 1000 projects in 50 locations in 30 countries, IPCOS delivers unique engineering-based, technology solutions combining domain knowledge with technology know-how. Headquartered in Leuven (Belgium) we employ over 80 experts in 7 locations worldwide.

Our Digital Oil Field (DOF) business unit provides consulting, technology integration and project delivery (on matters such as production surveillance, process optimization, production allocation, and forecasting solutions) to help improve our customers’ oil field performance and management.




Role & responsibilities

IPCOS Inc. (Houston) is recruiting a Digital Oil Field Consultant who will participate in major DOF projects with US customers and help expand our US DOF business.

As a Digital Oil Field Consultant, you deliver projects to IPCOS' upstream Oil & Gas customers. Your role involves designing, delivering, and supporting real-time systems that enhance production surveillance, optimize production, and improve allocation and forecasting.

In this role, you:

Combine petroleum engineering expertise with DOF solution architecture experience.
Perform business analysis to advise on tool selection, develop analytics, and design end-to-end digital oil field solutions.
Engage in DOF deployment, including data acquisition, model creation, workflow engineering, and visualization.
Build, configure, deploy, and integrate Digital Oilfield solutions, providing application support.
Collaborate with customer engineers to design and deploy engineering workflows.
Perform end-to-end testing and provide technical support.
Coach users on utilizing the Digital Oilfield solution.
Participate in proof of concepts and business proposals.



Profile

You have a Petroleum Engineering degree (minimum Bachelor’s) which you ideally combine with a strong affinity for IT engineering (data quality, data flows, ……..).
You have a solid understanding of basic petroleum engineering principles, especially related to production operations.
Ideally you have 1-5 years of relevant experience, but recent graduates are also encouraged to apply.
Familiarity and affinity with the following would be a major plus

o Concepts of Nodal Analysis and Flow Modelling software (e.g. PETEX Digital Oilfield applications such as IPM (PROSPER, MBAL/GAP), IFM, IVM)

o Data sources (e.g. OSI PI, Oracle, and SQL)

Ability to operate in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with excellent organizational skills.
Collaborating closely within a (global and virtual) team is something that attracts you, as well as having direct interactions with the customer.
You are ready to tackle a project hands-on, whilst at the same time showing energy, drive and an entrepreneurial attitude.
You have strong analytical ability and problem-solving skills.
You consider yourself to be a self-starter who doesn’t shy away from taking responsibility.
You currently already reside in the United States and are willing to relocate to Houston.



We offer:

We give our employees full trust in organizing their work day and in giving them ownership and independency in their job from day one.

Being a very international oriented and agile company, we offer a job with great variety and with lots of challenges in an intellectually stimulating environment.

IPCOS promotes communication within an informal, constructive, and no-nonsense culture.

We foster cooperation between colleagues, yet also provide room to work independently.

To top it all off, we offer a competitive remuneration package, including benefits and flexible working hours.

This position is offered on local terms and conditions. IPCOS will prioritize applicants who have a right to work and reside in the United States.
