KINDER MORGAN

Kinder Morgan is one of the largest energy infrastructure companies in North America. We own an interest in or operate approximately 83,000 miles of pipelines and 144 terminals. Our pipelines transport natural gas, gasoline, crude oil, carbon dioxide (CO2) and more. Our terminals store and handle renewable fuels, petroleum products, chemicals vegetable oils and other products.

We are a market leader in each of our businesses – Natural Gas Pipelines, Products Pipelines, CO2, and Terminals. We have an unparalleled, large footprint of diversified and strategically located assets that are core to North American energy infrastructure and help deliver needed energy products to high-demand markets.

BUSINESS UNIT: PRODUCT PIPELINES

Kinder Morgan is the largest independent transporter of petroleum products in North America, transporting approximately 2.4 million barrels per day. The great majority of these products are transported through our Products Pipelines business, which moves gasoline, jet fuel, diesel, natural gas liquids and condensate through about 9,500 miles of pipelines. We also have approximately 65 liquids terminals in this business segment that store fuels and offer blending services for ethanol and biofuels.


Primary purpose

Perform research and market analysis, and assist the commercial activities to identify opportunities and/or projects that will create and enhance the profitability of the assets base.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assess competitive threats and recommend strategies to mitigate commercial risks to company performance.
Analyze market trends for crude oil transportation including production trends by basin/area and potential outlets for production.
Assist in negotiation of commercial terms for revenue generating agreements.
Prepare term sheets, offer letters and LOI's.
Prepare management presentations and project justification documents.
Build, prepare and analyze economic models for evaluating various commercial deal structures
Develop and document annual plan/budget for revenues and volumes.
Develop and recommend tariff strategies for company pipelines.
Identify and develop capital expansion opportunities (define scope, coordinate preparation of cost estimates, prepare economic analysis).
Create, develop and maintain relationships with new and existing customers
Perform other duties as assigned
Position level will be dependent on the experience and job skills of successful candidate.

Position Requirements




Education

Bachelors Degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Engineering, Finance or Accounting or equivalent professional experience; MBA preferred

Experience / Specific Knowledge

Minimum two (2) years of related industry related experience


Competencies, Skills, and Abilities:

Must have well developed oral and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.


Proficiency level in MS Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.


Must be self-motivated; capable of performing tasks with minimal supervision.


Must be flexible and able to work effectively with a team, handle multiple priorities simultaneously, focus attention on details, and follow work rules.


Working Conditions:
Overtime required and extended work hours in cases of deadlines and/or emergencies.

Routinely required to work alone (unsupervised).


Up to 20% travel required, including day trips and overnight stays.


Majority of the work will be conducted from an office environment


Preferred Education, Experience, Certifications, Competencies, Skills, and Abilities:
Above the minimum requirements; not required but advantageous in this position:

Experience developing and marketing new business opportunities.


Ability to develop contractual framework for formal agreements to minimize legal time and expense.


General understanding of natural gas, NGL and crude oil production, natural gas processing operations, crude oil refining operations, petrochemical operations, and associated terminology within each industry.


Working knowledge of FERC pipeline regulations with respect to rate making methodology.


General understanding of pipeline operations including basic hydraulics and scheduling functions.


Experience in developing and monitoring budgets.


Advanced proficiency level in MS Office applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.


Ability to understand and analyze all aspects of a proposed commercial transaction (financial, contractual, legal, operational and marketing).

SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

SR. BUSINESS ANALYST (STARLINK ENTERPRISE)

Starlink, our revolutionary satellite constellation, will deliver low-latency broadband internet worldwide. The Starlink Enterprise Account Management team serves as the point of contact for Starlink's growing base of enterprise customers from contract signature, through successful activation, ensuring all contract terms are fulfilled. This role will be responsible for analyzing data about Starlink enterprise customers and translating it into reporting, recommendations, and tooling to improve both our customers' experience and internal Starlink operations. Our ideal candidate has self-starter that has a passion for building analytics from scratch, prototyping tools, and working cross-functionality to simplify systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct analyses (SQL queries, other methods) that identify issues and opportunities impacting our customers, including actionable recommendations that quantifiably change outcomes
Define and develop department-level metrics and associated dashboards that quantify the health of our customer accounts and influence change
Integrate with all levels of the business to understand current workflows and identify systematic gaps
Develop automation that accelerate revenue, mitigates business risk or creates efficiencies within Starlink Business Operations and across teams
Own data integrity, tool maintenance, and reporting quality
Train internal users, external technical teams, and leaders on dashboard, API, and tool usage; assist in troubleshooting
Improve data capture for future Account Management use cases, identifying front-end requirements and collaborating with software development teams on table structure
Support new market launch, continuous improvement, and cross-functional strategic initiatives

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree
5+ years of professional experience in reporting and analytics within customer operations, manufacturing, quality, human resources, purchasing, operations, cost accounting, supply chain management, or consulting
3+ years of professional experience building required datasets to create and manage dashboards using data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
3+ years of professional experience in at least one analytics language (e.g. Python, R)
1+ years of experience leading projects

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain, management information systems, computer science, engineering, or economics discipline
Advanced SQL proficiency (i.e. advanced joins, views/table distinctions, and basic query optimizations)
Advanced understanding of database structures, query optimizations, ETL development
Experience automating analytics tasks (i.e. intermediate coding skills (VBA, Python, C#, etc.)
Start-up, consulting, or other demonstrated experience in high-growth, fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Strong project management and self-directed prioritization skills
Exceptional ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences at all organizational levels
Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships across disciplines and with multiple levels of management
Experience working with customer operations teams and tools (e.g. ticketing, account management, communications tools)

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be willing to work long hours and weekends as needed

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

Pay Range:

Sr. Business Analyst: $110,000.00 - $145,000.00/per year

Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.

Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short & long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation & will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.

Job Title: IT AND DIGITAL PRODUCT OWNER III
Job Description:
It’s about creating and championing big ideas.

Are you the kind of person that can take a big idea and bring it to life? Do you enjoy leading others to accomplish real change? Are you ready to utilize your inquisitive mindset to truly build something new? If so, then the IT and Digital Product Owner III position might be for you.

At Frost, it’s about more than a job. It’s about having a flourishing career where you can thrive, both in and out of work. At Frost, we’re committed to fostering an environment that reflects our values and encourages team members to be the best they can be. In joining our adaptable, integrity-driven team, you’ll become part of Frost’s over 150-year legacy of providing unparalleled banking services.

Who you are:

As an IT and Digital Product Owner III, you are our user experience champion. In this role, you’ll provide technical and functional input to design, maintain, build, integrate, and test complex software components. You will use your innovative mindset, effective communication skills and desire to do better by constantly creating and improving the Frost user experience. You are not afraid to ask the question why and thrive in a collaborative environment. You believe in servant leadership and will work with development teams to optimize workflow and deliver top-quality products on time.

What you’ll do:

Lead product ownership team in executing complex roadmaps, interpreting requirements, and writing user stories to guide development within applications
Coordinate with the development team to define and iterate the product based on the strategy
Ensure development team workflow is optimized so that product is delivered in a timely manner
Resolve and prevent against future issues in the development process to ensure requirements are met
Partner with product manager by socializing solutions and seeking feedback to help meet deliverables
Provide guidance and leadership to other Product Owners across the enterprise
Always take action using Integrity, Caring, and Excellence to achieve all-win outcomes

What you’ll need:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, a related field, or equivalent work experience
4+ years of experience in product ownership or product management
4+ years of experience with Agile methodologies including Scrum and Kanban in a digital space
Experience in product ownership, product management, customer experience management, business analysis, software engineering or a related field
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage competing priorities
Relevant experience in banking, finance, or in a related product area
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft computer applications

Additional Preferred Skills:

Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or in a related field

Our Benefits:

At Frost, we care about your health, your family, and your future and strive to have our benefits reflect that. This includes:

Medical, dental, vision, long-term, and life insurance
401(k) matching
Generous holiday and paid time off schedule
Tuition reimbursement
Extensive health and wellness programs, including our Employee Assistance Program
Referral bonus program + more!

Since 1868, Frost has dedicated their expertise to provide exceptional banking, investment, and insurance services to businesses and individuals throughout Texas. Frost is one of the 50 largest U.S. banks by asset size and is a leader in banking customer satisfaction. At Frost, it’s about being part of something bigger. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply and see what’s possible at Frost.

The ideal candidate is a proven change agent that demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems through logical, digestible solutions that deliver key value to our stakeholders. Additionally, this individual must be comfortable communicating to all levels of the organization as well as inside and outside the organization. Job Title: Director Analyst, Integrated Business Planning, S&OP (Remote US)
Job Description:
Description

Director Analyst, Integrated Business Planning, S&OP

Who we are:

Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries.

About this role:

Gartner is seeking a Supply Chain Planning Analyst to drive new thought-leading research around improving supply chain planning processes, organization, and metrics to solve our client’s business challenges. This research will be mainly targeted to Supply Chain Planning Leaders in different industries globally.

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. An analyst possesses a keen eye for identifying gaps, problems, and solutions within the market they serve. They use their knowledge to help clients make better decisions, solve complex issues, and execute new practices that propel clients’ businesses toward key objectives. An analyst publishes these insights as pragmatic and/or provocative research. Additionally, they reinforce Gartner’s value every day by engaging clients via in-person and virtual meetings, sales support visits, Gartner conferences and industry events.

As an industry thought leader in supply chain planning, you will build insights and advise senior supply chain planning leaders on leading trends and best practices in the field around product portfolio planning, demand planning, supply and inventory planning, S&OP and S&OE processes to clients from different industries, different size of organization and with different levels of maturity.



What you’ll do:

Support client’s mission critical priorities of supply chain planning leaders on the following processes: Product portfolio planning, Demand Planning, Supply and Inventory Planning, S&OP and S&OE. This includes supporting our clients to evolve and mature their processes, building the right organization and talent as well as improving their planning technology roadmap.

You will research markets, practices and trends and produce written research for Gartner clients to download and apply. You will collaborate with peers and become a published author on Gartner.com showcasing your own thought-leading research, growing your knowledge and your brand as a Gartner Analyst.

You will meet with clients every day, via video conference and eventually onsite, given client demand. As an analyst, you will engage with clients to support their most challenging business initiatives, ultimately helping them to make the right decisions for their role and their business.

Advise Senior Supply Chain planning leaders across all subsectors of manufacturing – including, but not limited to, CPG, apparel and footwear, high tech, industrial, chemical and process, automotive and A&D – on leading practices in supply chain planning.

Lead process and capability assessments to help supply chain planning leaders align current performance with desired strategy.

Partner with other domain experts to develop industry-leading views on the alignment of other functions (technology, sourcing, logistics, manufacturing, quality) with supply chain planning.

Produce innovative, thought-leading, impactful, analytically deep, fact-based research.

Prepare and deliver high-value presentations and other materials.

Support the Gartner sales team in driving new business through proof of capability discussions.

Drive client demand for your advice and insight

Lead or participate in research community meetings to discuss research issues and collaborate effectively with peers.



What you’ll need:

10+ years of experience in supply chain planning, with at least 5 years as a in supply chain planning leader in roles such as S&OP leader, IBP leader, SC Planning transformation leader, or Global SC Planning process owner.

Experience in managing supply chain planning for manufacturers across multiple industries; familiarity with both process and discrete operations preferred.

Genuine approach to help clients improve their status quo. Ability to paint the future and guide them to deliver on their progress.

Possess excellent communication skills both verbal and written; preferably have had the experience of ‘main stage’ speaking.

Demonstrate strong analytical skills, applying conceptual models, recognizing patterns, and drawing conclusions.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience, Master's degree preferred.

Limited (<20 days/year) domestic and international travel as needed.



Who you are:

Collaborative: experienced providing service to clients and collaborating with global colleagues

Organized - skilled at multitasking, prioritizing, and working under tight deadlines and high volume and able to work remotely.

Confident – able to make sound decisions on projects with minimum supervision.

Analytically savvy – have strong critical thinking and analytical capabilities.

Leadership and Influence. Persuades, encourages, or gains the support of others and causes them to act.

Ownership & Impact. Accepts personal accountability, takes ownership, and perseveres. Embrace feedback.

#LI-Remote

#LI-JP4

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner

What we offer:

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.

Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 130,000 USD - 165,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.



The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

The Sr. SAP FICO Business Analyst is responsible for defining detailed requirements, analyzing business needs, and validating SAP solutions with appropriate business stakeholders.

Rush Enterprises, Inc. opens the door to the world of opportunity. We are a part of the largest network of commercial vehicle dealerships in North America representing truck and trailer manufacturers. Our franchises include Peterbilt, International, Hino, Isuzu, Ford, IC Bus and Blue Bird. We offer a rewarding career as a leader in the transportation industry. Grow with us as we continue to expand our network of locations and services.
Responsibilities:
Provide guidance and leadership to associate analysts in processes analysis, configuration and implementation methodologies within a particular functional area.
Evaluate development projects.
Assist in tailoring the development process to meet the project needs.
Work within IT project teams and be responsible for eliciting requirements from stakeholders, analyze the requirements, document them in User Story or Business Requirements Document and Acceptance Criteria Format.
Work closely with technical staff to ensure requirements are understood and delivered to the business.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, tasks and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and requirements.
Utilize experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required.
May lead and direct the work of associate analysts.

Welcome to ECENTA.

We at ECENTA are not only searching for employees – we search for team members for our ECENTA family. We are seeking team players with a distinct sense of responsibility as well as a sense of community. We know that in strong company, we can achieve a great deal. With us you will find more than a job – we offer you a professional home with real perspectives.

We keep on growing and search for new team members to find their place with us. Join us as a Senior SAP Commerce Business Analyst and bring fresh ideas, a lot of curiosity and ambition into the team.

What we do.

Working as a team, we analyze and develop solutions for our customers using SAP Customer Experience products to implement their business processes. SAP Commerce is key area of expertise at ECENTA. We have deep experience in B2B and B2B2C businesses and care deeply about the success of our customers. In other words: We love and succeed in project work. From specification and conceptualization, during implementation, up until the testing and go-live: we support our customers throughout the whole project cycle. We do not dread challenges. What is more: We think outside the box to find the right solutions when others only see problems.

What we offer.

A place to work which does not relate to any conventional office job – and a lot of variety. And it is not just an empty statement. As an SAP Commerce Business Analyst at ECENTA, you will have the opportunity to travel the world and meet our customers, engage with some of the largest companies in the world and work in many different industry segments. At the same time, you will profit from the security and employee benefits coming with a position in a medium-sized company.

And you?

During the past few years, you have already gained experience in SAP Commerce as a Business Analyst. Now you want to expand your expertise and take on new challenges. Demonstrate your proficiency to us and join ECENTA as a Senior SAP Commerce Business Analyst!

At least 3-4 years of experience as a business analyst in SAP Commerce (on-premise or cloud)
You have strong analytical and process-oriented thinking skills.
You are proficient at developing deep and meaningful user stories.
You are proficient running workshops (virtual and in person), demonstrating SAP Commerce capabilities and helping customers derive the right set of user stories to meet their business requirements.
You have great attention to detail. It shows in your documentation as well as your testing of the solution.
You can work well in multi-cultural and virtual team set ups.
You are business fluent and have strong communication skills.
You are willing to take an active role. Self-initiative is what drives you to obtain information and learn new things. This makes you a co-creator of the ECENTA family.
You like staying on top of things and you have a natural organizational talent. You are not afraid of creating project plans, but rather look forward to it.
You embody team spirit and would like to be active around the globe.
Stagnation is a foreign concept to you. We will encourage and foster your ambition by providing you opportunities for further qualification and professional growth.

Interested? Then apply now and become a member of the ECENTA family!

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Summary:

As a Senior Analyst, Data Governance Operations you will play a pivotal role in driving our data governance initiatives forward. Leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will lead meaningful conversations, host trainings, and foster relationships with various teams across the organization. This role offers the chance to work closely with a diverse set of stakeholders, influencing the way data is viewed, managed, and leveraged across the organization. If you're passionate about data and its potential to drive business success, this could be the perfect role for you.

Responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders across different functions to understand and address data-related needs and challenges.
Serve as a key point of contact for data stewards and owners across different domains, assisting with onboarding, addressing queries, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed to effectively manage their domains.
Develop and nurture relationships with various teams, positioning the data governance unit as a reliable partner in all data matters.
Assist in the development and updating of training content and materials; host and facilitate training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding and implementation of data governance practices.
Support ongoing data governance projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with the company's strategic goals.
Assist in maintaining governance documentation, ensuring all processes, policies, and standards are up-to-date and easily accessible for internal teams.
Address data governance related issues, escalating where necessary and ensuring timely resolution.
Support the collection and reporting of data governance metrics, helping to showcase the progress and impact of governance initiatives.

Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Systems, Business Administration) or equivalent experience.


Required qualifications:
Minimum one year of experience supporting data governance operations, data policy, data management, or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to facilitate meetings and training sessions effectively.
Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

$70,000.00 - $140,000.00

This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

Job Title

Job Description

The Brink’s Company (NYSE:BCO) is a leading global provider of cash and valuables management, digital retail solutions, and ATM managed services. Our customers include financial institutions, retailers, government agencies, mints, jewelers and other commercial operations. Our network of operations in 52 countries serves customers in more than 100 countries.

At Brink’s we believe that diverse teams drive success, and as such we foster an inclusive culture that values people with diverse backgrounds, ideas and perspectives. We build a sense of belonging so all employees feel respected, safe and valued, and we provide equal opportunity to participate and grow.

We are currently looking for a IT Business Systems Solutions Manager.

The IT Business Systems Solutions Manager is responsible for planning and managing business development processes and implementing IT business solutions, including post implementation support, technology enhancements required to support Brink’s Capital strategic priorities. This role will be assigned with managing business relationships, translating the business needs into the technical requirements, and ensure the development, testing and implementation comply with the methodologies and policies set by Brink’s Global Technology Shared Services, including IT Security and Risk & Compliance.

Major Responsibilities:

Manage end-to-end business solution delivery projects, including work breakdown structure, project planning, implementation, and communication.

Serve as the primary point of IT contact and collaborate closely with US counterparts, Brink’s Capital business to understand needs and requirements to existing and modern technology platforms. Provide guidance and recommendations.

Execute tasks as required to support the delivery of projects and initiatives, ensuring deliverables align with priorities.

Maintain, support, and upgrade existing business systems and applications. Identify and propose opportunities for improvement, to minimize risk and maximize operational efficiencies, and align with Brink’s Capital strategic priorities. Ensure Management is informed of material changes to scope and/or design that would impact the timeline and resource requirements.

Oversee compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., SOX) and identify areas for improvement

Actively participate in lean and process improvement activities, driving efficiency and effectiveness in our operations.

Architect innovative solutions and challenge existing processes to identify opportunities for improvement.

Manage technical engagement with external partners, as required, collaborating to produce designs that meet the Global and country business and technology requirements.

Maintain a detailed understanding of industry standards and technology platforms, identifying areas for personal development, to maximize potential and expand in the role and career within Brink’s. Foster strategic thinking within the team and contribute to the creation of long-term plans and goals.

Frequent travel

Minimum work experience requirements:

10-15 years of direct experience implementing and supporting enterprise level systems

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, etc.)

Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

Application Delivery Process-Knowledge of major tasks, deliverables, formal methodologies, and disciplines for delivering new or enhanced applications.

Ability to clearly gather client requirements and manage expectations.

Budgeting-Knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget.

Relationship Management-Ability to establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with clients, vendors, and peers.

Ability to communicate complex information in an easy-to-understand way.

Demonstrates initiative, independence, and accountability.

Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and mathematical skills.

Dedication to detail and must have process improvement skill set.

Excellent organizational and time management skills

Desired work experience:

15+ years (Audit both Public & Private Industry)

Master's degree

Previous Banking/Financial Industry experience

Preferably Big Four or Consulting experience

Technical or Specialized Skills Required:

Proven experience in IT leadership and project management, preferably in a collaborative and interdependent environment.

Strong understanding of architecting solutions and evaluating existing systems for potential improvements.

Strategic mindset and the ability to contribute to the development of long-term plans.

Hands-on approach and the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks.

Exceptional written and oral communication skills and able to effectively interact with all staff levels and executive management using suitable interpersonal styles and techniques.

Ability to absorb and impact information and work within standard operating procedures.

Able to apply analytical / critical thinking and business acumen; understand broader business environment.

Business analysis skills and the ability to comprehend complex business processes.

Familiarity with compliance regulations (e.g., SOX) and the ability to oversee compliance efforts.

Job Title: Analyst II, IT Field Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Analyst II, IT Field Operations

Buckeye is the premier infrastructure and logistics provider for the world’s energy needs, both today and tomorrow. Since 1886, we have successfully navigated transitions in the way energy has been distributed to continually meet the needs of an evolving market and industry environment. Our people are a critical element to the success and longevity of our operational history and our future as we seek to thrive through the energy transition.

We own and operate a diversified global network of integrated assets providing midstream logistic solutions, primarily consisting of the transportation, storage, processing, and marketing of liquid petroleum products. We are committed to safely and responsibly providing world-class service to meet the continually evolving energy needs of our customers and the communities we serve. As part of this commitment to our customers, we are continually diversifying our platform and service offerings to enable less carbon intensive energy solutions, and undertaking decarbonization efforts on our operations.




Buckeye Partners is currently seeking an IT Field Operations Analyst II with experience in software application support and troubleshooting in the Oil & Gas Industry to join our growing team!




Role Summary:

The IT Field Operations Analyst II role performs, or monitors activities and projects related to the operation, integration, implementation, upgrade, and/or enhancements to Buckeye’s IT Field Operations Applications.




Responsibilities & Essential Functions include:

Application Program Management Support. Support issue resolution with the production environment and end users through investigation, analysis, and training end users on how to properly utilize the system.
Responsible for assigned IT Field Operations Application Programs.
Document end user requirements related to new application request.
Engage vendor(s) to develop and maintain operations
Work with vendor(s) to develop and maintain operations applications.
Lead as IT program manager for the applications you support.
Investigate reported application issues.
Provide operations with recent upgrades and work closely with supervision to guarantee proper and realistic site representations.
Internal Support. Recommend to the IT department lifecycle management of assigned and dependent applications.
Vendor Liaison. Work with application support vendor to lead issue resolution including any tracking progress of issue resolution.
Internal Applications Administrator. Coordinate department administrators to ensure proper administration and setup of assigned applications, administering systems interfaces between dashboard services, and coordinating the administration of security. Coordinate with and communicate to IT peers, IT management, Operations staff, and Operations management as needed.
Process Improvements. Based on knowledge and experience, continuously identify potential opportunities to increase efficiencies and/or improvements to existing processes. Identify gaps in the current business model and propose processes that will help move the business forward.
Project Execution. Identify various projects related to Buckeye’s application systems.
System Maintenance. Perform and manage the maintenance of the supported data and databases.
Documentation. Support providing documentation for all supported applications and ensuring documentation is current. Documentation may include IT PMO, Disaster Recovery, Interconnection, etc.
Testing. Test application upgrades prior to releasing to the Buckeye Business and providing recommendations for application system application upgrades and enhancements.
On-Call Support. Provide on-call support during non-business hours to Operations on an as needed basis.
Customer Service. Providing exceptional customer service.
And other duties as assigned.



Position Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technologies or related discipline OR equivalent experience required.
7+ years related experience in software application support and troubleshooting is preferred.
Basic knowledge of pipeline and truck terminal terminology and operations is a significant plus.
Microsoft Excel VBA programming experience preferred.
Microsoft SQL experience is preferred.
Basic knowledge of pipeline and truck terminal terminology and operations is required to be obtain in short order.
Linux OS experience is preferred.
Ability to travel up to 25% both domestically and internationally.



Certificates & Licenses:

None required



Other Skills, Attributes and Abilities:

This position requires good analytical skills to resolve technical and business issues.
Persons in this position are asked to respond to system issues immediately and requires someone who has the ability to meet stringent deadlines and the ability to work well under pressure.
The individual must be able to work in a team-oriented environment and interact on numerous concepts at various levels of the end-user community.
This position requires good oral and written communication skills.



Essential Functions:

This position requires the ability to safely and successfully perform essential job functions consistent with ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and or/quantitative productivity standards.
This role requires the ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
This position requires compliance with all personnel policies.



Physical & Safety Requirements:

The person in this position needs to occasionally move inside the office to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc.
This role continuously operates a computer and other office productivity equipment (i.e. a calculator, copy machine and computer printer).



About You:

To be successful in the Buckeye culture, our employees must possess a demonstrated commitment to environmental responsibility and regulatory compliance. Excellent communication, both written and verbal, as well as strong organizational skills are paramount. You must work independently and be able to exercise tact, discretion, and professionalism when dealing with internal and external customers, and when handling sensitive and confidential information.

Buckeye wants to create and reward an organizational focus that stimulates the creative and entrepreneurial actions of its employees that result in innovative ways of reducing costs, generating revenues, improving productivity, or improving processes.




About Us:

People First Culture:

From managing over 5,000 miles of pipeline to commercializing clean energy projects, our people collaborate to provide world-class service and meet the changing energy needs of our customers. Our employee-first culture means that we invest in our employees and equip them to be fully contributing members of high performing teams. We are focused on collaboration, inclusion, empowerment, accountability, and professional development. We want the best in you to bring out the best in us.

Join us as we work together to build a business that is responsive to the needs of the future while continuing to serve the energy needs of communities today.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP on the following website:

All employment offers are contingent upon the successful completion of these pre-employment processes.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Industrial Equipment Sales, Compressor Technique - El Paso, TX
Functional area: Sales
Country: United States
City: El Paso
Company name: Atlas Copco Compressors LLC
Date of posting: Nov 12, 2023


Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations.

Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.


Your Role


Product Sales – The Sales Representative prospects, sources, and maintains quality customers in assigned area. A requirement of this role is to achieve or exceed assigned sales goals by developing action plans and schedules to identify specific sales prospects, targets, and/or markets and to project number of contacts to be made. The Sales Representative manages, calls on, and sells products directly to customers in assigned area and will actively engage in planned prospecting activities geared at increasing the customer base. They will follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity and establish rapport through maintaining regular contact with existing and new customers (particularly key accounts). Responding promptly to customer inquiries, introducing new products and upgrades, studying customer needs and coordinating customer service are abilities the Sales Representative should have.




Additional duties of a Sales Representative include:

Preparing and presenting quotes, proposals, pricing, credit terms. Overseeing customer services through quality checks and follow-up; to help in identifying and resolving customer concerns.
Maintaining a professional image at all times through personal actions and initiatives. Enhancing division and Company reputation and brand image by consistently working to implement the Company’s core values of commitment, interaction, and innovation.
Obtaining, developing, preparing, delivering, and presenting sales materials, exhibits, and promotional programs when attending exhibits, conferences, meetings, and other local, regional, and national promotional opportunities.



Training & Development– The Sales Representative is expected to continuously update their job knowledge (for both products and sales/marketing strategies and skills) by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; networking; and participating in professional organizations.




Reporting – The Sales Representative, prepares reports as assigned relative to activity, lost orders, closings, follow-up, and performance against budget. These reports may also be on special developments, information, or feedback gathered through field activity, including recommendations for product, service, pricing changes and evaluation of competitive developments.




Perform other duties as assigned.





To succeed, you will need

Skills and experience




Four year degree in engineering, business or marketing preferred or equivalent work experience .
5+ years of direct sales experience or customer service experience, industrial equipment sales preferred.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint, Word and Excel.
Must be self-directed.
Must have excellent organizational, interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills.
Have proven business analysis skills.

The Operational Risk Officer is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.


Responsibilities:

Establishes and oversees the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and governance processes to create lasting solutions for minimizing losses from failed internal processes, inadequate controls, and emerging risks.
Independently assess’ risks and drive actions to address the root causes that persistently lead to operational risk losses by challenging both historical and proposed practices
Define and manage Operational Risk Management Products, liaise with stakeholders and technology partners
Responsible for oversight and execution of critical ORM Initiatives as a Program/Project manager, with required SME input
Define and manage Operational Risk Data Strategy including but not limited to performing data analysis to derive insights that can be used for effective identification and management of Operational Risk
Develop and maintain strong relationships with senior stakeholders across multiple organizations (internal and external)
Define Scope, Strategy and Success criteria for Operational Risk Transformation Programs
Identify risks, issues and critical interdependencies across programs/initiatives
Define requirements and manage Book of Work execution for Operational Risk Applications in the capacity of Product Owner
Manage adherence with all Citi Internal Processes including but not limited to creating and managing documentation that can evidence adherence
Provide Execution and Oversight support for Transformation Programs including effective Independent Challenge
Manage all program/project execution artifacts required for Business Completion and IA Validation of regulatory milestones and deliverables
Governance and oversight may include (not limited to) technology operational risk, risk for example.
Execution ownership of ORM assigned Consent Order RBCM (Regulatory Business Milestones)
Ownership, Execution, Delivery or ORM owned Programs/ Projects
Resolves transactional level escalations coming from the vendor or internal partners
Analyzes a multitude of scorecards/performance management tools in an attempt to mitigate exposure (risk/financial/regulatory)
Monitors goals are met through performance, risk and relationship oversight of our extended supply chain
Collaborates to resolve any issues which fall within the terms of the contract.
Develops and maintains relationships across the business users and Lines of Defense to better understand and deliver customer requirements by responding to changes in the internal and external business environment
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (Full Time) - Sugar Land or Dallas
Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Will work with the Business Intelligence team focused on providing solutions to complex business problems through the configuration, integration, testing and support of our software applications. This role requires project management experience and a strong technical background. This Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. It requires a blend of analytical skills as well as extensive user interaction and great interpersonal skills.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology
Translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the BI team and manages changes to such specifications
Update, implement and maintain procedures
Perform some User Acceptance Testing
Assist in the definition of project scope and success criteria
Prepares business cases including cost/benefit analysis for proposed processes
Develops reports and documents for existing business processes and business rules
Adheres to IT policies and procedures and industry accepted practice
Conducts post implementation review and document goal attainment

QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Certification: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information systems or equivalent. Project management certification a plus.

Required Knowledge

Experience in business analysis in an Agile environment.
Experience with agile work organizations tools (Azure DevOps, Basecamp).
Have a solid understanding of software development life cycles.
Strong technical background allowing to provide credible leadership to the BI
team and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues.
A solid understanding of how APIs and databases function at a high level.
Experience creating functional requirements and use cases.
Experience implementing technology applications.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills are essential.

Experience Required

7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
3+ years managing and/or leading IT project implementations
3-5 years of experience in financial/banking industry a plus

Skills/Abilities

Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and can establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and other departments/agencies.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Excellent documentation skills.
Must be willing to work after-hours
Must work well in a team environment
Must be able to interface with users and vendors
Must have sense of urgency and ownership to support financial applications, with architectural and system component knowledge preferred
Proficiency in interpersonal communication, presentation, problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with attention to detail and accuracy.
Must be a self-starter that is driven to understand and complete tasks within the guidelines and timeframes assigned.

Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
40 hours per week

• Initiative Health care domain – Retail Insurance, Supplemental Insurance, Claims process, Medicare, Enrolment

6 + years’ experience working in agile environment.
6+ years’ experience working with SQL, COBOL, REST API, JAVA, .NET and Microsoft excess. (must be able to understand code)
6+ years’ experience working with REST API
7 + years’ Experience in creating Requirements in terms of user stories, and support Sprint activities.
Must have experience for agile Central.
Must have experience with Confluence
Must have excellent Communication skills (oral and written)
• Must have excellent understanding of healthcare claim management and policy management & Enrollment.

Job Title: The BOSC (Business Operations and Supply Chain) Plant Finance Senior Enterprise Analyst
Job Description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.
Job Purpose and Impact

The BOSC (Business Operations and Supply Chain) Plant Finance Senior Enterprise Analyst is responsible for delivering financial analysis input into business cases, costs, and schedules to support growth in the business. In this role, you will contribute to the continuous process improvement on management reporting, report standardization and rationalization and you will develop and implement action plans on business performance optimization. Key Accountabilities

Design and deliver effective financial and management reporting, including defining relevant business performance indicator and frequency, as well as standardizing and optimizing management reporting across the country.
Contribute and implement continuous process improvement, including simplifying and optimizing process, improving data integrity, and leveraging current technology.
Conduct initial analysis and interpret the results to the business.
Collaborate on corporate budgeting process, including expenses controlling, budgeting, forecasting and management reporting.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned. Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Advanced data analytical skills for using spreadsheets or business intelligence tools.
Experienced leveraging financial and business systems to monitor business activities and aid in decision making.
Experienced working with multiple businesses experience.

Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree
Experience using accounting technology applications.
Professional experience working in a plant environment.
SAP experience

Overview:
Veritex Community Bank is looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst to partner with PMO and Veritex business partners across Commercial & Consumer Lending, Credit Cards, Special Assets, Credit, and Treasury. The Business/Systems Analyst will serve as a liaison between Veritex team members, Technology, and 3rd party vendors as they implement process improvements and operational efficiencies across the bank.

In this role, the Business/Systems Analyst will be asked to analyze data and processes, problem solve, document project related information (project charter, business requirements, process workflows, test cases, etc.). Project related responsibilities include but are not limited to discovery, issue tracking, change management, testing, and additional needs as they arise in support of project efforts.


To succeed in this role, applicants should be a strong team player, have excellent time management, and communication skills. Although there will be independent work, this role focuses on collaboration with internal and external partners to deliver results on deadlines. The Business/Systems Analyst will support projects from concept to delivery and post-implementation.
Responsibilities:
Transform business requests into actionable deliverables (project charter, business requirements, process maps, costs/benefits, etc.)
Conduct stakeholder interviews and requirement sessions to capture and refine business requirements and targeted analysis.
Plan, schedule and facilitate meetings with business owners & SMEs
Record & distribute detailed meeting minutes
Track and monitor risks, issues, actions, and decisions
Obtain, analyze, and synthesize information from multiple business users to help distinguish request from needs
Become a product and/or, process subject matter expert
Develop and execute test plans and scripts, lead testing such as user acceptance and system integration
Act as liaison between business and technical members of the project, if needed
Ensure adherence to internal practices and standards resulting in consistent development and implementation of project components
Provide training and support to end users
Qualifications:
Job Skills and Qualifications:
Proven ability to build rapport and maintain relationships with internal partners at all levels within the organization
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Superior problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills required
5+ years of business/systems analyst experience required across one or more of the following project types: Business Process Reengineering, Strategy Transformation, Vendor Integration, SDLC projects
Proven work experience as a Business Analyst or Consultant from top tier management consulting, or similar role
Approaches work in a flexible, solution focused manner and is able to collaborate effectively with team members
Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision
Experience in data analysis, and general project management methods
Experience developing, leading, and executing test plans and scripts, including both user acceptance and system integration testing
An ability to prepare and interpret data, flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans
Strong client-facing skills
Proficient use of MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Outlook, MS SharePoint and MS Visio
Hands-on experience with project management tools (e.g. Smartsheet, Visio, MS Project)
B.S. in Business Administration or related field
Assists in researching process and/or technical related incidents and issues, including conducting detailed root cause analysis to avoid further impacts and decrease the risk of recurring issues
Strong sense of urgency and ownership when resolving issues

The Pricing Operations Analyst is primarily responsible for supporting programs by managing the equipment and offering price processes, performing program/business-related analysis, providing data-driven answers to business questions, and supporting business development activities. The role will be expected to manage analysis work streams by collecting business needs and working with program data to provide insights that drive strategic decisions. This role will also utilize formal training and/or a high level of first-hand experience to understand business needs translating to developing models and tracking performance across Assurant’s Device Lifecycle Solutions (DLS) global programs.

What will my duties and responsibilities be in this job?

Guide, manage, and collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams to support offer/TIV pricing activities:

IT teams responsible for DLS platforms (includes technical knowledge and understanding)

In country and regional program management teams supporting program needs (includes business acumen and understanding)

Operations teams supporting physical processing of devices (includes working knowledge of supply chain fundamentals)

Interact and respond to requests from clients and account management teams

Support and work with business development teams to drive new program growth

Responsible for helping develop and support Global program performance monitoring:

Track key program KPIs

Monitor data accuracy

Provide feedback and insights to internal leadership and external clients

Bridge internal technical and program teams

Skills expected in this role include:

Project Management

Concurrently handle multiple tasks and minimum scope projects

Collaborate effectively with management and teams at all levels to accomplish goals

Lead project meetings/team efforts to meet goals

Analytics Technical Skills

Develop solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity through applying in-depth business understanding

Responsible for designing improvements, developing, managing quality control, documenting data flows, and ongoing maintenance for program data

Responsible for querying large data sets and transforming data into digestible intelligence for diverse audiences

Business Acumen

Participate in the development of reporting solutions according to business and technical requirements

Document existing and new business workflows with applicable metrics and measures

Closely coordinate activities with internal cross-functional teams in order to optimize DLS program management processes

Analyze factors in the marketplace impacting the program

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to support ambiguous requests

What are the requirements needed for this position?

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, analytics or similar

A minimum of 2+ years’ experience in a related field

Experience in database management tools (e.g., MS SQL Server, Oracle SQL, SSIS (ETL), and UC4)

Experience using advanced features of MS Excel, MS Visual Basic, Tableau, and SQL for writing queries for extracting information out of databases

Experience in common data analytics programming software (e.g., R, SAS, STATA, or Python)

Experience creating financial models and program analysis to drive program results

What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively perform system support duties

Ability to quickly learn new applications

Ability to process time-sensitive data and information from multiple sources, make decisions, and communicate actions

Ability to prioritize, organize, and work independently, or as part of a project team, to complete multiple tasks

Requires the ability to perform detailed work

Requires strong interpersonal skills

Working knowledge of wireless handsets

Chalk Mountain Services of Texas, LLC (“Chalk”) is a leader in transportation and logistics servicing the oil and gas extraction industry. The Company is based in Fort Worth, TX and is currently hiring an Operations Data Analyst.

The Data Analyst will provide enhanced management reports and a high-quality budgeting and forecasting analysis. They will utilize technical expertise to ensure data is accurate and high-quality. Data is then analyzed and presented in a way that identifies errors, irregularities, and opportunities for financial and operational improvement so to assist the business in making better decisions.

Responsibilities

REPORTING:

Develop financial and management reports which clearly and concisely illustrate operational, financial, and forensic performance. Continue to enhance reporting as requirements change.
Maintain and distribute the various reporting package templates for management and operational personnel.
Assist CFO in the presentation of findings in monthly board reports and other presentations.
Prepare ad hoc reports as required.

PLANNING:

Assist with the development and ongoing measurement of Key Performance Indicators utilized to measure operational performance and incentive bonus calculations.
Create forecasting models based upon historical data and pertinent forecast data designed to project Key Performance Indicators and other critical assumptions used in the Company’s forecasting process.
Provide additional support for the annual/monthly forecasting process.

ANALYSIS:

Review business performance data on a continuous basis. Identify errors and irregularities in the data and identify opportunities for improvement in operational and financial performance in such data. Such efforts include but are not limited to:
Development of metric forecasts and subsequent variance analysis.
Drill down analysis of data and metrics designed to identify underlying relationships between operational behavior and results.
Analysis of resource capacity utilization
Analyze payroll and benefits trends, coordinate with Payroll and Human Resources to ensure accurate payroll reporting.
Periodic auditing of internal functions through assessment of processed data.

OTHER:

Such other assignments as the Company may require from time to time.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or Data Analysis required. Proven analytical depth and strong technical skills required, including current knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles. Experience with Vena, Planful or similar CPM software considered a plus. Proficiency with MS Office, including Excel (Pivot Table and V-Look ups) and PowerPoint required.

Strong ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Strong analytical problem-solving aptitude with creative solutions, ability to organize work with large amounts of information efficiently, manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously with attention to detail.

Communication

Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, both in writing and verbally, with management, vendors, consultants, and other business partners. Ability to speak effectively in group settings.

The Business Analyst works collaboratively with cross-functional team members to support project management, software implementation, and automation of business processes for dynaConnections customers. As a Business Analyst, you will work on critical projects with various teams and leaders, proving your ability to influence and impact business through the software solutions we provide customers. You will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, maintaining records of changes, ensuring all stakeholders are informed of changes, and serving as a conduit for delivering quality results. The Business Analyst will also Coordinate and facilitate requirement meetings and product demonstrations, and regularly update project artifacts. They will also establish and maintain an effective and collaborative relationship with dynaConnections team members, customers, end users, and others as needed. Additional responsibilities may include assistance with quality control and software testing.

WHO WE ARE

dynaConnections is a rapidly growing SaaS company founded in 2001, based in Austin, TX. We provide a mission-critical SaaS application that enables organizations to utilize their big data with the best and highest use. Our growing suite of products is delivered via a hybrid Cloud computing service, utilizing the latest innovative technology and processes, and is backed by an outstanding team. Our application, connectMLS, easily connects users with clients, streamlining collaboration and closing millions of real estate transactions. Based on our consistent performance, clients consider dynaConnections’ application, connectMLS, an essential component of their success.

At dynaConnections, we have developed a stellar reputation for delivering and maintaining a high-performance SaaS application that continues to exceed client expectations. Consequently, we always seek self-starters to contribute to dynaConnections’ ongoing success with a client-first attitude. Everyone at dynaConnections impacts the company’s future directly or indirectly.

Four fundamental principles we follow:

Passion – Having the right mindset for client success.
Collaboration – Engaging, designing strategies, and solving problems – together.
Get Stuff Done – Turning obstacles into opportunities.
Play to Win – Having fun and going “All-In” to exceed expectations.
ABOUT YOU

We seek a self-driven, enthusiastic, hands-on Business Analyst with a positive attitude to maximize the value of dynaConnections’ products and services to customers. Do you aspire to work in a place that values collaboration and fosters cooperation and trust? Do you want to see the result of your work directly impact the company’s bottom line? Do you refuse to let obstacles get in the way of completing a task?

If this describes you, we look forward to speaking with you to discuss the opportunities at dynaConnections!

POSITION DETAILS
RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES
Have experience with extensive analytical thinking to interpret and document technical requirements accurately.
Be a creative thinker who can outline problems, provide solutions or alternatives to existing or proposed solutions.
Evaluate business processes, predict requirements, and design solution requirements.
Work directly with multiple customers and stakeholders and identify their business needs.
Able to see the complete picture and validate the requirements based on the knowledge of the business needs.
Master the art of asking the right questions.
Create, document, and monitor projects related to business requirements with defined and prioritized milestones and regular check-ins to ensure a smooth process.
