Online shopping has changed. Today's eCommerce runs on selling products, not brands. SamCart is the only eCommerce software platform built for creators, by creators, who want to build a profitable digital business and experience personal freedom and growth.

Full time. Remote.

Business Operations Analyst

The Innovation Team at SamCart is focused on helping make entrepreneurship easy. We've launched two products. First is CreatorU, an e-learning platform which coaches creators along their journey. Second is Typeset, an AI-powered design and content creation platform.

With explosive growth on the Innovation Team, we are looking to hire a Business Operations Analyst who is primarily responsible for driving strategic and operational initiatives across the Innovation Team. In this role, you will sit at the intersection of operations, analytics, finance, and product management, working closely with internal stakeholders to identify and solve complex business problems. We're looking for a go-getter who will help us take this Team to the next level.

This position requires a driven self-starter who is able to communicate clearly and effectively with leadership and successfully juggle multiple priorities. You take tasks from start to finish, are able to deliver value quickly, and enjoy working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

Take ownership of cross-functional strategic initiatives.
Develop, run, and measure experiments to increase our product adoption or revenue which lead to the creation of playbooks for ongoing business management.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis in support of cross-functional stakeholders and executive management across all business functions.
Apply strategic, operational, and analytical experience to uncover operational issues and drive process improvements at SamCart.
Manage datasets from disparate sources to build recommendations for product, customer experience or to better understand channel performance.

Qualifications

1-3+ years of experience in management consulting, strategy, at a high-growth startup, or in a heavily analytical role is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis (Tableau, SQL, Python, or R); you don't need to know SQL when you join, but expect to learn quickly!
Excellent communication skills with the ability to synthesize strategic insights in an actionable and compelling manner.
Comfortable operating in a fast moving, ambiguous space.

Success Measures

Within 1 month, get up to speed on the analytical tools we use, b) the products we offer our customers and c) our market and competitors.
Within 2 months, begin identifying and leading initiatives to scale the business and/or deliver process improvements.
Within 3 months, scope and kick-off your first major initiative, with input from Business Operations and cross-functional teams.

This is what you'll love about SamCart

Our co-founders always say "Their success is our success" and we believe that about our people too! We want everyone to love their job at least 80% of the time and when you are successful, the whole team is successful.

Each team has one offsite Hub Week per quarter to collaborate with your team members (and others!) and plan for the upcoming quarter.
Diversity adds value to everything we do - We hire from and for a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to allow the team to bring their own unique ways of thinking and working to each project.
We have unlimited PTO with an encouraged 14-day minimum to empower our team members to maintain a healthy balance in their day-to-day lives.
Yay, we have 401K!
Health Insurance premiums are covered 100% by SamCart for you +1, be it a significant other or child.
Supportive Parental leave policies for all parents.
Career growth and development are essential here at SamCart and we want all team members to build sustainable, future-proof and adaptable careers.

Our Core Values

Be Transparent - We communicate openly, thrive on feedback, and check our egos at the door.

Be Human - We operate with compassion and always assume positive intent.

Be an Owner - We are all owners of the business. We take pride in our work and know that the success of our customers and the business contributes to our individual success.

Be Creative and Commit - We collaborate, create resourceful solutions, and work as a team to get it done.

Be You - We are stronger together because of the unique qualities we each bring to the team. We believe in balance, making time for fun, and enjoying the work we do!

“I can succeed as the Security Assurance and Operations Analyst at Capital Group.”
The Security Assurance and Operations Analyst will be a highly skilled and motivated individual with responsibility to help associates define and operate security controls to ensure protection of data and systems across the organization. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to make risk-based decisions related to firewall connectivity, proxy, and USB access-related requests; perform periodic assessments of network and firewall connectivity; and develop and enforce third-party connectivity designs. Strong performers will have the ability to grow into more senior risk, engineering, or security operations roles within the security organization.
Responsibilities:
Assist associates in defining and implementing security controls to protect data and systems.
Review and assess firewall, proxy, and USB access-related requests to ensure compliance with security policies and standards.
Manage and maintain end point security policies to include but not limited to removable media controls, end point encryption, web browser security, and EDR applications.
Solve engineering problems with applications, network, and security infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, VPN appliances, proxy servers, DNS appliances and Wireless devices.
Perform periodic assessments of network and firewall related connectivity and technologies to identify vulnerabilities and recommend necessary improvements.
Evaluate the risk associated with firewall connectivity approvals and provide recommendations for risk mitigation.
Develop and enforce third-party connectivity designs and conduct reviews of setup and required connectivity to ensure compliance with security requirements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address security vulnerabilities and ensure timely resolution of security incidents.
Stay updated with the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and industry best practices to enhance security posture.
Collaborate with security incident response teams to address security issues and implement countermeasures
“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience in security assurance and operations roles, preferably in a large enterprise environment.
Strong knowledge of network and firewall technologies, including TCP/IP, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and secure network architecture.
5+ years’ experience with managing network technologies such as routers, firewalls, switches, DNS appliances, web proxies.
Understand Network protocols and network security best practices and ensure compliance with security standards and controls.
Familiarity with security frameworks and standards, such as ISO 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and PCI DSS.
Experience conducting risk assessment for firewall, proxy, and USB access.
Proficiency in analyzing network traffic, logs, and security events to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
Ability to communicate complex security concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or GIAC is highly desirable.
Knowledge of cloud security best practices and experience with cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Understanding of regulatory requirements related to data protection and privacy (e.g., GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation), CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act), etc.) is a plus.

As Staff Analyst Energy Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for optimizing electricity operations across North America and APAC regions. This role is based in Palo Alto, CA or Austin, TX.

8+ years’ relevant work experience in the electricity or energy procurement industry

Job Title: Senior Business Applications Analyst - SAP INV/PM/MM
Job Description:
Summary

Baylor College of Medicine is searching for motivated individuals to be part of a large multi-year business process and technology transformation to modernize the important work we do. Our team will be one of the first in our industry to move to the latest in SAP technologies, pioneering solutions to advance our missions of Healthcare, Research, and Education.

We are looking for team member responsible for the continuous improvement and support of BCM's Supply Chain Business Applications including, but not limited to SAP S4/HANA, Plant Maintenance, Inventory, MRP, Warehousing and Jaggaer electronic Procurement. This role will be supporting the Supply Chain Business Application function with a focus on best practice, consistent delivery and effectiveness, building strategic relationships inside the organization, collaborating with business leaders, and supporting team development and growth.


The successful candidate will design, test, implement and support business applications and/or ERP system solutions for Baylor College of Medicine. Investigates advanced application functionality and recommends changes for optimal performance. Manages end-to-end projects or processes. Interfaces with all employee levels within the institution.

Ideal individuals for this role will be passionate about improving business processes, enabling technology to solve business problems, working in an environment experiencing fast-paced change, and developing expertise in the unique field of Academic Medicine.


The position will be hybrid within the Greater Houston, TX area with onsite time occasionally required for team events and in-person meetings. Preference for Houston-based candidates.


Working title: Senior Business Applications Analyst - SAP INV/PM/MM; Internal title: Senior Business Applications Associate

Job Duties
Responsible for the continuous optimization, integrity and evaluation of the business application(s); efficient processes; and relevant training to applicable staff, faculty and learners.
Identifies process gaps and solutions that improve quality of service and assists with the development and improvement of the application.
Stays abreast of new technology solutions that improve efficiency within Material Management Processes (including but not limited to: Inventory, MRP, Plant Maintenance and Source to Pay).
Adjusts and refines configuration of supported application(s).
Serves as a project leader for implementations of business application software releases and new products.
Performs quality audits and tracks metrics related to the business application usage and performance.
Assists with complex projects that require knowledge of business application functionality.
Creates and maintains high-quality documentation for system capabilities, support requirements, reporting, and end-user training documentation.
Develops effective working relationships with key customer stakeholders, including members of departmental owners, finance team members, IT team members and third party suppliers
Primary Responsibility for technical and functional support of SAP Inventory Management (including MRP & Vendor Managed Inventory, Material Masters, scanning technology) & Plant Maintenance. Also serve as backup support for Materials Management (Procurement) module and the Jaggaer toolset.
Uses knowledge to proactively identify process gaps and solutions that improve quality of service.
Responsible for developing and maintaining a list of support responsibilities, project tasks, and proposed enhancements and working with team leader and business stakeholders to prioritize work.
Communicates with end users including both Central and Departmental users and leaders. Excellent communication and listening skills are essential.
Works with third-party suppliers including vendor-managed inventory, MRP, and catalog management.
Responds promptly to customer requests and establishes a trusted relationship with customers.
Provides assistance and training to end users and peers at a variety of levels across BCM.
Must have ability to translate business requirements into solutions that are supportable and leverage the software package's capabilities to the fullest extent
Requires work after hours or on weekends from time to time to support critical business activities or project deadlines.

Bachelor's degree. Four years of relevant experience may substitute for degree requirement.
Four years of relevant experience.

Advanced SAP experience in the following modules: Inventory Management, Plant Maintenance, MM, S4/Hana a plus
Working knowledge of how responsible modules of SAP interact with other modules such as Finance
Experience in Jaggaer One a plus
Demonstrated analyst skills and relational database experience
Advanced Excel and Power BI skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong customer service skills

Job Description
Manager, Business Systems Analysis
Location: Austin, TX
Hybrid Schedule: 3/2
Job Description:
A Portfolio / Business Analyst Manager specializes in performing research and analysis to devise strategies for optimal Functional business operations and services, ensuring efficiency and increased productivity. Their responsibilities typically revolve around coordinating different departments to develop functional services, setting goals and budgets, managing schedules, aligning strategic roadmap, and establishing new projects to improve the organization's workflow and workforce performance and driving and coordinating internal / external projects that optimize our internal IT Resources and processes.
Furthermore, as a manager, it is essential to lead and encourage the team to reach goals, all while implementing the company's policies and regulations.
Ensure adherence to the appropriate governance functions (IT Councils) relating to the portfolio. Do so on behalf of the IT portfolio steering committees, and in accordance with the organization’s guidelines, policies and practices.
Facilitate and coordinate the efforts of the CIO and senior leadership toward the establishment of the project portfolio, its structure and processes. This includes:
Demand management and strategic alignment of projects and programs
Portfolio categories and criteria
Evaluation, selection and prioritization
Backlog and Release Management
Execution, tracking and measuring the achieved results
Conduct reviews monthly with senior business and IT executives, stakeholder committees, the steering committee, and other relevant bodies. Do so to validate and assess the project portfolio, execute change, and reprioritize as necessary to meet business needs.
Conduct regular meetings with functional senior executive bodies. Inform them of any issues with the performance of individual projects within the portfolio. Confirm that the use of resources and funding is on plan and highlight any variances.
Lead reviews of any significant initiatives, projects or programs that have run into challenges. Provide recommendations as to whether they should be continued, changed significantly, placed on hold or discontinued.
Partner with business functions to create IT Roadmaps, and associated business cases, to drive short and long-term IT investment
Provide criteria for prioritization at the appropriate level aligned to the goals of the IT investment council and steering committee. Become the point of escalation and arbitration if necessary.
Collaborate with senior business and IT executives to identify opportunities for applying technology developments to address the challenges from increasing digitalization.
Oversee and coordinate dependencies across the initiatives in the portfolio and resolve or escalate conflicts.
Ensure and balance the availability of the required skills and competencies across project and program teams within the project portfolio, as mandated and resourced by leadership.
Direct the development and maintenance of communications and reporting about the project portfolios, their contents and the performance of individual initiatives to stakeholder and governance council(s), the steering committee and senior executives.
Direct the creation and maintenance of the required portfolio documentation and artifacts.
Delivers the agreed upon IT Portfolio via programs and projects
Required Education: Bachelor’s Degree required.
Required Experience:
10+ years of experience in Business Analysis / Project Management, including IT projects and IT Infrastructure.
Employment history must demonstrate increasing levels of responsibility.
Experience in managing a team and multiple concurrent projects.
Preferred Experience:
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) certification.
Agile Project Management experience.
Certified Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB)
Experience with the Salesforce / SAP / CRM systems
Knowledge and Skills:
Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and communicate the portfolio objectives, inspire and motivate staff, and maintain alignment with business strategy.
A high degree of political sensitivity, astuteness and the ability to use influence to overcome obstacles and achieve portfolio success.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain and “sell” the portfolio goals and objectives to the business and to technical leadership.
Strong business acumen
A high level of empathy and the ability to vary styles of interaction to match the needs of a variety of business and technical audiences, as well as temperaments and personalities.
Influencing and negotiation experience and skills in an environment with high competition for resources.
Excellent analytical, conceptual strategic planning and execution skills. Familiarity with financial analysis and associated reporting tools.
Ability to develop portfolios and deliver them against financial and resource constraints.
Familiarity with the use of reporting tools to monitor portfolio activities and analyze portfolio performance.
Experience with the delivery methodologies and frameworks of:
PMI standards (PMP Certification)
Agile / Scrum (CSM Certification)
Experience across a range of projects and programs.
Understanding of current and emerging technologies and how organizations may apply them to drive digital business.
The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This job operates in an office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. This is a largely sedentary role; however, some filing is required, which would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 35 pounds. This position also requires 4 to 6 hours per day at a computer screen/keyboard.

Come Join an Inclusive Team:

The Finance Data Analytics and Automation (DA&A) Team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, process mining and reporting to generate insights which facilitates better decision-making and value creation. The team also governs and supports key financial reporting systems used by Finance and will act as focal point in strategic initiatives / projects. The Lead Analyst, Finance Business Intelligence will report to the Manager, Finance Business Intelligence and will be a core member of the OneStream Projects and Development group. The OneStream Projects and Development group delivers technical leadership for ongoing enhancements of applications used in financial reporting such as OneStream, SAP BW/BPC, and CCERT. The Lead Analyst will interact with vendor(s) on design of the OneStream application, provide training to OneStream users, and advise on new features of OneStream to be considered for future implementations or enhancements. Additionally, they will assist the OneStream Center of Excellence (COE) team with the management and governance of the OneStream application. The Lead Analyst will support COE team efforts related to the OneStream Community of Practice (CoP) and super-user group. This role will also contribute to the development of any ongoing OneStream applications. The Lead Analyst will have the additional opportunity to learn and technically support the automation and analytical tools used by DA&A like RPA, Alteryx, Automation Anywhere, Microsoft Power Platform, Celonis, and Azure SQL.

Day in the Life:
Stay up to date with Business Intelligence and related tools such as OneStream, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Platform, and Azure.
Stay up to date with Corporate Management Systems like OneStream and SAP BW. Also be familiar with and able to leverage knowledge of other technologies such as Intelligent Automation, process mining, and data & analytics.
Must have experience working in OneStream or a comparable CPM system with direct experience working in modeling, reporting, visualization, and dashboarding. OneStream implementation, consolidation, and/or FP&A experience is a plus.
Must have experience working with teams from different groups / vendors spread across different geographical locations, with varying levels of familiarity with OneStream.
Must be able to review the design and implementation proposals recommended by external vendor keeping system performance and data quality in mind.
Should be able to help explore and implement OneStream Marketplace solutions like AcctRecs, Transaction Matching, ACM and others.
Should have knowledge of SQL and VB scripting; at least within the confines of the OneStream application.
Working experience with Power BI is preferred; must have a desire to develop this skill set.
Must be able to assist in the development of training materials and teach new users in OS COE group on basics-to-advanced OneStream processes / concepts.
Would act as OneStream subject matter expert (SME) for LYB OneStream COE and extended peer group, including the OneStream Community of Practice (CoP).
Should be able to help with OneStream Support activities related to Month End Close including monitoring loads, updating transformation mappings, running ad hoc loads and data management jobs.
Nice to have knowledge related to FP&A processes like monthly forecasting, budgeting and management reporting.
Must have experience with company consolidation of financials.
Experience with end-user support / request prioritization using tools like ServiceNow and Azure DevOps (ADO) is a plus.
Nice to have OneStream and/or HFM Expertise.
Must have knowledge of various OneStream functionalities including data integration, Workflows, Business rules, Data Source, Transformations, Dimensions, Member Filters, Cube Views, Quick Views, XF get cell, Dashboards and various other administrative functions (including OS security).
Must have OneStream knowledge on advanced Member Filters, Dynamic Calculations and Formatting settings for Cube Views, BI Viewer and advanced Components, Dashboard Layouts and Embedded Dashboards, and OneStream features used in Report Books.
Must have experience with OneStream Finance Engine including Dynamic Calculations, Stored Calculations and Finance Business Rules.
Must have experience designing and implementing Dashboards in Onstream with advanced data queries, Business Rules and Workspaces.
Must be very comfortable with the concepts of a Dashboard Maintenance Unit, using Business Rules such as Dashboard Extenders, XFBR Strings and / or Dashboard Data Sets, advanced Dashboard Components and SQL data queries.
You Bring This Value:
BS Accounting, Finance, MIS, or related Degree.
6-8 years of experience.
CPA or similar accreditation is a plus.
Strong Project Management skills.
Deep OneStream knowledge.
Technical SQL and VB scripting knowledge.
Understanding of FP&A and / or Consolidations processes.
Presentation skills, including the ability to break down complicated subjects and explain them succinctly to non-experts and project leadership.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Specialist II - FT - Days
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible for maintenance and monitoring of existing BI reports, applications and infrastructure, as well as creation, maintenance and implementation of new applications, databases, reports, and dashboards. The candidate must be self-motivated with a strong attention to detail and the ability to fill multiple roles within the BI environment.

Bachelor’s degree required
Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred
Hospital or healthcare experience preferred
Ability to interpret requirements and technical specifications and translate and present in an understandable and user-friendly manner.
Working knowledge of Business Intelligence end user tools and knowledge of database architecture.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience in at least one of the areas of database administration, ETL programming, data visualization, report writing, or SQL programming preferred

Works on multiple tasks/projects individually or as team member.
Sometimes works as a functional lead.
Works with internal and external customers and IT partners to develop and analyze business intelligence needs.
Perform data validation to ensure the data is within the required quality standards.
Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials.
Interpret business requirements and technical specifications in order to complete tasks as needed.
Works under supervision of the manager and takes support and guidance from other Level II and Engineer level staff to accomplish goals.

(Chain-of-command)

Identify and revise enterprise reporting requirements.
Responsible for evaluation, installation, testing, implementation, maintenance and troubleshooting of new or upgraded BI Applications.
Troubleshoot reported problems pertaining to BI tools and database environments, working closely with other IT members, especially DBAs, Systems Analysts, BI Analysts and Systems Engineers, identifying the cause and designing / developing an approach for resolution.
Assess impact of changes and updates to source production systems, planning and implementing resulting changes to reports and dashboards.
Governance / Best Practices – adhere and contribute to enterprise data governance standards. Also educates andsupports colleagues in best practices to ensure that data is used appropriately.
Conduct end user training on BI systems.
Perform system administrator functions within software, including maintaining configuration of software, account management, maintaining system security.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Job Description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Business Analyst with a strong technical background and a proven track record of success in implementing ChatBot projects. The ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of business analysis processes, methodologies, and tools, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive successful project outcomes.

Conduct comprehensive business analysis activities to define project scope, requirements, and success criteria.

Develop and maintain project documentation including business cases, requirements specifications, use cases, and process flows.

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including developers, testers, and project managers to ensure timely and successful project delivery.

Lead requirements gathering sessions, facilitate workshops, and present findings to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Identify and manage project risks, issues, and dependencies, and develop contingency plans where required.

Leverage technical expertise to provide guidance and support to the project team, and ensure that technical requirements are accurately captured and documented.

Actively contribute to the continuous improvement of the business analysis practice, by identifying and implementing process improvements, tools, and techniques.

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Supports institutional I.T. applications by providing ongoing support with implementation, training, and workflow design. Support change management efforts by assisting in the development of training materials and providing user support during system implementations and/or upgrades.

Perform all other duties as assigned.

Combination or related education and/or experience.

Jeanne Clery Act

The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act is a federal statute requiring colleges and universities participating in federal financial aid programs to maintain and disclose campus crime statistics and security information. By October 1 of each year, institutions must publish and distribute their Annual Campus Security Policy & Crime Statistics Report (ASR) to current and prospective students and employees. To view this report, visit the TTUHSC Clery Act website.

Job Title: Lead Database administrator and Business Data analyst
Job Description:
Applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives. Works on problems of diverse complexity and scope. May act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process. Exercises independent judgment within generally defined policies and practices to identify and select a solution. Ability to handle most unique situations. May seek advice in order to make decisions on complex business issues.

Responsibilities

Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Represents the data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Build cloud-based database systems of high availability and quality.
Design and implement database in accordance to requirements.
Minimize database downtime and monitor database performance to provide fast query responses.
Provide proactive and reactive data management support and training to users.
Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards.
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy and integrity.
Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors.
Review SQL code and database changes.
Manage database deployments to all environments.
Create and manage database reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Provide database reports to the users, in appropriate format and in a timely manner.
Recommend and implement emerging database technologies.
Establish consistent customer service SLAs and commit to high quality in the customer experience.
Work with engineering teams to resolve production incidents.
Coordinate database processes across different products and organizations.
Provide ad-hoc data analysis reports for executives and upper management.
Track and manage database related bugs using JIRA.
Collect data from a variety of sources and transform into insights to improve business decisions.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.

Knowledge & Skills

Using data engineering tools, languages, frameworks to mine, cleanse and explore data.
Fluent in NoSQL & relational based systems and ability. Expert level of transactional SQL language is a must.
Fluent in complex, distributed and massively parallel systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to represent complex algorithms in software.
Strong understanding of database technologies and management systems.
Strong understanding of cloud-based systems/services.
Database architecture testing methodology, including execution of test plans, debugging, and testing scripts and tools.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design proposals and negotiate options at management levels.
Other desired programming languages will be Java, C++, or Python.
Scala language with Spark SQL is a nice to have.
Understanding of analytics pipeline with AWS services (EC2, RDS, S3, EMR, Redshift, etc.)

Scope & Impact

Collaborates with peers, junior engineers, data scientists and project team.
Typically interacts with high-level Individual Contributors, Managers and Program Teams.
Leads a project requiring data engineering solutions development.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent.
Proven working experience as a Database Administrator
Hands-on experience with database standards and end user applications
Experience with AWS cloud services and Linux environments
Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL
Familiarity with database design, documentation, and coding
Problem solving skills and ability to think algorithmically
Understanding of relational and dimensional data modeling
Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
Typically 5-10 years’ experience.

At Meta, Mission Control is the organization responsible for end-to-end workforce planning, management, and headcount allocations for all of Meta. In this role, our team helps the business proactively drive their priorities aligned to the strategies of our human resources, recruiting, and finance departments. Further, they manage the day-to-day operations of headcount management across Meta.We are looking for an experienced individual who will be responsible for improving headcount management processes and products, designing future-state solutions, implementing and developing operational strategies. The ideal candidate will question common assumptions, rethink existing processes and products, and see every challenge as an opportunity for improvement. This role supports process and product development on a global scale. The individual must have a proven track record in solving complex problems, and excellent communication, collaboration, and influence abilities across all levels of an organization.



Workforce Operations Analyst Responsibilities:

Design workforce management and planning processes that scalability and efficiently enhance user (e.g., manager, org leader, workforce planner) experiences
Conduct current-state assessment and recommend future-state business processes
Develop, document, and measure end-to-end processes utilizing process improvement methodologies, tools, and techniques (i.e., Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen)
Measure the outcomes and outputs of process improvement endeavors and leverage quantitative results to inform direction of the business
Effectively leverage data dashboards and metrics to inform prioritization processes and Product roadmaps
Design and drive co-creative design thinking sessions to drive alignment and accelerate delivery
Leverage industry best practices and develop end-to-end process improvement frameworks to increase the speed of delivery, scale, and adoption of solutions
Educate and advise stakeholders on best practices for driving process improvement initiatives and how to leverage the tools and templates that have been developed
Consult with process owners throughout the execution of process optimization projects providing guidance on methodologies, tools, and templates
Develop and maintain an inventory of best-in-class tools and templates to accelerate the impact of process improvement projects and ensure consistent execution
Build and maintain effective communication with project relevant stakeholders




Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience
6+ years of experience with process improvement
Experience working with multiple cross-functional partners
Experience managing process improvement projects and cross functional teams
Experience utilizing process optimization methodologies & tools
Experience with workforce planning and/or management including headcount planning and allocation management




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Workday, Salesforce, and Workplace by Facebook functionality including tenant configuration, data loads, and maintenance
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline such as Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Applications & Systems Development.
Lean Six Sigma or certification in agile management
Experience with finance, organizational effectiveness, and recruiting processes




About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. Job Summary

Ensures that gas volumes and related cost and revenue transactions of the Company's operations are accurately recorded, analyzed and reported in a timely, cost-effective manner and in compliance with regulatory, state and federal requirements. Develops reports, in compliance with standard reporting requirements, for internal and external parties.

Essential Functions

Ensures accurate recording of revenues and costs and resolves any errors in the transport counterparty, and customer reconciliation process; including entity set up or termination, transport rate reconciliation, confirming invoice payment amounts.
Reviews and verifies gas supply and transportation invoices to ensure accuracy and resolve discrepancies in the payment of vendor invoices.
Compares scheduled pipeline volumes to monthly transportation statements to ensure accuracy and coordinates between Scheduling and Trading to identify and resolve discrepancies.
Obtains customer usage files each month from various pipelines/utilities to load, review, and process volumes through the system in order to ensure invoices are billed and accurate revenues recorded to the financials.
Verifies and reviews monthly storage statements to confirm the correct storage volumes have been documented and analyses the volumes and related pricing to ensure accurate recording of costs and deferrals to the monthly statements.
Reconcile to identify volume and pricing issues, and work closely with Trading, Scheduling, and Actualization groups to resolve discrepancies.
Obtains and provides financial/statistical information or supporting test documentation to ensure compliance with SOX requirements
Analyses information and collects and cross-references supporting documentation to prepare/review A/R, A/P schedules, documents, reports. Prepares variance analysis and projections. Reconciles account activity and resolves discrepancies. Interprets and monitors corporate compliance with Regulatory/State and Federal requirements.
Creates updates and controls contents of business units’ various system files. Verifies system integrity and audits accuracy of system data.
Obtains or provides financial/statistical information (written or oral) as requested and prepares reports for internal and external auditors, various governmental agencies and other outside organizations.
Participates in project teams involved in the design, development, testing and implementation of automated systems, reengineering of processes or implementation of new requirements.
Develop and maintain strong customer relations by providing timely customer service to both internal and external customers daily.

Qualifications

Education

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in economics, accounting, finance or general business.
Requires a minimum of three (3) years of full-time experience in gas accounting, revenue accounting or related gas industry experience or other business-related disciplines.

Experience, additional knowledge, skills, and personal characteristics

Strong proficiency in full suite of Microsoft Office applications with an emphasis on Excel and the ability to write, improve, and repair complex formulas and workbooks.
Experience with Openlink Endur ETRM, Salesforce, and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central highly preferred.
Able to perform all aspects of work with a high degree of effectiveness, efficiency and accuracy to meet or exceed customer expectations
Able to demonstrate and apply a strong technical knowledge of accounting theory and principles and apply effectively.
Able to acquire and apply knowledge of requirements necessary to comply with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
Able to demonstrate and apply proficiency in performing financial and statistical computations.
Able to demonstrate and apply effective written and oral communication proficiency with a wide range of audiences
Able to excel in conceptualizing and assimilating data quickly to make timely and accurate decisions and take appropriate action.
Able to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Able to take a leadership role in a project team to establish plans, coordinate team activities, and assure successful completion of objectives.
Able to work self-directed, using initiative and self-motivation, to achieve goals independently, or with minimal supervision.
Able to work with close attention to detail, in a highly accurate manner, to produce complete and timely work.
Able to remain focused in the face of distractions, prioritize work, meet deadlines, manage multiple tasks concurrently, and respond flexibly to changing work priorities.
Able to adapt effectively to new and changing environments and technology
Able to remain current on industry and business issues, understand and apply this knowledge to current activities.
Able to demonstrate commitment to compliance with applicable laws and regulations, the Company’s Ethics and Compliance Code of Conduct, and other Company policies and procedures and do so consistently, take all required training courses and do so timely.
Able to demonstrate respect for all individuals, adhere to the Company’s values and business practices and do both consistently.

Other Requirements

Able to work in fast-paced office environment with a high-volume workload and frequent, short deadlines that may require more than a 40-hour work week to meet established deadlines including working nights or weekends, as required
Able to work indoors, in an office environment, regardless of whether open office, cubicle or private office
Able to travel occasionally, possibly overnight.

The Senior Analyst, Business Systems is a key position within the Finance organization, responsible for assessing and managing enterprise projects and business initiatives that impact T-Mobile’s accounting and financial reporting processes. This role reports to the Sr Manager, Business Systems Analysis as an individual contributor. This individual will be responsible for representing Finance on enterprise projects through the project lifecycle, including assessments, business requirements, operational impacts and solution, system design, testing and launch approvals. This position partners closely with product owners and other teams across the enterprise and has significant interaction with finance leadership.

The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in both business analysis and technical and/or operational accounting. To effectively support projects, the candidate will become a SME (Subject Matter Expert) in one or multiple areas of accounting, developing an understanding of transactional flows, financial risks, controls and corresponding journal entries through the various systems to drive scalable solutions and operational accounting efficiencies. This is a highly dynamic and continuously evolving area of T-Mobile’s business; the ideal candidate works well through ambiguity, thrives in a fast-paced and changing environment, and possesses excellent leadership and communication skills.

Responsibilities

Manage projects from concept approval to launch including status reporting and go/no go recommendations to accounting leadership.
Partner effectively with cross-functional teams to support business initiatives, drive process improvements, and implement best practices.
Elicit requirements and write user stories with acceptance criteria.
Communicate and advocate for business requirements to project teams, ensuring the solution design meets the requirements.
Collaborate effectively and communicate with all levels of management and cross-functional teams.
Manage risks and issues, develop mitigation plans, and escalate as appropriate.
Serve as a knowledgeable resource and SME to business partners and cross-functional enterprise project teams.
Develop/review test plans, communicate with testing teams, and review test results, and perform traceability to ensure all requirements are tested.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field required
CPA or Chartered Accountant preferred.
Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in business analysis.
Public accounting or public company experience preferred.
Proven ability to plan and manage multiple projects while meeting set deliverable deadlines.
Proven ability to adapt and excel in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Proven ability to make sound, fact-based decisions, and recommendations.
Proven ability to build successful partnerships and negotiation with product owners and IT on delivering system solutions and enhancements.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
Experience with Agile software development practices
Solid understanding of ERP and/or financial systems, including the development, implementation, testing, and/or maintenance of a suite of billing & accounting systems
Wireless Industry experience preferred.

The Collections Senior Analyst will specialize in the collection of debt owed to ENGIE and needs to be proficient in all market rules pertaining to billing and collection procedures.




Minimize credit risk exposure and credit losses by executing established collections procedures. Employ business communication skills and judgment to enforce compliance with contractual payment terms by contacting customers directly. Provide recommendations for credit decisions to management based on customer payment history and industry experience to initiate actions for mitigating losses. Timely management internal/eternal customer queries for resolution. Accurate and timely management of disconnect and reconnect processes.




This role reports to the Collections Manager, sits in Houston, TX and is eligible for a hybrid work schedule in-office and work-from-home.




The safety of our employees is our number one priority. All employees at ENGIE have both a duty and the authority to STOP WORK if unsafe acts are observed.




What you’ll do:

Specialize in the collection of debt owed to ENGIE
Strategically prioritize and balance workload based on changing business needs
Use a variety of means to contact individuals who have defaulted on debts and/or who have not paid past-due bills
Must have exceptional communications skills, as well as listening abilities and problem solving acumen
Must have good attention to details
Generate weekly A/R report and assign what calls to be made to analyst
Advise credit department on payment history for customer renewals
Participate in major department projects and take an active role in cross-functional teams to assist in driving quality improvements, processes, and initiatives
Reduce DSO and increase cash flow
Be able to handle multiple priorities
Ability to handle stressful situations and maintain composure
Be backup to analyst when they are out of office
Responsible for collection of term fees, returned checks and proper recording of activity
Suggest new or changes in collection policy and procedures to enhance customer experience
Responsible for return of credit balances on finalled accounts
Responsible for collection of term fees, returned checks and proper recording of activity
Responsible for all customer accounts that have summary bills to assure timely payment
Outbound and Inbound Collection calls, challenge resolution, customer service issues and be the expert in collection resolution. Address escalated customer collections issues received from customer care center that are escalated from the analyst. Objective: Get paid
Maintain notes of collection activities in billing and collection systems. Assure that tracking of problem accounts are escalated to manager
Acquire collateral from customers and advise accounting counterparts on proper recording to deposit report
Advise remittance group on proper application of payments as needed and contact customers if necessary for remittance information
High volume phone calls to assigned delinquent customers. Responsible for coordination of collection activity with analyst
Reconcile customer disputes as they pertain to payment of outstanding balances that are due and be the champion of getting paid
Make recommendations to Manager on any process improvements that streamline collection activity
Address escalated customer collections issues received from customer care center that are escalated from the analyst with the ability to manage stressful situations and maintain composure
Coordinate with relevant groups-sales, legal, accounting, etc. to resolve customer disputes
Job applies to Retail accounts. Need to be proficient in all market rules pertaining to collection procedures and be able to recommend drops of customers who are past due
Maintain supporting documentation to support drop decisions when PUC complaints arise
Responsible for meeting/exceeding collections process metrics and quality control to insure high level of on-time payments and professional customer interaction
Monthly reports as required by Manager
Assist with accounting reporting requirements
Acts as a team member with all ENGIE staff
Comply with all ENGIE policies and procedures
Carries out other duties as assigned



What you bring:

Bachelor’s Degree Accounting or Business or 3 years of energy industry experience in lieu of degree
Commercial collections experience required
Preferably 3 years High Volume corporate Collections experience
Minimum 5 years business experience
Extensive knowledge of retail C&I (Commercial & Industries) energy operations, procedures, and regulatory standards
Proficiency in all market rules pertaining to billing and collection procedures and be able to recommend disconnects/drops of customers who are past due
Working knowledge of market EDI transactions
Direct billing and accounts receivable experience is highly preferred
Experience with SQL, MS Excel, MS Access
Must have good attention to details and in-depth knowledge of Retail Commercial invoicing and products
Knowledge of Billing and Collections procedures;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
Strong attention to detail and goal oriented
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities;
Self-motivated and initiative taking without assistance from Manager
Spanish speaking preferred not required
Independent thinker, excellent verbal, and written communication skills
Detail-oriented and strong follow-up skills with the ability to manage multiple assignments on a timely basis with a high degree of accuracy
Proficiency with standard office software packages
A high degree of reliability and strong ethics
Productive and efficient, with a fast turn-around
Collaborator with the ability to work well with others

Must be eligible to work for any U.S. employer without the need for sponsorship now or in the future

Sr. Manager, Global Customer Success




Your role

We are searching for a Continuous Improvement Manager to deliver business performance improvement opportunities for our organization. In this role, you will analyze customer feedback, current practices and develop business process improvements as well as recommend workflow, system, and process changes to ensure continuous company performance.

As a continuous improvement manager, you should be a skilled communicator, experienced in business analysis, project and solution implementation. Candidates must have technical knowledge, effective communication, and training experience. Must be able to work with technical development teams and end-users to support process, system, and data requirements. Ability to comprehend, analyze and interpret data, system integrations, and external applications. Position involves participation in complex global technical projects, including but not limited to ERP implementation, Global Customer Portal launch, Global Service Management process and system change management.

This position reports to Global Customer Insights, a function of Global Customer Success, and works closely with Global Operations, Information Technology, Customer Care, and Customer Success Manager communities in North American, EMEA, and APAC Regions.

Continuous Improvement Manager Responsibilities:

Analyzing customer experience feedback.
Analyzing company processes and procedures.
Developing process enhancement strategies.
Investigating gaps, issues, and complaints in current business processes.
Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to enhance processes and systems.
Communicating ideas and opinions to cross-functional management.
Training, mentoring, and guiding team members in new processes.



Continuous Improvement Manager Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in business administration, process management, or operations.
A graduate degree in business or MBA would be beneficial.
Five years' experience in process optimization, operations, or business management.
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma principles and methodologies. Certification Preferred.
Proficiency in data analytics tools and modeling.
High degree of ownership over work and ability to work independently.
Clear communicator with excellent written, verbal, and listening skills.
Familiarity with Agile SDLC and Project management experience helpful.
A sharp eye for identifying weak points in processes and organizational structures.
A thorough understanding of the latest process enhancement strategies.
Dynamic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Confidence in your abilities to lead organizational change.

Continuous Improvement Manager Job Description:

The primary focus of this role is analysis of customer and internal feedback to develop organizational performance insights that aim to improve people, process, and systems as part of our global customer experience program. Part of this role includes oversight and management of our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Experience (CX) Management software applications. Software application requirements include system administration, user support, trouble shooting, and issue resolution. The Global Continuous Improvement Lead is also responsible for identification and implementation of process improvements, solution development, system, process training, change enablement, and oversight of technical support resources.

Continuous Improvement Manager Technical Skill Requirements:

To qualify for this position, candidates must have knowledge and hands on experience with data tools and models, system integrations and APIs, Salesforce.com, and PowerBI. ERP, ServiceNow, Gainsight CRM, and Qualtrics knowledge preferred.

Ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders to define business requirements using various skills, such as critical thinking, process development, and latest management methodologies.
Maintain, review, and analyze organizational performance levering customer and internal feedback from software applications and data analytics tools.
Capture and use customer feedback and internal business requirements to enhance systems, process improvements, and develop end-user reporting and data visualizations for consumption and analysis.
Conduct research and analysis of business situations to contextualize and summarize solutions for end users.
Extensive data analysis experience to ensure accurate data for business consumption using a combination of manual and automated data cleansing and migration solutions.
Work with Global cross-functional teams to develop, evaluate, and execute system enhancement and process improvement roadmaps.

A bit about us

Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL®, the company’s global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 28 countries on six continents.

Our Operations team keeps our customers’ infrastructure running safely and securely. We get plenty of opportunities to take on a variety of tasks and develop our technical skills. From overseeing electrical power to cooling and fire suppression systems, our team plays a vital role in making sure everything in our data centers operates as it should.




What we can offer you

Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers.




Join us and you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, you’ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us.




Our Compensation Philosophy

Digital Realty offers its employees a highly competitive compensation package, excellent benefits, and an environment that recognizes and rewards your contributions. Central to our compensation philosophy is rewarding our employees for achieving the values and objectives aligned to the company's overall goals and values.




This is an exciting time to join our business so apply now and make your mark on our future.

Senior Legal Operations Analyst - Technology

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 250 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 20+ years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

As a part of the Global Legal Operations team, the Senior Legal Operations Analyst will be responsible for working with various stakeholders at all levels across the Legal department on projects, from opportunity alignment and requirements gathering through design and delivery. The focus for this role will be on technology projects that drive digital transformation across the Legal practice areas, from enhancing current systems, supporting system integrations to developing business requirements and common processes for new system deployments. The Senior Legal Operations Analyst will need to juggle responsibilities with a wide range of complexities, while also remaining methodical and organized.




We are seeking a bright, enthusiastic, business minded, and results-oriented professional with solid legal technology experience and the ability to coordinate with cross-functional teams. To excel in this role, you will be a proactive representative of the Global Legal Operations team, eager to make a lasting impact with a passion for innovation. Successful candidates will have experience deploying a wide range of digital technology to a legal practice area or a complimentary function with transferable skills.




Responsibilities

Project management of Legal technology initiatives, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope and within budget.

Independently conduct internal/external research to completion of basic and complex requests

Understand and uncover business needs and objectives for the Legal department, including understanding existing processes, gaps, goals, and improvement opportunities

Define project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility

Lead the implementation, deployment, and further development of Legal Technology systems

Create, gather, document, and analyze business requirements and partner with IT, cross functional stakeholders and external service providers to recommend practical, innovative solutions

Lead, coordinate, and conduct user acceptance testing

Lead the development of customized training materials

Act as the liaison with various stakeholders, including IT

Lead cross functional process management discussions

Translate business challenges into systems (single or cross functional) requirements design

Gather metrics and generate routine reports that measure adoption of processes and tools

Partner with Data & Analytics teams to develop meaningful usage reports or communicate the need for raw data to develop customized reports

Provide trainings as required on various functions, processes or technologies

Provide recommendations on promoting awareness and increase user adoption of tools

Use a variety of problem-solving skills to resolve issues with internal teams and stakeholders

Qualifications

Proven years completing similar tasks to those above, and within a Legal or IT environment, preferred

Bachelor's degree required

Experience with Legal technology and processes required

Agile Project Management qualifications preferred

Ability to identify and manage cross-team and cross-project dependencies

Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently, both verbally and written

Ability to anticipate and address issues early with strong customer focus

Strong analytical skills including business case acumen

Ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects for various internal customers

Strong interpersonal and communication skills required

Ability to make decisions independently, knowing how and when to escalate issues

Experience working directly with business teams and stakeholders

Experience in Legal domains preferred, including but not limited to Corporate Legal, Compliance, Privacy, and Entity Management

Knowledge of Project Management Technology, such as SharePoint, Jira, Smartsheet, Tableau, Box

Experience with Legal technologies, such as ServiceNow, Onit, iManage, OneTrust, and Diligent

Job Description Summary
The Project & Finance Analyst/Manager will be the key leader and liaison between the business and IT by providing production support and implementing business process improvement through process definition, configuration of and enhancements in the company's core ERP: Oracle R12 E-business Suite application’s finance and project accounting modules. The candidate will implement, analyze, develop, maintain and modify Project Accounting, Project Costing, GL, AR, AP, Fixed Asset, Cash Management and project manufacturing solutions. This is a unique opportunity as we are beginning to build a robust ERP system, a core repairs' management system as well as a new business Intelligence platform. This role will be crucial to support business functions. It will require working closely with cross functional team members to understand and shape the overall business system landscape

Job Description
Be the ERP Workstream lead for: Oracle Project Accounting, Project Costing, GL, AR, AP, Fixed Asset, Cash Management and Project Manufacturing
Work with business functions to gather requirements to document functional specifications and process flows
Work with internal Supply Chain & finance partners to understand and review the feasibility of business requirements
Gather business requirements for enhancements, customizations and develop technical requirement documents
Consult ERP DT Leader on ERP “best practices” process implementation and drive end-to-end process implementation or improvements initiatives (design, test & deploy).
Responsible for gap analysis of functional flows, provide solution design, perform demo for the Gaps solution from standard solution sets as well customized solutions.
Learn & Develop proficiency with the supply chain modules of Oracle E-business Suite and other tools used with ERP
Provide L1 and L2 end user support from root cause analysis through resolution with both onsite and offshore support resources
Promote user adoption by facilitating user acceptance testing and training
Responsible for proactive action regarding updates, including researching known issues, testing key processes, and educating business SMEs/BPOs on existing or new ERP functionality
Work with management and business users to identify report gaps, design report specifications, and test developed reports
Identify opportunities for improvements and enhancements to maximize the use of Oracle throughout the organization
Plan, create, and execute detailed task list based on high-level goals and objectives
Participate in providing solutions for daily production issues or for any other maintenance activities which might also involve change management process
Test and document code updates. This includes unit testing, component integration testing, system integration testing, performance testing, capacity testing and quality reviews

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or Information Systems related fields (Master’s in science or business, preferred)
5+ years of related business and/or IT experience
4+ years of business analyst experience
3+ years of Oracle EBS or other ERP experience
At least 1 Full Cycle ERP implementation experience
Expertise in Process Design and Architecture in Supply Chain modules (Procurement-to-Pay, Material Master and BOMs, Production, Inventory Management, Logistics and Integration with Oracle Financials & Order to Cash)
Excellent organizational and presentation skills
Understanding of IT Change Management practices and ERP Life Cycle Management
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to travel up to 10%

TECHNICAL SKILLS:

PL/SQL and SQL development (Must have)
Knowledge of Web Service Integration architecture
Knowledge/experience of Oracle ERP Integration capabilities
Knowledge of Cloud integration middleware products such as: Dell-Boomi, Mulesoft etc.
Knowledge of the Security architecture (roles, privileges, hierarchy, etc.)

Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled and motivated SAP OTC Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between our business needs and technical solutions. Your responsibilities will include analyzing, documenting, and communicating business processes and requirements.

Summary of Essential Job Functions:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may also be assigned.

Elicit Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, managers, and IT teams, to gather and document detailed business requirements. Conduct interviews, workshops, and data analysis to identify and understand user needs.
Process Analysis: Analyze existing business processes, workflows, and systems to identify areas for improvement, efficiency gains, and automation opportunities. Provide recommendations for process enhancements and optimizations.
Solution Design: Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications and user stories. Work closely with the development team to ensure accurate and effective solution design.
Data Analysis: Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decision-making and improve operational efficiency.
Testing and Validation: Create test plans, test cases, and conduct user acceptance testing to ensure the implemented solutions meet the business requirements and objectives.
Change Management: Support change management initiatives by assisting in the development of training materials, conducting user training, and providing ongoing support to end-users during the implementation phase.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of business requirements, process flows, functional specifications, and other project-related artifacts.
Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate project status, updates, and risks to stakeholders, project managers, and senior leadership.
Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify areas for improvement within business processes and systems and suggest appropriate solutions to enhance productivity and efficiency.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience (five years or more) as a Business Analyst or in a similar role specifically working with ERP and CRM systems, with a track record of successful project deliveries.
Strong understanding of ERP (SAP ECC 6 On-Premises Preferred) and CRM (Salesforce) functionalities and configuration, with deep knowledge of SAP OTC.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful insights.
Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with all levels of the organization communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with project management principles and agile methodologies.
Experience in working with cross-functional teams and managing stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Knowledge of relevant software and systems used in the industry (e.g., Microsoft Office, SAP, BI tools).
Adaptability and flexibility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with changing priorities.

Other Skills and Abilities

To be successful in this role, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Leadership Mentality
Detailed orientated
Planning and organizing
Decision-making skills
Customer Service orientated.
Effective interaction with Stakeholders
Facilitating meetings
Teamwork

Physical Requirements/Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job the employee must be able to remain in a stationary position for long periods, must be able to operate a computer and other forms of office technology; and must be able to effectively communicate.
Frequent extended work hours.
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.



Join our team and contribute to driving meaningful business growth through data-driven insights and process improvements. In addition to an attractive wage, this position offers a competitive benefits package including Group Health and Life Insurance, Vision and Dental Insurance, a Flexible Benefit Plan, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with a company match, a Profit-Sharing Retirement Plan, and other benefits.
