About Stampli

﻿

Stampli is an AI-powered Accounts Payable (AP) automation solution that doesn’t require rework to the customer’s enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. Our solution is designed to seamlessly integrate with over 70 ERPs, including Oracle Netsuite, Sage Intacct, SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and many more, allowing our customers to deploy in days, not months.


As a leader in AP automation for 18 consecutive quarters according to G2 Crowd, Stampli is a comprehensive AP automation solution that centralizes communication, documentation, payments, corporate cards, and more – providing customers full visibility into all company spend.


We have an excellent culture and a vibrant location in downtown Mountain View, Nashville, and Austin (new!). Stampli has won several Comparably awards, including: Best Company Outlook, Best Company Work-Life Balance, Best Company Compensation, Best Company Happiness, and Best Company Perks & Benefits.


About the Position


As Stampli’s Revenue Operations Analyst, you will play a critical role in both our contract and billing management processes. You will frequently collaborate cross-functionally, mainly with our Sales, Customer Success, Finance, and Business Intelligence teams. You will report directly to the VP of Revenue Operations.


Responsibilities


Partner with Revenue Operations to ensure data accuracy in CRM. This will include but is not limited to managing cross-functional teams to establish consistent definitions to process and interdepartmental information collection and sharing.
Work with Sales, Finance and Revenue Operations leadership to establish robust rules of engagement to govern sales processes and eliminate friction between the sales, customer success and product organizations.
Partner closely with sales, customer success and finance leadership to implement scalable, repeatable, data driven processes based on industry best practices around deal desk operations
Facilitate successful implementation and adoption of new processes within the sales and finance organization. Foster an ecosystem of continuous process improvement.
Partner with the Finance team to ensure customer deal desk agreements translate to sales orders and other customer agreements
Work with sales leaderships to review and identify key insights into the sales and finance process
Assist sales enablement with the focus on compressing new hire ramp time, improving overall sales productivity, and ensuring sales process consistency and efficiency.
Partner with Business Intelligence team to develop dashboards and reports leveraging existing technologies such as Hubspot and Qlik to ensure forecasting and reporting efforts are appropriately integrated with other planning processes within the company.
Work with Sales Leadership, Finance, and Operations to design sales quota and compensation incentive programs, and ongoing governance, that tie to company objectives, motivate our sales team to sell, and rewards them for doing so.


You will need:


Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, Finance Operations & Strategy or similar capacity for a SaaS or Fintech company and/or a foundational skill set in finance, financial services, or an analytical sales finance role
A proven track record in driving operational efficiency, sales reporting, and data analysis
Experience presenting to executives is a plus
Experience interacting and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Demonstrated ability to solve problems and provide analytical support
Flexibility and adaptability to shifting priorities
Eagerness to learn and an extreme capacity for attention to detail
You are analytical, resourceful, self-starter, great communicator, passionate, flexible, accountable, dependable, and organized.


You will get:


Stock Options
Full medical, dental, and vision insurance
401(k)
Opportunities for internal promotions
Strong and experienced leadership that supports your growth and success
Hybrid work schedule (2 days a week in office)
Free snacks, beverages, catered meals, happy hour and team events
Open concept and modern work environment
An inclusive, tight knit, and exciting environment culture that offers career and personal growth

About the team:

Capco is a fully independent, global management and technology consultancy. For nearly 20 years we have combined innovative thinking with deep industry knowledge to deliver business consulting, digital transformation and technology services to Finance and Energy markets. Our collaborative and efficient approach helps clients reduce costs and manage risk and regulatory change while increasing revenues. We are thinkers, innovators, and disruptors. We are small enough to care but large enough to matter.

About the Job:

As Technical Business Analyst, you will be involved with analysis, design, and consulting support, as well as developing an understanding of our clients’ strategic direction, issues, and project goals. You will bridge the gap between user-functionality and system developers and assist in documenting, evaluating, and translating business architectures and needs into IT applications.

What You’ll Get to Do:

Preparing, facilitating, documenting and participating in client meetings/workshops conducting a structured gathering, research, and analysis for developing and evaluating procedures, controls, user requirements, and functional specifications to identify gaps between the current state and future state
Creating business requirement documents (BRD’s) into use cases/functional specifications for customization
Requirements gathering, functional requirements, user stories, and documentation business/data/application/technology architectures, requirements and business rules
Business process models/design, logical data models, standards and guidance
Documenting and explaining problems and works to resolve software defects while ensuring technical compatibility and end-user satisfaction
Analyzing, developing and proposing enhancements to current business processes, reports and applications in order to optimize system effectiveness
Conducting customer interviews and producing meeting summaries
Conducting market/client research and industry analysis of requirements
Producing high-quality verbal and written consulting deliverables (including proposals, customer presentations, consulting reports) to effectively communicate project findings
Generating re-usable intellectual capital in the form of consulting methodology and templates, blueprints and business cases
Basic scripting and project plans

What You’ll Bring with You:

3+ years of Business Analyst experience
Experience working for a management consulting firm desired
SQL experience.
Background in financial services or energy a plus
Experience interviewing client executives to gather and document business requirements
Process mapping experience
Strong presentation skills
Experience writing project proposals
Ability to demonstrate project management skills and experience
Bachelor’s degree required; major in MIS, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business or Financial Engineering preferred
An advanced degree is desirable

Why Capco?

A career at Capco is a chance to help reshape the competitive landscape in financial services. We launch new banks, transform existing ones, and help our clients navigate complex change. As consultants, we work on the front-end business design all the way through to technology implementation.

We are the largest Financial Services focused consultancy in the world, serving everyone from global banks to emerging FinTechs, from strategy through digital transformation, design, business consulting, data and analytics, cyber, cloud, technology architecture, and engineering.

Capco is a young and growing firm. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset, and have minimal bureaucracy. We have no internal silos that get in the way of your career opportunities or ability to focus on our clients and make a difference to the business. We offer the opportunity for everyone to learn rapidly, take on tough challenges, and get promoted quickly. We take pride in our creative, collaborative, diverse, and inclusive culture, where everyone can #BYAW.

We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement, and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.

Ready to get started?

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.

OPS Group Description:
Partner Distribution Services is a global business unit specializing in the support of AB Sales, Product and the back offices of our retail, retirement and insurance Intermediaries.
OPS Job Description:
We are seeking a San Antonio based Business Analyst to join our ABIS Partner Distribution Services Department.
Describe the role:
We are looking for an individual to serve as a Business Analyst in the Partner Distribution Services Department within the Transfer Agency Operations. This person will be responsible for managing the relationship between AB and intermediary back offices to ensure daily operations, critical events and service matters are effectively coordinated. The person is expected to develop and maintain relationships with intermediary back offices, AB Product, ABI Sales, various ABIS teams and other groups, as needed to facilitate communication and coordination of initiatives between AB and the firms. The person in this role must be highly organized and have outstanding communication and relationship management skills.
Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:
DST TA2000 - Record keeping system for AllianceBernstein retail mutual fund accounts
DST SMARTDESK
DTCC Mutual Fund Profile
DTCC Mutual Fund Information Exchange
TA2000 Rumba - TA2000 Mainframe
AWD Automated Workflow Distribution (AWD) – Imaging and workflow utility for TA2000
StorQM - Web-enabled application-to extract daily reports
Microsoft Office Applications – with a heavy focus on EXCEL
The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Manage relationships, communication and initiatives with intermediary back offices, AB Product, ABI Sales and ABIS Ops
This person will be responsible for reaching out to firms (call campaigns) to obtain information AB may require as it pertains to various AB initiatives
Participate in various AB initiatives as needed, assess impact to and coordinate with intermediaries
Manage ad-hoc projects resulting from requests from our intermediaries or other internal AB groups. Examples of these requests include, but are not limited to broker conversions, omnibus conversions, complete RFPs. fund fact and “spec-pack” sheets, questionnaires, customized reporting and record-keeping for internal groups
Support AB intermediary oversight processes
Develop and present information related to AB initiatives and funds to internal and external clients as needed
Serve as a resource for escalated issues from intermediaries, ABI Sales or other ABIS groups
Become familiar with industry issues/trends affecting operations between intermediaries and AB and serve as a resource to PDS Management and other ABIS and AB Management groups
Maintain intermediary profile database
PDS management reporting as needed
Perform additional responsibilities as needed, based on department requirements
What makes this role unique or interesting (if applicable)?
The person in this diverse and fast-paced role will be exposed to a wide scope of business within our firm. They will be encouraged to be entrepreneurial and will be given the autonomy to manage and develop the assigned client relationships.
What is the professional development value of this role, i.e. what learning and professional growth does the role offer the candidate?
The person in this role will have an opportunity to demonstrate skills such as time management, project planning, relationship development, problem solving and communication. This person will be exposed to many areas within our firm and will become familiar with the processes of various groups over time. This role is considered a stepping stone for future leaders, relationship managers and senior business analysts.

Qualifications, Experience, Education:
Business or Finance degree is helpful for this role, but not required
Experience in a fast-paced environment in a supporting role for a vendor, client, or firm
Previous mutual fund operations experience is a plus, but not required
Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Outstanding time management and organizational skills with a proven ability to work independently and follow up to ensure tasks and other deliverables are completed
Strong attention to detail
Experience in problem solving
Ability to build relationships with external and internal clients of all levels

Ability to work collaboratively in a team setting
Candidate must be customer-focused and extremely flexible
Demonstrate the ability to further develop skills through training and as provided through coaching and feedback
Prior knowledge & experience in handling initiatives and/or projects
Special Knowledge (if applicable):
A strong level of knowledge regarding mutual fund operations are desired, but not required
People leadership and business operations management experience are desired, but not required

Interested in a career with both meaning and growth? Whether your abilities are in direct patient care or one of the many other areas of healthcare administration and support, everyone at Parkland works together to fulfill our mission: the health and well-being of individuals and communities entrusted to our care. By joining Parkland, you become part of a diverse healthcare legacy that’s served our community for more than 125 years. Put your skills to work with us, seek opportunities to learn and join a talented team where patient care is more than a job. It’s our passion.


Primary Purpose
The individual in the Business Intelligence Specialist role is a project leader, recognizing timelines and priorities, and organizing the work efforts of both small initiatives and departmental improvements. The BI Specialist may be entrusted with resources and personnel to complete objectives without supervision. In general, the BI Specialist has reached a level of mastery across multiple disciplines in the data management field which allows the ability to see big picture consequences to make tactical decisions. The BI Specialist generally has a strong interest or specific advanced knowledge of a complex concept or tool that is critical for the department, and often serves as the top-level technical expert in one of more highly specialized areas of systems analysis and reporting. The BI Specialist is expected to have strong time and project management skills, to have advanced speaking and communications skills, and to have the ability to think outside the box when designing solutions to both customer and departmental challenges. The BI Specialist proactively identifies areas of improvement within their scope of knowledge. The BI Specialist has attained a level of advanced knowledge or training to work independently not only on tasks assigned by supervisors, but also on problems outside the scope of daily work activities.


Minimum Specifications


Education
Must have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Masters preferred.


Experience
Must have six years of experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools, including Crystal reporting, WEBi reporting and dashboards.
Must have six years of SQL (Structured Query Language) server-based SQL coding or Oracle PL-SQL (Procedural Language/Structured Query Language) experience.
Must have a minimum of two years as a subject matter expert in a single reporting or data discipline.
Prefer previous experience within a healthcare organization.
Prefer previous experience with an Electronic Medical Record (EMR) application such as Eclipsys, Epic, Clarity, or Epic within a healthcare organization.


Equivalent Education and/or Experience
May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements.


Certification/Registration/Licensure
Prefer related certification(s) in Epic and/or Clarity.
Prefer related certification(s) in SAP data reporting.
Prefer related certification(s) in Cisco data management.
Prefer Category I Project Management Professional (PMP) certification by the Project Management Institute (other project management training considered).


Skills or Special Abilities
Must have an expert level knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language) / Oracle relational and multi-dimensional database structures, schemas, stored procedures, views, and queries.
Must be able to build and run SQL queries, Crystal reports, and use other reporting tools.
Must have an expert level knowledge of Reporting and Analytics.
Must have expert level knowledge regarding EMR, word processing, database, and spreadsheet software.
Must have an expert level knowledge of commonly used programming concepts, practices, and procedures within the Information Technology field.
Must have advanced knowledge of critical tools and concepts and can explain these concepts to others on the team.
Must have strong analytic and computer skills in addition to an extensive knowledge of database management and data analysis.
Must be able to develop system specifications and decision flows, in the form of flow charts or equivalent techniques, from written business requirements.
Must have experience with data modeling, warehouse design and virtual universe structures.
Must be able to demonstrate critical thinking skills, about system issues.
Must demonstrate an understanding of patient data and the use of this data in a healthcare environment, as applicable.
Must be able to accept verbal and/or written problems or direction from senior staff and business users and demonstrate an ability to prepare specifications that reflect provided information (with coaching from senior personnel).
Must have exceptional planning skills with a results-oriented record of achievement and the ability to set goals, meet deadlines, and evaluate results particularly regarding significant changes within an organization and with respect to the organization’s relationship with the community or marketplace.
Must have a high level of attention to detail, can manage multiple projects at once, and be able to demonstrate excellent analytical, organization and prioritization skills.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with customers, team members and IT management.
Must be a quick learner. Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to work in a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent time management skills and management reporting skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent discernment and assessment in professional decision-making.
Must be an independent worker and self-starter, having the ability to provide internal motivation and drive.
Must set high standards of performance for self.


Responsibilities
Performs root cause analysis or configuration overview for clinical leadership and succinctly and accurately relay findings or information as well as recommendations to leadership as needed.
Proactively identifies areas for improvement in applications and develop solutions for those problems outside of leadership-assigned projects or tasks.
Serve as a mentor for senior and intermediate analysts, providing them feedback on protocols, procedures, and other processes in place at Parkland.
Organizes the work effort for large initiatives (such as Meaningful Use, New Parkland Hospital, Epic Upgrade, 1115 Waiver, etc.) and ensures that timelines are met and that projects are implemented successfully.
Leads the design, development, and implementation of complex customer analytic solutions by applying an expert level understanding of Business Intelligence best practices
Applies an expert knowledge and understanding in systems and data analysis to conduct in-depth evaluation of source system data and processes. Uses industry standard data modeling and reporting tools to generate richly documented, creatively designed data models, reports, and other content as requested by leadership.
Facilitates communication and problem resolution with physicians & staff in both inpatient and outpatient settings.
Documents each step of development to ensure adequate communication within the team and customers.
Actively provides prompt responses to customer problems and inquiries. Makes the customer’s experience the priority in all operations.
Resolves ITSM incidents and requests independently within SLA timelines. Takes ownership and resolves complicated/code intensive incidents and requests.
Performs upgrades and/or routine maintenance for the report writing team.
Mentors and trains other team members by introducing them to new technologies, methods, and learning resources.
Handles conflict between team members, utilizing diplomacy, without allowing personal feelings to influence or impact the outcome negatively.
Models’ behavior for team members by following all department procedures (Weekly Status Reports, Customer Delivery, Customer Communications, Request Creation, etc.)


Job Accountabilities
Identifies ways to improve work processes and improve customer satisfaction. Makes recommendations to supervisor, implements, and monitors results as appropriate in support of the overall goals of the department and Parkland.
Stays abreast of the latest developments, advancements, and trends in the field by attending seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, actively participating in professional organizations, and/or maintaining certification or licensure. Integrates knowledge gained into current work practices.
Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws, and guidelines that impact the area. Develops effective internal controls designed to promote adherence with applicable laws, accreditation agency requirements, and federal, state, and private health plans. Seeks advice and guidance as needed to ensure proper understanding.


Parkland Health and Hospital System prohibits discrimination based on age (40 or over), race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability, national origin, marital status, political belief, or veteran status. As part of our commitment to our patients and employees’ wellness, Parkland Health is a tobacco and smoke-free campus.

The SAP FICO Analyst will directly support the IT related needs of the Finance and Accounting processes. The successful candidate will have experience in assistance with SAP business processes design, configuration, and testing within the context of both project and production support efforts. The resource will be responsible to support, investigate, and analyze enhancements to SAP modules – Finance and Controlling. Troubleshoot system issues, interfaces, and develop new systems capabilities, while supporting integration between SAP ERP and other systems. Should be a team player with excellent organizational and communication skills. Requires the ability to plan, design, configure, and troubleshoot issues. The role requires a high level of cross-functional communication and coordination amongst different groups supporting other SAP modules, and all departments and levels of management. The candidate must be detail oriented with adherence to company processes and procedures.

Requirements:
At least 5 + years of experience in SAP FICO Module including 1-2 full life cycle project implementations for these modules
Solid understanding of FICO modules - AP, AR, GL, Fixed Assets; Controlling – Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Profitability Analysis, Month End Processes
Design, customize, configure and testing of FI/CO modules. Understanding of Integration between SD and MM with FI.
Configure and Enhance SAP FICO Configurations & standard functionalities with a proven track record in architecting solutions in an integrated environment in SAP ECC 6.0
Should have experience with configurations, testing, developing functional specifications for developers
Bring in best practices in architecting, designing & supporting FICO Sub modules and other integrated processes
Perform detailed analysis of complex business process requirements and provide appropriate system solutions; identify, interpret, validate and document customer requirements
Develop functional specifications, solution designs, test plans, review technical specs in collaboration with customers, developers and technical architects.
Monitor and resolve production issues and requests submitted by users through ticketing and service requests.
Responsible to drive changes and enhancements through the change management process, including project management, communication with stakeholders, users and developers, performing functional unit tests, coordinating user acceptance testing, cutover tasks and ongoing support.
Configure and Enhance Configured various components in the SAP FI/CO like Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable (AP) and General Ledger Accounts; Configured the Automatic payment program for Intercompany automatic account posting, running program for Check management, open item clearing and down payments
Knowledge of User Exits and solid understanding of Configuration of Enterprise Structure, containing Company Code, Chart of Accounts, controlling area, Business area, Valuation area and Credit Control area
Competencies:
Action Oriented: Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and Enthusiasm.
Ensures Accountability: Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Decision Quality: Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.
Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Sciences (CS) or Management Information Systems (MIS) or Industrial Engineering or Related Fields
Minimum 5 years of SAP Implementation & Configuration experience in areas such as SAP FI AP, FI AR, FI Financial Accounting, FI GL/New GL, FI SPL, FI Fixed Asset, Treasury, CO CCA, CO Product Costing, CO-PCA, CO-PA, CO-Internal Orders
Minimum 5 years of SAP Experience with Integration of SAP FICO with MM, SD, FSCM, and other integrated Modules. Experience with FSCM Dispute management, Collections and Credit management modules.
Must have 5 years of experience leading SAP system solutions implementation including design, configuration, development, testing, and Implementation
Experience in working with interfaces and integration with third party systems
Experience in conduction workshops and freeze the requirements
Experience in preparation of blueprints and solution documents; Experience in writing functional specifications
Performs functional / analysis, requirements definition, and system configuration.
Previous experience in identifying the impact on existing configuration and determining the technical requirements to support the organization**s business processes within the SAP system.
Strong SAP support application process knowledge in Finance modules, GL, AR – OTC, AP – PTP, AA, CO – CCA and PCA.
Knowledge and experience working with SAP tables, sets, validations, and substitution rules.
Business process analysis and redesign experience: strong business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and support design implementation.
Experience with SAP custom solutions and RICEF knowledge preferred.
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support.

Who We Are

At Freshpet, our goal is to change the way people nourish their pets forever. We strive to strengthen the bond between people and our pets so that we both live longer, healthier, and happier lives while being kind to the planet. We believe that if we can create fresh, real foods that pets love and help them live healthier lives that their pet parents will also enjoy the many benefits of a rich life shared with a pet.

We started off with a mission to change the way pet parents feed dogs and cats, but we also wanted to be a company that had a thoughtful approach to how we operate. We wanted to do things differently, make great products but be gentle to the planet, good to the people who touch our business, and leave a positive impact with everything we do. We work hard every day to ensure that the original vision is met, starting with making the highest quality foods in our kitchens to running our business with integrity, transparency, and social and environmental responsibility. IT’S AMAZING WHAT CAN HAPPEN WHEN YOU START COMPLETELY FRESH!

What You Will Do

As the BI Analyst, you will support and work with Freshpet leadership teams to develop functional requirements, design reports, implement dashboards, and support the data engineering team for the Microsoft Power BI platform. You will successfully evangelize business intelligence throughout the organization to align with and support data visualization and analytics solutions that involve web, reporting and dashboarding.

How You Will Make an Impact

Collaborate with both executive leaders and management teams to define reporting metrics, dashboards and KPI’s heavily driven by business goals, mid-term plans, and reporting against long-range goals
Consolidate requirements from multiple departments to define standard reporting measures and definitions to enforce organization-wide reporting consistency
Define standard templates and reusable components for reports and dashboards, collaborating with data architects and leadership to create and maintain a data catalog
Transform raw data into actionable information to facilitate informed decision-making for stakeholders across sales, manufacturing, logistics, supply chain (forecasting) and finance
Learning and understanding the application, and use of, Microsoft D365 at the manufacturing floor level
Learning the theory and application of D365 processes as it applies to integration of the manufacturing execution systems (MES) or RF Smart
Assist in building and supporting learning models, including providing written guidance and implementation plans. Conduct demonstrations and provide one-on-one technical assistance as needed
Utilize automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Identify and resolve coding errors, remove corrupted data, and address related problems
Perform data analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
Review reports and performance indicators to filter data and identify and correct code problems
Development and Maintenance dashboards associated with PowerBI/MES Systems
Learn the theory of operation for both roasted meals and rolls for better data interpretation/understanding
Contribution and Chartered membership of the Focused Improvement Pillar
Develop Standard dashboards within the Daily Management Systems

What You Will Bring

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred or combination of education and relevant work experience
5+ years of experience in developing and administering Microsoft Power BI solutions
Experience in the manufacturing field preferred
Proficiency in preparing reports for management that highlight trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Experience using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets for diagnosis and prediction purposes
Familiarity with business functions to assess and compare business performance over time
Knowledge of consumer goods industry, information architecture, user experience, and ISAE compliance
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Effective communication skills in both verbal and written forms
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Demonstrated experience in designing and developing customized reports, dashboards, and scorecards using Power BI/MES Systems

What We Offer

At Freshpet, we offer a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental and vision insurance, basic and optional life insurance, short- and long-term disability protection, flexible spending accounts, and a 401(k) plan with company match, paid parental leave, pet insurance, tuition assistance, a generous PTO plan and so much more!

Our Commitment to a Diverse Workforce:

At Freshpet, we embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, sex, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

Freshpet aims to foster, cultivate and preserve a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. Our employees are our most valuable assets. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well. Freshpet is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Disclaimers

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Freshpet as a result of the referral or through other means.

As the Senior Business Analyst - CPQ, you will form partnerships with business users across departments and build expertise that will help you prioritize, gather, and document Oracle CPQ requirements related to new configurable product launches, current configurable product updates, continuous improvement initiatives, and clarifying requirements to implement bug fixes.

Who We Want

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders, senior management, and their teams.

What You Will Do

Requirements gathering, testing, and documentation of Oracle CPQ Product Configuration, Commerce, Document Designer, and Pricing Functions focusing on the addition of new product lines to an existing Oracle CPQ Cloud implementation, documenting Sales Bill of Material requirements and Manufacturing Bill of Material requirements.
Work with business department stakeholders, prioritizes enhancement requests related to Oracle CPQ and SAP Variant Configurator.
Consult with Sales, Marketing, Production, and R&D Project managers on specific product line needs.
Learn Stryker’s implementation of Oracle CPQ and becomes a subject matter expert of CPQ end user functionality.
Review upcoming Oracle CPQ Cloud version release notices and collaborates with the CPQ development team to document the required changes.
Collaborate with internal developers and external consultants to create project plans and participate in unit testing and End User Testing.
Lead business process mapping and requirements gathering sessions with business stakeholders.
Work with middleware teams to document interfaces in and out of CPQ in clear and concise business language.
Track CPQ project progress and reports status, issues, and roadblocks to the responsible R&D project manager for a new product launch.
Share industry best practices around Configure-to-Order systems and business processes.
Drive continuous process improvement activities and initiatives.

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent required.
2+ years of relevant experience.
Knowledge of Product Configuration & Rules, Commerce Process, Document Designer and Pricing functionality of Oracle CPQ Cloud or other CPQ systems required.
Experience developing Oracle CPQ Configurators is preferred but not required.
Experience administering Oracle CPQ (formerly BigMachines) preferred.
Experience building manufacturing bills of material using SAP Variant Configurator preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of commercial processes and manufacturing processes including Assemble-to-Order and the differentiation between Sales BOMs and Manufacturing BOMs preferred.
Knowledge of Oracle CPQ integrations with Salesforce.com, Model N and SAP S/4 preferred.

The Position
Job Title
Systems Analyst II
Job Description
SUMMARY
The Channel Systems Analyst will evaluate business requirements for multi-platform technology and digital applications, assist in the delivery of new or modified systems enhancements and integration solutions, and provide application support to those systems and solutions. This position will collaborate with stakeholders and serve as the intermediary for the lines of business, most areas of IT, and digital banking partners. Mentors junior-level analysts and ensures compliance with company policies and procedures. Communicate with Bank department managers and senior leadership to promote efficient and approved workflow.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS)
Manages vendor relationships and holds vendors accountable to their deliverables
Understands vendor roadmaps, manages relationships, feedback and escalations
Participate in UX planning for improving existing processes and building new features and functionalities.
Building and maintaining the team backlog that is prioritized based on the business value and other key business drivers
Partner with other business leaders to develop stories through an Agile process and is ultimately accountable for signing off and accepting the story has met the expected requirements
Independently leverages Digital or Technology research, business and market intelligence, and data-driven insights to identify opportunities, propose solutions, and improve performance
Provide second and/or third level support for daily maintenance and support of applications including system administration and resolution of issues.
Assists in maintaining and enforcing IT policies. Documents standard operating procedures, workflows and systems.
Document results of activities using the appropriate processes in accordance with the Bank’s documentation and project methodology standards.
Participate in the analysis and evaluation of current business and system processes, interfaces and workflow.
Excellent trouble shooting skills, familiarity with test tools, and a drive to quickly fix issues
ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Adherence to all First United Policies and Procedures
Complete all required compliance exams on an annual basis
Travel up to 10% of the time, possible
Performs other duties as assigned
EMPLOYEE SPECIFICATIONS
In order to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline from an accredited four-year college or university or 7 years of related experience in lieu of a degree
Seven (7) years Digital/Technology Product Management experience, to include experience in innovation, user experience, process engineering, analytics, and/or research/testing OR an advanced degree and 6 years of experience.
Four (4) or more years of business analyst support with a major digital banking system acting as liaison between the business units, technical staff and/or system provider.
Three (3) years’ experience working in an Agile environment preferred
Certified Scrum Product Owner preferred
Comprehensive knowledge of Technology/Digital products and emerging technology platforms
Robotic Process Automation Experience Preferred
Proven track record to effectively develop, influence, present and communicate highly complex business, digital, or technology concepts to cross-functional teams, non-technical users and senior leadership.
Strong attention to detail, deadlines with a focus on effective communication to peers and senior leaders
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is frequently required to stand, climb or balance, talk and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment
The characteristics of the work environment described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned by supervisor to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst II - Decision Support Svcs
Job Description:
Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements
Summary

The Business Intelligenca Analyst II supports system-level analytics activities of a large integrated delivery system. Work product directly impacts information delivered to the Harris Health's Board of Trustees and Commissioners Court as well as the state of Texas and CMS. Participates in complex projects and initiatives across the system, which significantly impact business results, and require a large degree of cross-functional participation/coordination. The position supports the implementation of Finance information systems. This position works in close collaboration with IT Business Intelligence supporting many of the same or similar projects and deliverables. In concert with IT, the position and actively contributes, on the Finance side, to organizational initiatives in the development of business intelligence (BI) tools.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelor's Degree in IT, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline preferred; or four (4) years of Business Intelligence work-related experience required in lieu of degree.

Work Experience : Three (3) years of experience in a Senior Business Analyst capacity.


Analysis, design and development of enterprise-class software
Experience with data mapping in a data warehousing environment
Experience in analyzing source systems and performing data mapping between disparate databases / data sources. In addition, working experience in performing gap analysis of the production data to validate business requirements.
Healthcare experience.

Equipment Operated: Knowledge of EMR/Epic, Clarity, SAP Business Object tools (Business Intelligence), Oracle SQL, Allscripts EPSi Enterprise Analyst and Decision Support Suite, PeopleSoft.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

Communication Skills:
Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)
Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)
Writing /Composing: Correspondence / Reports

Other Skills:

Analytical, Design, Mathematics, Medical Terms, Research, Statistical Deployment, P.C., MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, Project Mgmt., Prod. Support, Development

Advanced Education:

Bachelor's Degree Major: Bachelor's Degree in IT, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline preferred; or four (4) years of Business Intelligence work-related experience required in lieu of degree.

Work Schedule: Flexible, Eligible to Telecommute

Other Requirements: Knowledge of State, Medicare/ Medicaid, and other external regulatory agencies, reimbursement regulations and methodologies. Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry’s technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Physical Requirements : General Office Demands

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area, you will work in a growing global team, providing restaurant industry expertise and insights whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support your topic in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts for the topic/sector, in conjunction with business leaders, supporting marketing efforts, conferences and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will assist with on-boarding, training and guiding junior colleagues and share best practices within the team.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in four sub-sectors: consumer goods, retail, and fashion & luxury.

YOU'RE GOOD AT


Ability to work autonomously and with a strong entrepreneurial thinking spirit. The candidate will need to develop a strong business-building focus in order to operate/influence effectively senior stakeholders in an international matrix organization and identify where the Knowledge Team can be involved to better support case teams
Solving client problems through formulating relevant research and/or analytical approaches in the restaurant Industry
Codifying knowledge and maintaining assets and tools for the restaurant topic based on different client contexts
Communicating with senior stakeholders, in a credible and confident way
Working collaboratively and effectively in a group dynamic often virtual, proficient in agile ways of working
Flexibility and bringing a curious and creative mindset, open to new things and able to propose innovative ideas
Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)


1-2+ years of consulting experience in restaurant, foodservice, consumer packaged goods or retail industry required; candidates with consulting experience preferred
In lieu of consulting experience, 2+ years minimum consumer industry experience required with preference in:
Experience at top QSR, Fast Casual and Casual Dining players in a corporate role or a Restaurant Technology/Startup organization in roles focused on growth strategy, franchise development, business analytics, artificial intelligence or digitalization/automation of the employee and customer experience, loyalty, personalization, etc.
Experience in a business analyst, market researcher or insights & analytics role at leading investment bank, private equity or other consumer focused Fortune 500 companies
Experience at leading consumer behavior or marketing analytics firm
Experience in advanced analytics, cross-industry data and expertise development focused on consumer topics
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView
Bachelor's Degree required (advanced degree preferred)
Fluency in English; other languages requested in certain locations
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills to interact with internal and external stakeholder while working in a global collaborative team environment

YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

Job Title: Epic Clinical Systems Analyst III - Lumens

Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Healthcare Information Technology experience.

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire


This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

What We Can Offer You:

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

Let's Stay Connected:

Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

Job Title: HR Operations Associate Analyst - Entry Level
Job Description:
JOB ID: 653217BR

Date posted: Sep. 25, 2023




Description:

Who We Are: At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics our products play an important role in the national security of the United States and more than 70 other countries, ensuring peace and stability around the world. Highly trained and specialized personnel and facilities are key to the company's unrivaled success in the aeronautics industry. Our team of more than 25,000 has pre-eminent expertise in advanced aircraft design and production, modification and support, stealth technology, and systems integration.

Your Impact: As a member of the Year One Experience Team, you will impact the experience of thousands of new employees’ careers from first year Interns to high level Executives. If you are passionate about how casing Lockheed Martin's unique company culture, mission, and values to our newest team members, this may be the perfect role for you! Our On-Boarding function is in the midst of creating positive large-scale change and is seeking a team member to help us continue to lead by example and implement collaborative new hire strategies while sharing the resources needed for all new employees to make a smooth and positive transition.

A Day in the Life: As the first impression of Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Headquarters, you will be essential in shaping the new employee experience beginning before day one. From coordinating incoming employees Day-1 instructions, New Employee Orientation (NEO), new employee online internal engagement, and to creating targeted e-learning content and more, you will have the opportunity to opportunity to engage in a variety of efforts within our On-Boarding Center. Although your primary focus will be to ensure an efficient, positive, and seamless transition for our employees, may also find yourself:

Contacting incoming employees prior to start date to answer questions and assist with completion of pre onboarding documents.
Executing Homeland Security procedures, I-9s and eVerify - Provide information on On-Boarding Center policies and procedures.
Open and close OBC facility, ensuring rooms are secure, computers are updated, and room prep complete.
Participating in strategic initiatives that will continue to enhance the new employee experience and further streamline the On-Boarding processes.
Developing relationships with SME’s across business functions to help ensure up to date and relevant content for our new hires.
Supporting the implementation of New Employee Orientation to ensure new hires, rehires, recalls, and transfers are supported and engaged about Lockheed Martin's mission, values, and culture.

About You: In this role, your human resources experience coupled with your ability to positively engage with those around you, will help you succeed. Your ability to seek out answers to the unknown and the passion to persevere when encountering resistance is what sets you apart. As a critical thinker, you can make a positive impact by providing data-driven people solutions that are efficient, effective, and flexible. Most likely, you'll be in your element, presenting to a variety of audiences and communicate skillfully when speaking to your work.


Basic Qualifications:



Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources or related field
Demonstrated ability and experience as a facilitator or presenter
Ability to work independently and execute projects with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated experience using relevant software tools/solutions, e.g., Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project), SharePoint, Slack, Zoom, Box, etc.

Desired Skills:



At least two years of experience in one of the following areas: On-Boarding administration, Human Resources Business Partner, Employee Relations, Talent Management, Organizational Development
Prior experience with applicant tracking systems such as Kenexa/BrassRing, processingI-9/ eVerify
Prior experience developing, recording, and producing e-learning content
Strong communication skills both oral and written and customer service orientation
Project experience, including developing project plans, identifying stakeholders, preparing corresponding communication plans, identifying milestones, deadlines, and metrics to assess outcomes/results
Continuous Improvement Training/Mindset
Change Management Training/Experience
Strong analytical skills
Working knowledge of Lockheed Martin policies and procedures

Clearance Level:

None


Other Important Information You Should Know




Expression of Interest:

By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.


Ability to Work Remotely:

Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.


Work Schedules:

Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.


Schedule for this Position:

4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.


At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. IT Business Analyst

EIS is one of the most highly regarded environmental remediation and demolition firms in the U.S. EIS is ranked among Engineering News Record's Top 20 Firms for Asbestos Abatement and in the Top Specialty Contractors. More information can be found at www.EISholdings.com.

Essential Functions:

The IT Business Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements and translating them into functional specifications for IT solutions. They work closely with stakeholders from various areas of the company to ensure that technology solutions align with business goals and objectives.

The Business Analyst will play an essential role in improving our business processes, driving efficiency, and implementing new system solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Requirements Gathering:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs and document detailed business requirements.
Conduct interviews, surveys, and workshops to elicit and prioritize requirements.
Analyze existing processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.

2. Documentation:

Create clear and concise documentation, including business requirement documents, functional requirement documents, use cases, and user stories.
Develop process flow diagrams, data models, and system diagrams to illustrate the proposed solutions.

3. Analysis:

Evaluate the feasibility of proposed solutions and assess potential risks and impacts.
Perform cost-benefit analysis to determine the ROI of proposed projects.
Identify and recommend alternative solutions when necessary.

4. Communication:

Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and IT teams, facilitating communication and understanding.
Ensure that all stakeholders are informed about project progress and changes.
Present findings and recommendations to management and project teams.

5. Testing and Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with the business to develop test plans and test cases based on business requirements.
Participate in user acceptance testing and ensure that the delivered solutions meet business requirements.

6. Training and Support:

Provide level two support for EIS business systems.
Develop training programs and materials and conduct user classroom training as needed.

7. Change Management:

Assist in developing change management strategies and plans to ensure smooth adoption of new technology solutions.

8. Continuous Improvement:

Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and recommend enhancements or adjustments.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to provide innovative solutions.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or equivalent years of experience.
Minimum of 3 years experience as a Business Analyst or similar role in a project-based organization.
Prior experience with Acumatica is preferred.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Travel:

This role requires regular travel to the company's multiple facilities approximately 40% of the time.

We offer a dynamic collaborative work environment with a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, paid time off, paid holiday's and a 401(k) plan.

This role plays a pivotal part in decision-making, problem-solving, and driving growth and innovation, serving as the right-hand to the CEO and business unit presidents.

The Operations and Strategy Analyst is a critical position within the organization, contributing to DerbySoft’s long-term success and growth by aligning operations with strategic objectives and ensuring efficient execution. The role requires a combination of analytical thinking, leadership, and a deep understanding of the online travel industry and competitive landscape.

This position will share at least 80% KPIs with the CEO.
