JOB SUMMARY:

The Global Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting supply chain, global operations and EHSS with analytics and reporting: from analyzing estimates and quotations data, to procurement and logistics data, planning and inventory data, to generation of demand management reports and supporting S&IOP process, compliance programs and EHSS. This position ensures goals, objectives, actions, strategies, and tactics produce the desired results consistent with the needs of the organization and attainment of Company and Department key performance indicators and targets. This position is responsible for developing data-driven solutions to optimize operations, EHSS and supply chain operations, increase efficiency, and reduce costs. This role supports data generation, analytics, complex reporting, dashboards and scorecards administration and maintenance. This position plays a crucial role in optimizing the procurement process for direct and indirect goods and services. This position is responsible for analyzing procurement activities and assisting in compliance reporting and identifying cost-saving opportunities. This position collaborates with cross-functional teams to drive efficiency, minimize risk, and achieve the organization's goals.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

This job description represents only the primary areas of responsibility; specific position assignments will vary depending on the needs of the department. To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Generates data, analytics, reporting.  Identifies, visualizes, and analyzes data from a variety of sources to obtain business insights and provide reporting analytics.  Develops clear data analyses, visualizations, and stories that identify trends and issues, drive actions with data that produce favorable business outcomes. Conducts statistical analyses and builds predictive and prescriptive models to support data'driven decision making.  Provides analytical support across supply chain disciplines such as spend, performance, demand management, inventory management, capacity management and others.  Analyzes supply chain data and identify areas for improvement.  Builds Should-Cost and Total Cost of Ownership economic models for materials and services.  Develops and maintains dashboards, scorecards, and reports to track KPIs and provide insights to management for EHSS, Operations and Supply Chain.  Provides support to management team and senior leadership.  Develops processes and tools to measure key performance indicators.  Develops and implements predictive analytical models to optimize operations and reduce costs such as optimization models for inventory management and others and evaluate leading indicators.  Monitors, analyzes, interprets data, and report industry trends to identify new opportunities for improvement and cost reduction.  Assesses external market trends and conditions to identify opportunities and risks in managed spend categories.  Provides monthly analysis of Company spend to enable informed decision-making.  Monitors and evaluates risks.  Analyzes data to provide a variety of reports such as: inventory reports to optimize inventory levels, lead times reports, safety stocks, MOQ’s, forecast consumption and accuracy, supplier spend data and others. Develop and create schedules for products and services.  Extracts data, analyzes, and prepares reports to measure key supplier performance-to-plan. Provides reports on supplier performance, recommends continuous improvement opportunities.  Support Supplier Performance Management process and S&IOP process. Identifies new Demand and Supply forecasting techniques or technologies to improve overall S&IOP process. Support the full integration of operations into the S&IOP process. Partner with the finance organization to link S&IOP process with financial forecasts.  Conduct comprehensive analysis of direct and indirect procurement data, including spend analysis, market trends, supplier performance, and cost optimization opportunities. Gathers data and analyzes company spend, supply market data, and other related commercial information to drive value across supply chain activities and assists in identifying sourcing. Provides analytical support for category sourcing initiatives, contract negotiations, and bid evaluations.  Support EHSS and Company real estate management with development of dashboards, scorecards, and tracking analytics.  Developing tools and processes to improve the efficiency of analytical work. Develops, documents, and implements processes and systems in support of company goals. Creates specifications for system enhancements when necessary.  Collaborate with representatives from EHSS, Accounts Payable, Finance, Supply Chain, IT to continually seek advancement of integrated systems and drive operational excellence.  Leverage ERP systems knowledge to identify and prioritize areas of greatest opportunity for improvement and applications of data analysis.  Advance best practices for use of business intelligence and other data analytics tools. Identify, prioritize, and solve high-impact business problems.  Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in data science and analytics, engineering, mathematics/statistics, business or major in related quantitative discipline. Master’s degree in related quantitative discipline preferred.  Data analysis statistical modeling experience with strong background in supply chain modeling, decision support tools development.  Experience with analytical programming languages such as SQL preferred.  Experience administering corporate level dashboards and scorecards.  ERP experience (Epicor, D365 preferred).  Demonstrated experience with business intelligence software Power BI, SharePoint, advanced Excel user knowledge and knowledge of building Macros preferred.  Familiarity with Hyperion, TM1 preferred.  5 years’ relevant data analytics experience required.  Previous experience as Data Scientist preferred.  Functional knowledge of planning and supply chain (i.e., planning, procurement, finished good supply chain) with focus on data analytics and ability to develop quantitative models in a supply chain context.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Strong project management skills that demonstrate the ability to initiate, prioritize and complete projects on time.  Excellent verbal, written communication skills and report presentation skills.  Industrial equipment manufacturing experience preferred such as: pumps, motors, valves, raw materials, actuators, welding, machining, painting, fabrication, resin, and fiberglass reinforced plastic.  Experience with ISO requirements and quality standards preferred.  Lean Six Sigma experience preferred.  Experience with supply chains with multiple locations preferred.  Microsoft Office experience including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Teams.

LICENSING/CERTIFICATIONS:

 Data Science certification preferred.  CPIM, APICS or ISM certification preferred.  Green Belt Lean Six Sigma certification preferred.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

International air travel may be required, as necessary; must have ability to travel across borders

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.

Come join the Costco Wholesale IT family. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.

Business Analyst will work closely with end users, user experience designers, business unit representatives, development architects/engineers, quality assurance, and others in all stages of the project lifecycle, including discovery, design, development, testing, and implementation.

This position will be responsible for developing detailed business requirements, process flow diagrams, user journeys, along with other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The individual in this role will be involved in program/project implementations, as well as support multiple customers and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle to help realize business benefits and define a set of business requirements and user journeys that will translate into valuable business solutions and technology systems.

If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined

ROLE

Defines and communicates requirements, risks, and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.

Collaborates with the QA Team to ensure acceptance criteria are easily translatable to test scripts.

Leads and participates in User Acceptance Testing/demos for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.

Assists the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional or non-functional specifications.

Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved, obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts, and manages changes and conflicts during the requirements gathering process.

Prepares artifacts in a clear, explicit, and presentable format.

Possesses product knowledge and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively propose solutions.

Identifies, builds, and manages stakeholder relationships (i.e., business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members, and management leaders).

Evaluates project complexity, assumptions, constraints, and dependencies to determine the appropriate business analysis approach.

Leads in requirements gathering and project scoping.

Manages product requests for enhancements and makes recommendations/provides feedback to the development team for enhancement implementation.

Supports the business post go-live and creates and/or assists in the training of the process in the new system.

Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.

Identifies opportunities for streamlining and increasing effectiveness through continuous process improvement.

Stakeholder and team interaction:

Determines business influence and relationship needs.

Builds and manages business relationships including business partners, end users, suppliers, customers, project team members, and management leaders.

Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions.

Elicitation and communication:

Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements, journeys, and other artifacts.

Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders.

Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements.

Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format.

Leads and participates in Business and User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements.

Requirements management process:

Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors.

Ensures that all requirements and journeys support the delivery of business value, fulfill goals and objectives, and meet stakeholder needs.

Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences.

Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements.

Conducts competitive analysis research to better understand prevalent interaction solutions.

Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions.

Manages requirements, traceability, and future reuse.

Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.

REQUIRED

Minimum 8 years’ Business Analysis and ecommerce experience.

Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation and stakeholder management.

Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation.

High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition).

Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as a positive attitude.

Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills.

Proven leadership skills; demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.

Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency.

Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.

Able to work independently.

Excellent organizational and planning skills.

Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.

Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables.

Proven experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies.

Strong process knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles.

Experience with executing project governance, including change control and issue/risk management.

Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.).

Ability and willingness to travel globally as needed.

Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including evening, weekend, and holidays; 24x7x365 operations; able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams.

Recommended

BA in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, or equivalent.

Professional business analysis certifications, such as CBAP or CCBA.

2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge.

Experience in Ecommerce Solutions, specifically SAP Commerce Platforms.

Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems, specifically Logistics Reply.

Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions.

Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics.

Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.

Required Documents

Cover Letter
Resume

Position Title: Sales Operations Analyst (P2)

Company Summary

Crown Castle is the nation’s largest provider of shared communications infrastructure: towers, small cells and fiber. Whenever you make a call, track a workout or stream music and videos, we’re the ones providing the communications infrastructure that makes it possible to transform the way we live and work. From 5G and the internet of things to drones, autonomous vehicles and AR/VR, we enable the technologies that help people stay safe, connected and ready for the future. Crown Castle is publicly traded on the S&P 500, and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the US.

Position Summary:

The Sales Operations Analyst leads data-informed projects that support sales leaders to maximize the productivity and effectiveness of the commercial organization. The analyst collects requirements to diagnose business opportunities and works cross-functionally to interpret, analyze, and make recommendations for data-driven business decisions.

Essential Job Functions

Leads requirements gathering with sales leaders and internal partners to understand their needs, shapes opportunity definition and co-creates pathways for resolution.
Develops analytical solutions and identify data trends by creating dashboards that generate actionable insights. Provides recommendations on reporting data insights and trends to better support business objectives.
Develops operational solutions that meet business objectives. Understands business processes and acts as subject matter expert on department’s use of systems, reports & tools.
Support sales teams for GTM activities including sales forecasting, customer segmentation, quota analysis, territory planning, account assignment and governance, growth strategy, and other related activities.
Develops process improvements to remove manual processes. Partners with Digital Transformation for process solutions or system enhancements.
Performs analysis and insights to support sales leaders in making data-driven decisions, reviewing trends, and applying a different approach/resolution.
Assesses and implements improvements to sales back-office processes by supporting internal sales team. Identify gaps and determine best practice to work efficiently and effectively to deliver best care to customers.
Provides recurring and ad hoc reporting to address business needs and identify commercial opportunities.
Oversees new sales programs, contests, and special projects (including requirements gathering, program planning and implementation).



Education/Certifications

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required.



Experience/Minimum Requirements

Five (5) years sales, project management, finance, or data analysis experience, preferably in the wireless or telecommunications industry



Other Skills/Abilities:

Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into business requirements
Understanding of metrics and their use to drive behavior and process change
Ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders, executive management, and cross-functional partners through written and verbal methods and ability to communicate complex concepts simply
Ability to collaborate with geographically distributed stakeholders with varying priorities and multiple projects
Ability to influence conversations and work through building relationships, thoughtful framing of issues, and building influence through excellent work
Ability to develop creative, data-driven solutions to complex commercial problems
Advanced quantitative and analytical skills, combined with the ability to formulate insights, present a compelling case for action, and deliver expert advice and recommendations
Knowledge of the financial drivers of our business and that of our customers
Excellent time and project management skills
In depth knowledge of Microsoft products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Dynamics 365, Access, etc.)
Experience with other business intelligence platforms and programming languages is a plus



Organizational Relationship

Reports to: Sales Operations Manager

Title(s) of direct reports (if applicable): N/A

Working Conditions: This role falls into our hybrid work model working in the office on Monday through Thursday. On Fridays, teammates on the hybrid schedule will have the option to work from the office or home. There is an expectation of collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter that could require travel.

Additional Information: We offer a total benefits package and professional growth development for teammates in any stage of their career. Along with caring for our teammates, we’re an active member in the communities where we live, work and do business. We have a responsibility to give back, which we do through our Connected by Good program. Giving back allows us to improve public spaces where people connect, promote public safety and advance access to education and technology.

Position Summary

The Director of Business Intelligence is a key member of the technology leadership team and serves as the Company’s analytics thought leader. This leader will develop, plan, and implement a technology strategy that delivers optimal returns on investment in coordination with the organization’s goals and core values with a focus on a “customer service” orientation.

Areas of responsibility include strategic leadership, team management, technical leadership around data management / ETL processes, end user reporting and analytics needs as well as project prioritization and management.

The Director will bring a track record of success in setting the strategic data and analytics direction in a multi-unit, franchised enterprise by driving innovation and building a competitive advantage based on strategic information.

The role is located in Addison, TX and this role requires the ability to be present in the office at least three days per week.




Key objectives

Lead the Business Intelligence team through data integration, storage, reporting, analytics, monitoring and compliance phases
Guide information strategy for customer, finance, marketing and other key data areas
Build and maintain Franchisee relationships; Earn respect of franchisees and cultivate strong relationships; navigate challenging situations with professionalism and confidence
Offer creative and practical solutions; Utilize creativity and innovation in problem solving and applying appropriate methodologies relevant to the complexity of the challenge
Understand future opportunities; Closely monitor changes with data technologies and identify ways the company can improve and implement plans to achieve these objectives
Maintain a high performing team; Continually assess and lead a talented, flexible, high performing BI function that has a high sense of urgency, is customer oriented, is responsive, and communicates effectively and manage the organization with a lean, ‘player / coach’ approach

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & DESIRED OUTCOMES




Serve as the thought leader, business partner and team mentor for the full data & analytics lifecycle

Collaborate with leadership to identify opportunities for leveraging data to gain a competitive advantage
Develop and execute the business intelligence strategy aligned with the organization's goals and objectives
Lead and manage BI team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities to team members
Own BI‐related budgeting, planning and procurement, including developing business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for spending and initiatives
Oversee data integration processes, ensuring the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from various sources to maintain a reliable data infrastructure
Ensure data pipelines are efficient, scalable, and maintain data integrity while optimizing priorities, delivery speed and related value-based spend
Ensure that data and analytics practices comply with relevant data protection and privacy regulations and security standards and protocols
Own and drive support processes around data / BI platforms, with an eye towards continuous improvement



IDEAL EXPERIENCE

Experience as BI/Analytics Director at a high growth company with a proven track record of high impact

Track-record of building and leading highly effective BI teams with a customer service and partnering mindset
Experience building strong stakeholder relationships across departments
Depth of experience selecting and implementing suitable technology for efficient data loading, governance and reporting capabilities required
Experience in building at a metrics-driven company (especially Private Equity owned) is ideal



PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS

Driving Results

Organized, urgent, and accountable: gets stuff done
Highly analytical mind-set; ROI and data-driven decision maker; has strong problem-solving and conceptual skills with the ability to quickly analyze and synthesize to support informed decision-making
Sets continually higher goals that are ambitious but realistic for self and team, geared to organizational objectives

Collaborating and Influencing

Presents effectively and persuasively with composure, building trust and credibility with various audiences
Excellent project management skills with the ability to balance multiple priorities and key stakeholders
Ability to work across the organization to get buy-in from the whole team on important initiatives and holds people accountable for results

Leading People

Collaborates and openly debates with the team to manage projects, solve problems, discuss challenging issues or learn more about critical issues as a group
Periodically reviews team progress against plans, focuses attention beyond the project to the full year and beyond



QUALIFICATIONS

15+ years of experience as BI/Analytics leader at growth companies with a proven track record of high impact
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Strategic thinking and the ability to align BI initiatives with business objectives
Strong communication and presentation skills, with a focus on understanding and communicating the company’s core business
Strong leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and guide a diverse team
Proficiency in BI tools such as Redshift, Snowflake, Tableau, QlikView, QuickSight or similar platforms
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience in data visualization and statistical analysis
Knowledge of relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices

Job Title: Business System Analyst with API Microservices
Job Description:
Business System Analyst with API Microservices, Salesforce Service Cloud

Dallas, TX (onsite, could be hybrid in future)

12 Months

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed requirements for API integrations, microservices, and Salesforce enhancements.
Leverage deep knowledge of API design and microservices architecture to identify opportunities for system integration and optimization.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of Salesforce platform capabilities and limitations, enabling the alignment of business processes with Salesforce solutions.
Analyze data from various sources, including Salesforce and other systems, to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive informed decision-making.
Identify inefficiencies in current processes and workflows, recommending and implementing improvements using APIs and microservices as appropriate.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of business and technical requirements, use cases, and system configurations.
Serve as a bridge between business stakeholders and the development team, ensuring effective and clear communication throughout the project lifecycle.
Participate in testing and validation of API integrations, microservices, and Salesforce configurations to ensure they meet business requirements and quality standards.
Support change management initiatives, helping stakeholders adapt to new technologies, processes, and systems.
Assist in project management tasks, such as project planning, timeline tracking, and resource allocation, to ensure successful project execution.
Troubleshoot issues related to APIs, microservices, and Salesforce and provide innovative solutions to address problems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in API, microservices, and Salesforce, ensuring the organization benefits from the latest advancements.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field (business, IT, or similar).
Proven experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on API, microservices, and Salesforce.
Strong understanding of API design, RESTful APIs, and microservices architecture.
Salesforce certification(s) is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Project management experience is advantageous.

Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality documentation.

Thanks & Regards

Sounika G

Job Description

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Location/Division Specific Information

Preferred location Rochester, NY; remote

Discover Impactful Work:

How will you make an impact?

The Sales Operations Analyst will partner with the Sales Operations team to ensure the tactical execution of initiatives and projects to drive the sales organization towards meeting the criteria for success within the defined sales strategies and objectives. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen, combined with excellent analytical skills and a bias toward action and collaboration. Strong process orientation and the ability to communicate, collaborate and influence team members in a cross functional environment are also required. This opportunity allows the individual in this role to develop their career in a challenging yet visible role.

A day in the Life:

What will you do?

Responsible for the support of sales incentive compensation within the scope of the North American LPD field sales teams. This includes but is not limited to:
Involvement in sales compensation plan design for all members of the Sales teams that are eligible under the Sales Incentive Plans (SIP).
Working with the Sales Operations team - review monthly incentive compensation payouts and casework (credit adjustments).
Support the Sales and Sales Operations teams with the month end reporting and incentive compensation process. This includes but is not limited to the month end reports for the Sales teams as well as preparing compensation data for review and approval by the Sr. Manager, Sales Operations for incentive compensation.
Support Sr. Manager, Sales Operations in quota setting for North American Sales organization for teams in scope of responsibility
Responsible for data quality and maintenance, by reviewing and updating product key assignments in the Data Warehouse and Xactly Incent (incentive compensation management software).
Responsible for special projects that support the strategic initiatives of the North American Sales Organization.
Ownership of the Sales Rep Product/Channel responsibility matrix. This role will have complete understanding of all the products and sales channels that the various sales teams in the North American organization are responsible for. This includes the complete documentation and change management of this matrix to support the sales strategies of the organization.
Support of the Sales Territory Management process. This includes support of the sales organization with territory mapping; deriving tools and documentation that articulates the mapping to the Sales Organization.
Provide ad-hoc reporting as requested by the members of Sales Operations and Sales teams.
Provide input and insight into commercial discussion as a full-standing member of Commercial and Sales Operations teams.
Keys to Success:
Education
BA/BS degree in finance, or other business related disciplines (MBA a plus)
Experience
3 - 5 years of experience in Sales Operations, Commercial Support, or related Finance role
Diagnostics, Medical Device, Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences experience a plus
Must have experience as a sales operations business partner, or related function, with cross functional teams.
Minimum of 3+ years of progressively responsible business experience
Strong knowledge of Excel (i.e., financial models and analysis), Cognos reporting tool (or equivalent), Xactly ICM Tool, PowerPoint, is preferred
The successful candidate should expect 10% - 15% travel
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
The successful candidate is personable, highly ethical and thrives in a collaborative environment.
Exhibits always: personal accountability to accuracy of information and deadlines
Proactive communication capabilities, identifying and addressing issues via candid dialogue and transparency
Must operate effectively in a complexly matrixed organization, having a track record of developing high levels of credibility and forging solid and positive professional relationships with peers and upper management
Strong commercial orientation with demonstrated experience partnering with business leaders to drive growth
Exceptional analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Self-motivated with high bias for action and accountability
High level of energy; will bring a passion to excel. Able to energize and influence a wide spectrum of people, including senior financial, commercial and operations professionals.
Ability to balance priorities and thrive in a complex global business environment
Drives a culture of accountability
Benefits

We offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus, healthcare, and a range of employee benefits. Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation!

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Job Title: Business Analyst Lead

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Description:

As the Business Analyst Lead at Huntington Bank, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing, documenting, and improving business processes and requirements. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for optimization and innovation, ensuring the bank's commitment to delivering exceptional customer experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Process Analysis: Analyze current business processes to identify areas for improvement and efficiency gains.

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to elicit, document, and validate business and system requirements.

Project Management: Lead and manage business analysis efforts for complex projects, ensuring deliverables are on time and within scope.

Data Analysis: Extract, analyze, and interpret data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for data-driven decision-making.

Documentation: Create detailed business requirements, functional specifications, and process flow diagrams.

Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate communication and collaboration between business units and IT teams to ensure alignment on project objectives.

Quality Assurance: Assist in the testing and quality assurance process to validate that solutions meet business requirements.

Change Management: Play a role in change management activities, including training and documentation.

Risk Assessment: Identify and assess risks associated with proposed solutions and provide mitigation strategies.

Continuous Improvement: Recommend and implement process improvements to enhance business operations and customer satisfaction.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field. An advanced degree is a plus.

[Specify years of experience required] years of experience as a Business Analyst or a similar role in the banking or financial industry.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.

Proficiency in business analysis methodologies, tools, and techniques.

Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.

Project management skills, with the ability to lead and coordinate cross-functional teams.

Familiarity with banking processes and regulatory requirements is preferred.

Experience with data analysis tools and software is advantageous.

Relevant certifications such as CBAP or PMI-PBA are a plus.

Provide contract and data management support to the Air Forces’ Military Construction (MILCON) and Facility Sustainment Restoration and Modernization (FSRM) Construction Tasking Order (CTO) programs. Perform a broad range of data analyst and reporting functions for a variety of design and construction project requirements focused on government contract compliance.

Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and other possible benefits as provided. Benefits are subject to change with or without notice.

Verifies and ensures data integrity by running reports and coordinates with users and government leadership.
Assists in Military Construction (MILCON) and Facility Sustainment Restoration and Modernization (FSRM) PMR slides.

Performs trend analysis.
Consolidates multiple documents into polished deliverable for government senior leadership.

Position Purpose: The Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) team is responsible for all aspects of ERM and Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) coordination and reporting for Centene Corporate and all subsidiaries. This position partners with multiple business units and/or functional areas to assist with gathering, analyzing, and documenting ERM and ESG data.

Support strategies to improve the company’s ESG ratings and propose actionable plans with appropriate measures to track results and integrate them into company business processes.

Research, benchmark, and evaluate ESG initiatives, guidance, regulations, and standards and identify potential emerging sustainability issues.
Work with multiple business units to gather risk and sustainability-related data from internal and external resources.
Maintain a repository of ERM and sustainability performance metrics and generate reports illustrating data, text, and graphics.

Manager, Product Management - Auto Finance

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Title: HR Operations Associate Analyst - Entry Level
Job Description:
Job ID: 653217BR
Date posted: Sep. 25, 2023

Description:Who We Are: At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics our products play an important role in the national security of the United States and more than 70 other countries, ensuring peace and stability around the world. Highly trained and specialized personnel and facilities are key to the company's unrivaled success in the aeronautics industry. Our team of more than 25,000 has pre-eminent expertise in advanced aircraft design and production, modification and support, stealth technology, and systems integration.

Your Impact: As a member of the Year One Experience Team, you will impact the experience of thousands of new employees' careers from first year Interns to high level Executives. If you are passionate about how casing Lockheed Martin's unique company culture, mission, and values to our newest team members, this may be the perfect role for you! Our On-Boarding function is in the midst of creating positive large-scale change and is seeking a team member to help us continue to lead by example and implement collaborative new hire strategies while sharing the resources needed for all new employees to make a smooth and positive transition.

A Day in the Life: As the first impression of Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Headquarters, you will be essential in shaping the new employee experience beginning before day one. From coordinating incoming employees Day-1 instructions, New Employee Orientation (NEO), new employee online internal engagement, and to creating targeted e-learning content and more, you will have the opportunity to opportunity to engage in a variety of efforts within our On-Boarding Center. Although your primary focus will be to ensure an efficient, positive, and seamless transition for our employees, may also find yourself:

Contacting incoming employees prior to start date to answer questions and assist with completion of pre onboarding documents.
Executing Homeland Security procedures, I-9s and eVerify - Provide information on On-Boarding Center policies and procedures.
Open and close OBC facility, ensuring rooms are secure, computers are updated, and room prep complete.
Participating in strategic initiatives that will continue to enhance the new employee experience and further streamline the On-Boarding processes.
Developing relationships with SME's across business functions to help ensure up to date and relevant content for our new hires.
Supporting the implementation of New Employee Orientation to ensure new hires, rehires, recalls, and transfers are supported and engaged about Lockheed Martin's mission, values, and culture.

About You: In this role, your human resources experience coupled with your ability to positively engage with those around you, will help you succeed. Your ability to seek out answers to the unknown and the passion to persevere when encountering resistance is what sets you apart. As a critical thinker, you can make a positive impact by providing data-driven people solutions that are efficient, effective, and flexible. Most likely, you'll be in your element, presenting to a variety of audiences and communicate skillfully when speaking to your work.
Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources or related field
Demonstrated ability and experience as a facilitator or presenter
Ability to work independently and execute projects with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated experience using relevant software tools/solutions, e.g., Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project), SharePoint, Slack, Zoom, Box, etc.
Desired Skills:

At least two years of experience in one of the following areas: On-Boarding administration, Human Resources Business Partner, Employee Relations, Talent Management, Organizational Development
Prior experience with applicant tracking systems such as Kenexa/BrassRing, processingI-9/ eVerify
Prior experience developing, recording, and producing e-learning content
Strong communication skills both oral and written and customer service orientation
Project experience, including developing project plans, identifying stakeholders, preparing corresponding communication plans, identifying milestones, deadlines, and metrics to assess outcomes/results
Continuous Improvement Training/Mindset
Change Management Training/Experience
Strong analytical skills
Working knowledge of Lockheed Martin policies and procedures
Clearance Level: None
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week

The Krazy Coupon Lady (KCL) is a female-founder-owned publisher on a mission to help shoppers beat MSRP, unapologetically maximize their money, and seize the deal. Our team of shopping experts curates and hand-tests nearly a thousand deals per week, so there is always something new to discover each time you visit our website, app, and your inbox.

You may have noticed that our headquarters are in Boise, ID, but our workforce is fully remote in the following states: Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Indiana, Iowa, Minnesota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Virginia, or Wisconsin. All team-wide meetings are scheduled to be inclusive of U.S. time zones.

About the position.
As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will lead high-impact data projects. You have a passion for uncovering insights from data, excellent communication and collaboration skills, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality insights and analytics to support business operations. To be successful in this role, you must be able to distill learnings into key takeaways, and effectively communicate actionable insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

In this role, you will develop and nurture high-trust, interpersonal relationships with leaders and teams across the business. You enthusiastically initiate collaboration with stakeholders and data teams to solve problems, build new reporting solutions, and commit to delivering against high standards. In addition to utilizing KPIs, business performance data, industry trends, competitor intelligence, and customer information to provide reliable and actionable insights, you will work to proactively identify opportunities for growth and efficiency.

As a senior on the team, you hold yourself to a high standard and you help set the bar. You act as a bridge between non-technical teams and data, able to effectively understand business challenges and requirements. Given a nebulous project, you are able to appropriately scope it, find a solution, then execute. Working closely with stakeholders across KCL, you consistently deliver high-quality results, and you are seen as a leader and valuable contributor to major company initiatives.

This is a full-time remote position with a Monday-Friday work week.
Responsibilities Include:
Drive analytical support and insights to cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product development, and content. Perform routine and ad hoc analyses to inform business decisions, including developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations that effectively communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Develop reports, dashboards, and innovative solutions to effectively investigate trends, communicate key insights, and deliver recommendations to stakeholders.
Contribute to the development of and reporting on Key Performance Indicators for major company initiatives and departments
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all performance-based metrics and reporting by performing detailed data exploration and validation to identify trends, tendencies, and anomalies
Develop and iterate on processes for gathering, summarizing, and distributing relevant insights to business leaders and teams across the companyUtilize data analytics tools to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth
Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas for improvement and develop solutions to address key business challenges.
Ensure a positive end-user experience by building solutions to deliver consistent and easy access to data needed to inform day-to-day and broader strategic decisions; leverage our internal reporting tool, Looker, and educate stakeholders on how to use it
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, and share insights with the wider team.
Additional responsibilities as the department scales
About You:
Minimum 5+ years experience in business insights, data insights or related role
Understanding of dashboard design and data visualization best practices
Expert in both analytics and visualization tools; experience with Looker is a plus
Proficient in SQL; knowledge of Python and/or R is a plus
High-level proficiency in Google Sheets/Excel
Ability to maintain good documentation and record keeping
Strong technical chops, enthusiastic self-learner, and curious
Excellent project management and organizational skills; experience with Asana is a plus
Strong storyteller; exceptional communication and presentation skills
Ability to think critically; must be solutions-oriented with a passion for problem-solving
Proven experience in managing multiple projects
Exceptional attention to detail and an avid team player who enjoys working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Ability to prioritize, work cooperatively, and collaborate with cross-functional teams
Physical Requirements
Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
Hearing: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.
The worker is required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned

With our roots in Boise, ID, we’ve grown into a remote company with employees located across the United States. We’re a team focused on hard work, humility, and transparency. We believe in the power of community and the magic of friendship that created KCL so, for us, everything we do is people-first.

Job Summary:
We are looking for an innovative solution architect to define, develop, implement, and verify systems architecture that will meet business needs. The solution architect’s responsibilities include gathering requirements and functional specifications, assessing the current software systems in place to identify areas in need of improvement, and overseeing development teams. The solution architect is a trusted technical expert and, as such, is responsible for providing ongoing technical updates to the executive team.

Responsibilities (Specific tasks, duties, essential functions of the job)

Analyze current technologies used within the company and determine ways to improve.
Assessing the systems architecture currently in place and working with technical staff to recommend solutions to improve it.
Building and integrating information systems to meet the company’s needs.
Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions.
Work closely with project management teams to successfully monitor progress of initiatives.
Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates.
Resolving technical problems as they arise.
Providing supervision and guidance to development teams.
Collaborate with Information Technology professionals within the company to define and set up needed resources.
Collaborate with Information Security professionals within the company on data governance and data democratization.
Continually researching current and emerging technologies and proposing changes where needed.
Informing various stakeholders about any problems with the current technical solutions as well as plans for technical solutions planned to be implemented.
Assessing the business impact that certain technical choices have.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Agile project management and leadership skills are essential.
Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure for digital health platforms.
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering, preferred.
Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures and data governance.
Experience in software engineering and software architecture.
Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to a high level.
Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes.
Professional experience working with and analyzing computer hardware and software.
Extensive knowledge of FDA regulations.
High degree of critical thinking skills
Excellent organizational skills
Strong sense of urgency and a desire to roll up sleeves to do the work
Qualifications (Experience and Education)

Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field of study, required.
Master’s in Computer Science or related field of study, preferred.
10+ years of overall experience, to include a minimum of 5 years of software development and architecture in in the Medical Device industry or any other regulated industry.
5-8 years of hands-on technical application architecture experience and Application build experience.
Software Architecture experience required 5 years.
Experience building digital health solutions 5 years.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.

Description: JLL is seeking an Insurance Analyst for its Escrow Operations group. This individual will be responsible for ensuring all loans are compliant with the applicable Lender’s insurance requirements. The Analyst will work individually and with all levels of staff and must interact effectively with internal and external parties. The Analyst must demonstrate organization, an analytical orientation and possess the initiative to work in an independent and reliable manner.

Essential Functions:
Review new loan and insurance documents to ensure proper setup in the servicing system and complete a thorough insurance review (certificates of insurance, appraisal, flood determinations, property condition reports, etc.)
Obtain insurance renewal information, invoices and/or paid receipts and policies from agents, borrowers, and management companies within specified timeframes, for an assigned group of loans
Ensure insurance coverage is in place for all assigned loans per Lender guidelines.
Process insurance premium invoices in the loan servicing system and contact borrowers to collect shortages, as needed
Analyze insurance renewal information to ensure compliance with investor insurance requirements, including complete policy review
Prepare insurance waivers for non-compliant insurance issues and submit for management and/or Lender approval
Monitor insurance compliance for life of loan, including insurance reviews for properties with mid-term policy changes or changes resulting from an ownership or management transfer
Monitor and update various reports and certifications utilized by lenders and leadership to analyze portfolio risk
Communicate escrow issues and coordinate resolution with servicing staff
Perform duties and responsibilities in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and JREC policies and procedures
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Skills Required:
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, OneNote)
Strong time management skills and ability to operate under demanding deadlines
Excellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving and organization skills
Ability to multitask and work on several transactions simultaneously
Ability to recognize and analyze risk
Willingness and ability to learn new technology
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to audit own work
Ability to work independently, unsupervised, and as a team player
Ability to travel as needed

Required Experience: Undergraduate degree in Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, or Business preferred, or, equivalent work experience in Insurance, Commercial Mortgage Banking, or Loan Servicing. Experience with Precision LM loan servicing software is a plus.

Position Description

This position performs highly complex professional administrative and policy analysis work. Work involves conducting organizational studies and evaluations, designing systems and developing procedures, conducting work efficiency studies, and preparing operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. May serve as lead worker for professional, technical and administrative employees. Work requires extensive contact with high-level executives, managers and governmental agencies. Employees at this level are virtually self-supervising and assume direct accountability for the work product.

Essential Duties:

Analyzes and evaluates business functions and activities; develops and monitors performance data.

Develops new or modifies existing administrative programs, policies or regulations.

Evaluates statistical data, interprets results and prepares reports on effectiveness of program activities.

Monitors, evaluates and makes recommendations concerning accounting activities and contract-related matters.

May serve as a lead worker and the related tasks.

Oversees strategic long- and short-range planning, modeling activities and/or the evaluation and development of policies.

Performs budget-related review, planning and development activities.

Prepares comprehensive technical records and reports to present, interprets data, identifies alternatives; and makes and justifies recommendations.

Provides financial information and recommendations to management.

Researches, plans, coordinates and develops programs, projects, activities or procedures to increase productivity, efficiency and streamline operations.

Performs other job responsibilities as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Management, Communications or related field. Relevant experience may be substituted for education on a year per year basis. Substitutions for Minimum Qualifications

Experience: 3 YEARS experience in business analysis, methods analysis, strategic planning, project management or related function. (Experience can be satisfied by fulltime or prorated parttime equivalent). Related graduate level education may be substituted for experience on a year per year basis.

*Relevant work experience may be substituted for degree on a year per year basis OR related graduate level education may be

substituted for experience on a year per year basis*

Licenses and Certifications: Valid driver’s license. This position requires driving a state vehicle.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience required

Competencies:

Budgeting methods and procedures

Contract administration/management systems

Portfolio, program and project planning, development and management

Fiscal planning and management practices

Financial management and accounting systems

Planning methods, techniques and strategies

Research and analysis methodologies

Analyzing and organizing business and technical data

Preparing detailed reports

Using computers and applicable programs, applications, and systems

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:

Sedentary work: Lift up to 10 lbs. at a time and occasionally carry files/small tools

Light work: Lift up to 20 lbs. at a time and frequently lift or carry objects up to 10 lbs.

Standing-prolonged periods of time

Repetitive Motion-substantial movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers

Close Visual Acuity-work includes data/figures; view a computer screen; extensive reading

General Functions:

Responsible for the support, maintenance and development of the organizations global information system and its associated peripheral systems and processes. This position works under limited supervision. Prepares recommendations for new systems, enhancements to existing systems and changes to procedures to improve efficiency and work flow.

This position requires a good working knowledge of the organizations global information system and its associated peripheral systems, the organizational structure, and business functions and procedures. This position differs from the Business Systems Manager position in that projects assigned have limited impact on the organization.

Key Activities:

Prepares recommendations for new systems, enhancements and changes to procedures to improve efficiency and work flow
Acts as lead on development, design and implementation of projects with a limited scope
Analyze and evaluate requests for enhancing existing systems and proposals for new systems and make recommendations to management
Draft system design requirements and logic specifications for submission to technical development teams under the guidance of senior BPM staff
Test enhancements and new systems, ensuring proper functionality and compatibility with local business requirements; coordinate with development team to resolve technical problems
Monitor the implementation of system changes in production and coordinate user acceptance testing
Write and maintain system documentation, user guides and procedures
Provide system operational training to staff and system users
Provide business departments with assistance in resolving computer related problems by troubleshooting and coordinating with IT staff when needed
Identify and resolve EDI communication errors
Document system problems and solutions for future reference
Participate as a team member and lead on inter-departmental and cross-departmental projects with a limited scope
Monitor and report on data quality; identify and support improvement measures
Maintain Corporate Performance Monitoring Key Performance Indicators
Other duties of similar scope as assigned

Minimum Qualifications:

Requires a Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science or a related field and 2 years of experience as a systems analyst or a combination of education or experience that provides and equivalent background required to perform the job functions. Shipping industry experience is preferred.

Additional Qualifications and Requirements:

Strong computer skills; proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access) and SharePoint
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and devise effective and logical system and procedural solutions
Work effectively independently as well as in a team environment
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical organization members
Ability to learn new computer systems independently through self-study and practice and teach others

Company Overview:

Hillwood, a Perot company, is a full-service industrial real estate developer, investor and advisor, focusing on institutional-grade industrial properties. From acquisitions and joint ventures to development, property management and fund/asset management, Hillwood provides creative solutions for its customers and long-term value for its partners. Hillwood has experience in 63 markets across North America and Europe and has developed and acquired 270.3 million square feet (Q3-2023). For additional information, visit www.hillwood.com.

Position Summary:

Hillwood IT is looking for a Vice President, Enterprise Applications and Strategy to join our growing organization. The Vice President, Enterprise Applications (EA) and Strategy will be responsible for leading the Enterprise Applications team and driving the execution of our strategic technology priorities through the development and realization of our enterprise application roadmap. The ideal candidate will possess a successful track record in leading technology and/or product teams through transformational change. He or she will have a strategic mindset, ability to develop trusting relationships, and expertise to drive technology results aligned to our overall business objectives.

Responsibilities:

Primary Job Duties:

Drive alignment across a federalized IT landscape, between our various businesses and corporate departments.
Effectively communicate the value of enterprise architecture and technology service portfolios to Hillwood, and drive improvements to service performance, costs, and business impacts.
Lead, mentor, and refine the enterprise applications team (architects, analysts, business and technology owners, managers & staff) working across Project / PMO and product teams. Instill architectural design precepts into everyday team practices.
Engage business and technology stakeholders to build and maintain relationships across various operating models. Adapt to different and changing business and operating models.
Evaluate trends & disruptions; incorporate emerging technologies into new company capabilities.
Evolve the Enterprise Applications teams’ services and operating model as capabilities improve.

Primary Job Functions:

Formulate Strategy and Guide Requirements:

Work with business and technology leaders to develop applications and service portfolio strategy.
Use plans, designs and capability-maturity approaches to construct and ‘sell’ future-state process & technology models.
Lead the development of an enterprise architecture roadmap with the internal capability to analyze current business processes vs. future capabilities and recommend potential solutions.
Translate & connect strategy to execution of targeted business outcomes, through collaborative and supportive approach, balancing operational excellence with growth and innovation.

Builds and Maintains Relationships

Continually assess stakeholder relationships to identify strengths and opportunities.
Lead technology teams to inform, advise, & improve the use of technology throughout enterprise.
Leverage enterprise architecture and project management capabilities to enhance stakeholder satisfaction with technology initiatives.
Advise strategic/portfolio committee(s) to guide project consideration & execution of transformational decisions and resolve conflicts between technology delivery and desired business outcomes.
Develop team capabilities both in technical skills and knowledge, but also in business awareness.

Guide Execution & Delivery of Business Outcomes:

Assess & drive operating technology services delivery to meet and exceed stakeholder expectations.
Lead team to drive understanding of business requirements, clarify project plans & expectations, and drive team to meet the desired outcomes.
Coordinate with peer leaders to facilitate proper priorities, decisions, and risk / issue resolution.
Conquer obstacles and risks to team project delivery with determination, ingenuity, and focus.
Ensure project / product delivery regularly incorporate ‘lessons learned’ and value realization.

Facilitate Innovation:

Assess disruptive forces affecting the organization and identifies technology-enabled innovation opportunities that enables business strategy.
Scan emerging technologies and the business ecosystem for major disruptive technology and nontechnology trends (trendspotting) that affect business.
Provide practical advice and best practices to take advantage of new, or emerging, opportunities and successfully deliver the expected business outcomes.

Required Skills/Abilities:

Strong leader, with exceptional soft and interpersonal skills including teamwork, conflict resolution, and negotiation.
Exceptional communication skills and stakeholder engagement capabilities.
Ability to interface with internal & external parties to achieve company goals, including challenging technology teams and business operations to achieve ‘stretch’ outcome.
Mastery of ERP, point-solution, and cloud-based applications – including integrated systems – to facilitate design and implementation of enterprise, cross-functional solutions.
Strong understanding of “off the shelf” software; judicious use of (minimal) customizations.
Comfortable navigating technology and learning, optimizing, and deploying multiple platforms.
Very strong analytical and problem-solving ability.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Finance, Business, Computer Engineering, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 15 years of relevant business experience in strategic and operations planning and/ or business analysis or experience as an enterprise architecture consultation required.
Minimum of 10 years’ experience managing and leading technology and/or product teams.
Minimum of 10 years of experience managing ERPs and affiliated application or SaaS products.
Hands-on experience with JD Edwards, Salesforce, and modern BI/Reporting solutions is a plus.
Experience cultivating innovation and enhancing processes with continuous improvement.

We’re changing the way people connect to social care.

At findhelp, we’ve built a comprehensive platform of products and services that make it easy for you to connect people to resources, follow them on their journey, and track your impact in a fast and reliable way. Our industry-leading social care network includes more than half a million local, state, and national programs that serve every ZIP Code in the country, from rural areas to major metropolitan centers.
Findhelp is headquartered in Austin, Texas and has been enabling healthcare, government, education, and other organizations to connect people with the social care resources that serve them, with privacy and security, since 2010.

As a mission driven organization, we are focused on creating a positive impact by connecting people in need to the programs that serve them with dignity and ease. Powered by our proprietary technology that enables people to find the resources available in their area, we have helped millions of Seekers find food, health, housing and employment programs.

As a Senior Engineering Business Analyst at findhelp, you will play a key role in the planning and execution of features, enhancements, bugs, and other work done by engineering teams. Wearing the Scrum Product Owner hat, you’ll partner with Engineering Managers, Product Managers, and other Business Analysts to deliver high-quality software solutions and business value to findhelp’s customers, partners, and end users. You will be on the front lines with our engineering teams crafting solutions, setting clear priorities for the next set of deliverables, and delivering on our commitments.
What You’ll Do:
Partner with Engineering Leadership and multiple engineering teams to deliver high-quality, high-value software solutions for our most complex opportunities
Provide a clearly-defined, well-organized, prioritized backlog of features, bugs, and other requests for each supported engineering team
Negotiate scope and timelines based on priority, customer needs, existing commitments, and team capacity and availability
Break large and complex technical projects into smaller, iterative steps to streamline and optimize value delivery
Write clear, well-scoped, technically sound, and testable technical acceptance criteria and collaborate with the engineering team to determine the best way to deliver the desired outcomes
Identify, minimize, and track cross-team dependencies
Partner with Product Managers to ensure we are solving root problems and our solutions are aligned with business priorities and goals
Foster strong relationships across multiple teams to build consensus and collaboration
Who You Are:
An experienced servant leader helping teams build the best possible solutions for our customers and end users
An impediment bulldozer, overcoming barriers to your high performing team
Documented history of getting things done and working tactically on complex solutions
Deep experience in Agile environment, shipping incremental value directly with engineering
A history of advocating for and supporting your team
Deep experience partnering with other functions in an organization, like product, customer success, and UX
A strong desire to solve the next problem impacting the lives of our users
Organized, with the ability to communicate clearly in written and oral form
Experience You’ll Bring:
5+ years as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or Systems Analyst in consumer web or SaaS products
Computer Science or Technical Degree
Healthcare or Government experience
Scrum and Agile Certifications such as Certified Scrum Product Owner preferred
