Responsibilities:
The Role:

We are looking for a motivated individual to drive sales forecasting accuracy and timeliness with the Sales team. Duties include sell-in forecasting, sell-thru forecasting, and pipeline forecasting according to guidelines. If this sounds like a role you are interested in, we welcome you to apply!


The Person:

To succeed in this role, you will have:

Strong attention to details and sense of urgency. Able to effectively perform multiple/concurrent tasks under high pressures and multiple deadlines.
Excellent communication and critical thinking skills.
Confident and comfortable to work with executives.
Key Responsibilities:
Deliver weekly Sales Revenue Attainment reports:
Update regular Revenue Attainment review templates including Sell-in and Sell-through sales forecasting, QTD billings + backlog, and inventory data etc.
Collect, validate and consolidate Revenue Attainment inputs provided by cross-functional teams such as Sales team, Business Units and Finance.
Compile executive Revenue Attainment Review decks within deadlines.
Continuously enhance and build from scratch of analysis models of revenue forecasting, demand vs. supply, funding forecasting, distribution inventory management to support business growth and address ad hoc issues.
Drive Sales forecasting accuracy and timeliness with Sales team including sell-in forecast, sell-thru forecasting, and inventory management according to guidelines.
Support quarter end closing activities including but not limited to variances analysis of QTD billings plus backlog vs. Sales forecasting and risk assessment.
Documentation and communication for all owned processes
Collaborate cross-functional to increase internal usage of sales tools such as PowerBI, Salesforce etc.
Required Skills:
Strong analytic skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel is a MUST. Able to build business analysis models from scratch and reconcile complicated data sources, depth of experience on creating reports for ad hoc/regular cadence/executive reporting.
Familiar with Sales forecasting tools such as Salesforce.com, PowerBI and data cubes.
Experience working in a matrix organization where building collaboration and influence generates results.

Preferred Experience:

Minimum 3 years related working experience in Sales Operations/Revenue Recognition/Sales Finance/Forecasting & Planning roles.
Bachelor’s degree with major in Business Analytics, Finance, or Accounting, and MBA is a PLUS.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: Performs entry-level computer system support work within the agencies Texas Crime Information Center (TCIC) Operations section. Work involves providing immediate and thorough technical support to internal and external customers for agency information technology systems in network and mainframe environments. Work is performed under close supervision, with minimal latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

The following Military Occupational Specialty codes are generally applicable to this position.
https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_InformationTechnology.pdf
Applicants must fully complete the summary of experience to determine if minimum qualifications are met.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinate and provide technical support in a 24/7 work environment, providing status updates on issues related to the use of the web based supported systems and a variety of other databases and monitors system outage & slowness.

Respond to numerous inquiries via phone and email, to provide assistance, resolution, guidance, clarification and interpretation regarding a variety of subject areas.

Provide impromptu training and instruction to internal and external agency personnel regarding various supported systems.

Process large volume of record entries by researching and verifying the accuracy, completeness and compliance with National Crime Information Center/Texas Crime Information Center (NCIC/TCIC) rules, policies, and procedures by reviewing every individual record entry.

Initiate and coordinate the resolution of operating problems and system failures with the Information Technology Division (IT), Operations Information Center (OIC), and/or vendor or Texas Law Enforcement Telecommunications System (TLETS) operations.

Ensure requests are handled appropriately between originating and requesting agencies in accordance with NCIC policies, procedures and observance of prescribed time requirements.

Initiate and compile correspondence and production records via CJIS website on a monthly basis through the NCIC of all active NCIC/TCIC record entries for required validation and purge transactions.

Create, maintain, and utilize databases for managing data; validate agency records; compose monthly statistical reports on supported programs, records handled, and documentation relating to specific interactions with customers; and review reports.

Process requests from the Department of Family and Protective Services for record entry of unlocated children/families into the Child Safety Check Alert List.

Provide timely responses for Open Records Requests ensuring compliance with state statute.

Assist user, i.e. password and user profile so they can access system, ensuring security of system and compliance with policy, procedures and rules.

Provide operational assistance in implementation and use of Dept. software/user interface.

Assist in rollout of new functionality and software upgrades to all Texas agencies.

Attend work regularly and observes approved work hours in accordance with agency leave and attendance policies.

Perform other duties as assigned.



Qualifications


GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS and REQUIREMENTS

Education – High School Diploma/equivalent.

Experience – Minimum of one (1) years’ experience performing administrative or technical work involving NCIC/TCIC systems or other high volume electronic telecommunications environments and customer service in person, over the phone, or online.

Licensure - Must hold or earn TCIC Full Access, TLETS Certification, TLETS Mobile Certification (DL and REG Only) and any other certifications essential to Control Room functions with the first six (6) months of employment. Operators must remain current on all courses of instruction/online certification related to TLETS/Nlets and TCIC/NCIC, recertifying every two (2) years.

Regulatory knowledge – Working knowledge of, or the ability to rapidly assimilate information related to TXDPS, State and Federal regulations, legislation, guidelines, policies and procedures.

Interpersonal Skills – Must demonstrate an ability to exercise poise, tact, diplomacy and an ability to establish and maintain positive, working/professional relationships with internal/external customers.

Organizational and Prioritization Skills – Must be organized, flexible, and able to effectively prioritize in a multi-demand and constantly changing environment; able to meet multiple and sometimes conflicting deadlines without sacrificing accuracy, timeliness or professionalism.

Presentation/Communication Skills – Must be able to construct and deliver clear, concise, and professional presentations to a variety of audiences and/or individuals.

Research and Comprehension – Must demonstrate ability to quickly and efficiently access relevant information, and be able to utilize and/or present research and conclusions in a clear and concise manner.

Analytical Reasoning/Attention to Detail – Must demonstrate an ability to examine data/information, discern variations/similarities, and be able identify trends, relationships and causal factors, as well as grasp issues, draw accurate conclusions, and solve problems.

Technology (computers/hardware/software/operating systems) – Must possess appropriate levels of proficiency with utilized software and systems and be able to learn new software/systems. Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and CJIS systems.

Confidentiality and Protected Information – Must demonstrate an ability to responsibly handle sensitive and confidential information and situations, and adhere to applicable laws/statutes/policies related to access, maintenance and dissemination of information.

Safety – Must be able to work in safe manner at all times, avoiding shortcuts that have potential adverse results/risks, and must be able to comply with safety standards and best practices.

Travel and/or Schedule – Availability for emergencies, after-hour, weekend, and holiday work is required.

PHYSICAL and/or ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS

The physical and environmental demands described here are representative of those encountered and/or necessary for the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job; reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Environment: Office.
Ambulatory skills, e.g. stand, walk, sit, stoop, kneel, crouch;
Hand-eye coordination and arm/hand/finger dexterity;
Ability to speak, hear, smell, and exercise visual acuity;
Ability to transfer weights of twenty-five (25) pounds anticipated for this position;
Driving requirements: None.

Role Overview:
NorthStar Anesthesia is seeking an Operations Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have finance and business operations experience.

This role offers the flexibility to be hybrid with a preference for candidates local to the DFW area.

A Smarter Career Investment
NorthStar is the fastest growing anesthesia management company in the U.S. We run successful anesthesia programs with more than 2,500 clinicians across 20+ states. Whether you're a physician, CRNA or office professional, NorthStar is a great place to invest your career.

Benefits
Health
Dental
Vision
Short term disability
Company paid long term disability
Company paid life insurance and AD&D insurance
401K plan with company match
Pet Insurance
4 weeks PTO
10 paid company holidays
Job Summary
The Operations Analyst will support the Ops team in developing, sourcing, and reporting key operational metrics and data analysis. This person will be responsible for performing research, analysis, and reporting on data around new initiatives. The Operations Analyst will assist in the coordination of all finance and business planning related functions including routine analysis, reporting, budgeting, and providing resource support.

What you will do in this role
Develop and monitor operational performance forecast and recommend solutions based upon analyses performed.
Incorporate data from multiple internal and external sources and communicate results to leadership.
Manage individual provider issues as well as requests for data on facility and provider productivity.
Respond to custom request for support and analysis on new metrics, projects, and initiatives.
Review ongoing accounting month close, accruals, payroll, billing processes, etc.
Proactively prepare/assist with P&L statements to develop and maintain a monthly dashboard of key operational performance indicators. Reconcile monthly financial performance vs. budget. Prepare data for all administration finance functions, including monthly financial and statistical reports. Present findings to senior leadership.
Act as a liaison between administration, other hospital departments, and anesthesia practices.
Prepare, maintain, and present analyses request for senior leadership as required.
Source, test, and report key operational metrics for the organization’s operations.
Partner with key business stakeholders to identify project requirements by analyzing operations, determining scope, and documenting results.
What qualifications you will need
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Healthcare, Economics, or related field is required.
1-3 years’ experience in financial planning, business operations, or financial reporting is strongly preferred.
Healthcare experience is a plus.
Equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.
Proficient in all Microsoft Office.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to understand key issues, operations, and synthesize complex information to communicate to various audience.
Fast growing. Dynamic team culture. Your chance to shine.
As a corporate employee in the healthcare field, you understand that our industry is changing rapidly, and you want to be a part of those positive changes. Founded in 2004 by an anesthesiologist and a CRNA, NorthStar Anesthesia is the fastest growing anesthesia management company in the country, and we have built a foundation of anesthesia expertise unparalleled in the market. Our corporate culture emphasizes collaboration, appreciation, mutual respect, and accountability. We put patients at the center of everything we do; and our corporate team works to support our clinicians so that they can provide world class anesthesia care.


"The best part about working at NorthStar is the people. In my opinion, we have some of the most knowledgeable, innovative, and hard-working professionals in healthcare. Across all departments, clinical and non-clinical, I have always been impressed with the talent within our organization. " - Landon Owens, Sr. Director of Talent Acquisition and Strategy

Join NorthStar as an Operations Analyst and invest in your career! Apply today and a member of our Talent Acquisition team will follow up with you.

NorthStar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. We are committed to having a workforce that celebrates diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are an Affirmative Action Employer.

Brief Description of Sunnova

Sunnova (NYSE: NOVA) is revolutionizing the energy industry as a leading Energy as a Service (EaaS) provider of solar, battery storage, EV charging, and other energy solutions with customers spanning the U.S. and its territories. Founded in 2012, our goal is to provide homeowners, businesses, and communities with a better energy service at a better price – making clean, renewable energy more accessible, reliable, and affordable.
At Sunnova, we believe that our success comes from the diversity and creativity of our people. Our team is made up of forward-thinkers who are passionate about changing the energy industry for the better, and we're looking for like-minded individuals to join us. We encourage our people to push beyond traditional limits and explore new horizons – because only then can we truly transform the world for the better.
If you're excited about being a part of the fastest-growing segment of the energy industry, we want you on our team!

The Operations Business Analyst Position
Sunnova Energy is currently looking for an Operations Business Analyst who will provide substantial analytical support for Sunnova’s Service and Maintenance departments that will be utilized to inform critical business decisions. Identifies areas for process improvement through data analysis and strategic thinking

Supports the development, documentation, and implementation of new procedures
Produces custom reports and analysis

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or another related field required
2+ years’ experience with data analytics tools and/or process automation
Experience with reporting/data analytics tools through design and creation of reports, dashboards, and queries
Experience in process mapping and business requirements documentation
Proven track record of timely analyzing and summarizing extremely large quantities of data
Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude applying advanced knowledge of business protocols & metrics; a high degree of accuracy is required
Proficient in Microsoft office, specifically Excel analytical capability and Outlook

Working knowledge of Tableau
Work experience as a business analyst in an operations or reporting environment highly desired
Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to excel in a team-oriented environment
Ability to thoughtfully exercise judgment to improve processes and advance the reporting outputs for the team.
Ability to assess metric outcomes on a relative basis and create sound recommendations based on accurate data evaluation.
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines
Ability to learn and adapt to change
Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Excellent judgment, reasoning, and problem-solving skills

Job Title: Sr. Decision Support Finance Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Who We Are
JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network features 75 locations across Fort Worth, with John Peter Smith Hospital -home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, only psychiatric emergency services site, and the largest hospital-based family medical residency program in the nation - and more than 40 community-based clinics. All told, our network employs more than 7,200 people.

Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group featuring over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network. Specialties range from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial, and clinical performance
outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.


Why JPS?
We're more than a hospital. We're 7,200 of the most dedicated people you could ever meet. Our goal is to make sure the people of our community get the care they need and deserve. As community stewards, we abide by three rules:

1. Own it. Everyone who wears the JPS badge contributes to our journey to excellence.
2. Seek joy. Every day, every shift, we celebrate our patients, smile, and emphasize positivity.
3. Don't be a jerk. Everyone is treated with courtesy and respect. Smiling, laughter, compassion - key components of our everyday experience at JPS.

When working here, you're surrounded by passion, diversity, and dedication. We look forward to meeting you!

For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.
To view all job vacancies, visit www.jobs.jpshealthnet.org/ or www.teamacclaim.org.

Job Description:

Description: The Senior Decision Support & Financial Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting and ensuring the integrity of the costing and decision support tool, maintaining and reconciling daily data loads and processes, completing pro formas and operational analysis, assisting the network, Hospital and Acclaim Physician Group, with reports needed to make day to day decisions, strategic initiatives and long range planning, and maintaining a high level of customer service for all end users. The Senior Decision Support Analyst functions at a more complex level while also supporting the Director with scheduled and non-routine reporting functions for hospital system and provider lines of business.

Typical Duties:

Collects, interprets, and analyzes clinical and financial data to support organizational decision making, clinical and financial initiatives and strategic planning activities.


Maintains DSS report infrastructure, monitoring data quality, developing new reports, assisting with dashboard planning and design, and understanding all data sources.


Validates and manipulates source system information so that extracted information is meaningful in StrataJazz.


Coordinates testing of new dashboards, scorecards and other reporting platforms as well as changes to existing reports and models to ensure integrity and quality of data.


Develops and maintains annual budgeting volumes for the physician group: Forecasts volumes based on historical data, develop reports for physician group variances and real time data tracking. Develops reporting to link compensation plan, productivity and volumes.


Coordinates with hospital system to accumulate standard benchmarking data on key healthcare metrics.


Develops, implement and present ad hoc reports to relevant parties as requested.


Updates and maintains cost accounting software and allocation templates. Ensures cost data integrity, including scheduled uploads, downloads, and reconciliations. Leads the annual cost standard review process and works with departmental managers and other operational leaders to develop and maintain accurate cost per unit values for each patient chargeable product.


Reviews new and existing departments’ codes and accounts to determine and validate allocations of expense. Analyzes actual compared to standard costs for ongoing expenses, and identify opportunities and risks.


Maintains Service Line logic and reporting. Collaborates with service line teams on deeper drilldowns and analytics by analyzing the service line at all levels including DRG/diagnoses/procedures. Ensures data interfaces and data loads run successfully and are validated for monthly and daily reporting.


Builds, maintains and analyzes executed and proposed contracts collaborating with Managed Care department. Performs analysis and provides key metrics and scenarios for negotiations with 3rd party payers. Consultative role for revenue cycle and managed care contracts.


Supports Reimbursement and Patient Financial Services departments with recurring analyses and reports to substantiate net revenue.


Compiles and reports revenue cycle data and uploads such as KPIs, Denials, Cost to Collect, Cash Collections, external reporting, etc.


Performs in a consultative manner to provide financial analysis on formulary additions proposed by the Pharmaceutical and Therapy committee.


Prepares and delivers decision support reports to both internal and external customers.


Acts in consulting manner for operational and clinical leadership to create and complete pro formas for initiatives and analysis of departmental or service line issues.


Qualifications:


Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field from an accredited college or university.
5 plus years of work experience performing a broad range of planning and analysis activities related to financial reports, budgeting, and strategic planning.

Preferred Education and Experience:
Master’s Degree in Business Administration (MBA) from an accredited college or university.
Prior Strata Decision Support experience is strongly preferred.

Preferred Licensure/Certification/Specialized Training:
Certified Public Accountant (CPA).

Working as part of a team of Database Administrators within the Business Intelligence group, this position will be key in supporting the database environment for multiple high volume sales and back office applications. The Sr. Database Administrator will be responsible for collecting, understanding, modeling, documenting and communicating the data requirements necessary to build and integrate data models for business processes, including performing data rationalization, defining data element standards and collaborating with functional SMEs, information stewards, data analysts, business analysts and product owners.

To succeed in this role the incumbent will need to marshal resources to identify and resolve database related issues in a timely manner and recommend monitoring and process changes to prevent reoccurrence.

This role will collaborate with developers and analysts on database design and best practices in the development of new functionality and maintaining and improving existing systems. Experience clustered SQL Server 2012/14/16 environments is essential; as is experience with data modeling for reporting and analytics.




ACCOUNTABILITIES

Designing, developing and delivering Reporting Services & Analysis Services, Schema modeling, stored procedures, SSIS packages, triggers and views.

Building and implementing enterprise data models, application relational data models, and data warehouse dimensional data models.

Installing and configuring SQL Server, implementing high availability and clustering, applying patches and fixes and monitoring, troubleshooting and optimizing performance with limited direction.

Creating backup plans, developing and testing disaster recovery scenarios, managing security, server sizing, and performance tuning.

Proactively communicate with business users, stakeholders, technical peers and project teams.

Maintaining contemporary knowledge of industry trends, concepts, and techniques.




QUALIFICATIONS




EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Analysis or related field.

Minimum 6 years of commercial experience with enterprise class SQL Server databases in a rapidly evolving, high-volume environment.

An approved equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.




SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS




Strong SQL development and tuning skills
Dimensional and Enterprise Data Modeling (Conceptual, Logical)
High volume commercial experience with cluster services, mirroring, and log shipping.
Solid understanding of contemporary database administration methodology.
Commercial Experience with Microsoft SQL 2012, 2014 and 2016
TSQL Programming; writing, debugging all mandatory (Index support, Query Plan analysis)
Production Cluster Support (AG and Traditional failover technology) with Geolocation
Support Operations and Development
SSIS for ETL and C# / VB Script experience
Excellent ability to communicate technical information, both written and verbal, to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize appropriately



The following skills/certifications are preferred but not required:

Microsoft Certified (MCDBA)
SQL Monitoring tools (SQL Monitor by RedGate and /or SQL Spotlight by Dell)
SSRS Report development
TFS Database deployments and Management
General Windows and/or Linux experience
Basic network and server configuration skills.
Powershell
Visual Studio .Net (C#) Development
MySQL Management

As a Business Information Architect, you will manage our corporate intranet (and related data) which we are currently re-branding as our internal Knowledge Management Platform. This role will require you to put yourself in the position of the end user – your fellow Walter P Moore teammates, to develop solutions on how best to organize, present, and archive data for optimal efficiency and ease of use. You will largely be responsible for working in conjunction with the Intranet Governance Committee and the IT group to make our intranet the “go to” resource for information and collaboration.

Working with necessary stakeholders to define and communicate knowledge management priorities and initiatives.
Utilizing and being versed in SharePoint Online platform architecture, related technologies and their interdependencies.

Developing and implementing change management techniques related to our Intranet Strategic Roadmap to successfully embed change.
Continually improving data and functionality needed for site users to have a positive, valuable self-service experience; keeping up-to-date with emerging technologies; and tracking/assessing key analytics.
Engaging with staff to determine knowledge and technology needs/requirements and providing solutions.
Coordinating with the Corporate Learning Manager to ensure training of front-end users on new technologies.
Working independently as a customer service contact for employees firmwide related to SharePoint/the Intranet.

Excellent communication and presentation skills. Must be able to effectively communicate with individuals at all levels of the firm to foster commitment to key collaborative programs.

Demonstrated understanding of data collaboration solutions, design, build and management.
Superior business processes and IT industry trends and developments knowledge.
Ability to implement high-level systems strategies and demonstrative technical proficiency within area of expertise.
Adept at establishing priorities, meeting deadlines, and organizing work effectively.
Ability to troubleshoot, debug and prioritize technical issues.
Professional, internal customer-focus demeanor is a must.

YOU'RE GOOD AT


Ability to work autonomously and with a strong entrepreneurial thinking spirit. Experience in a business analyst, market researcher or insights & analytics role at leading investment bank, private equity or other consumer focused Fortune 500 companies
Experience at leading consumer behavior or marketing analytics firm
Experience in advanced analytics, cross-industry data and expertise development focused on consumer topics
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView
Bachelor's Degree required (advanced degree preferred)
Fluency in English; other languages requested in certain locations
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills to interact with internal and external stakeholder while working in a global collaborative team environment

YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

#ta #bcgcareers #bcglife

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

What you’ll be doing...

This Director position will be responsible for end to end delivery of multiple Digital Service (Mobile & Home) programs on the web, mobile, app and cloud based platforms for Verizon. Responsibilities include Digital Marketing, Customer Experience / Omni Programs for Base Customer Support Digitally. The leader will be responsible for building a highly motivated and talented team, coaching and mentoring them to deliver high quality products and services. The Director will partner with business units to establish goals, influence and effectively communicate the vision set by Senior Leadership.

This position can be located in other valid Verizon locations.

Responsibilities

End to end delivery and support responsibility for all Verizon FIOS, Mobility & 5G FWA (Fixed Wireless Access) e-commerce solutions & Systems.

End to end delivery responsibility for Digital Marketing, Customer Experience & Omni programs delivery on web, app & other 24X7 on premise or cloud platforms.

Responsible for production defects (experience, functional, accessibility, & performance) fixing, support and troubleshooting of various platforms.

Establish objectives, create road maps, and align with key partners and stakeholders to ensure delivery of company goals.

Lead technology direction, facilitate key decision points, convert requirements into working product outcomes and drive integration with various Verizon and vendor systems.

Lead the design and architecture support for tactical and transformative ecommerce 24x7 solutions.

Drive SRE implementation including ideation, business case, architecture, design, stakeholder management, development, trials and delivery using industry standard processes and tools.

Partner with onshore and offshore design team to create and optimize UI, UX, usability and functional experience of digital sales and cross channel experience.

Lead creation of “minimum viable product”, prioritize critical tasks and enable test and learn approaches to iteratively deliver technical and business solutions.

Lead design of load and scalability testing and successful execution of testing & tuning.

Deliver results within budget, time, quality and strategic and tactical key performance goals.

Document and comply with software quality, data security and compliance processes.

Create proposals and present effectively to a diverse audience; manage stakeholders.

Hire, retain, develop high performing motivated talent and leaders both onshore and offshore. Manages teams in both direct and matrix structures. Manage multi-skilled global contractors and employees.

Drive employee satisfaction and engagement for the Digital organization.

What we’re looking for...

You’ll need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems, or related field.

Accelerated degree preferred.

Required knowledge of sales, eCommerce, Digital experience and Retail operations.

Must have demonstrated experience in partnering with Business and IT teams at multiple levels to drive alignment and delivery of complex problems.

Even better if you have:

Software Engineering and Development experience, including leading IT teams through Business Analysis, Project Management, and digital technologies.

A history of embracing and incubating emerging technology and open source products

Ability to collaborate with various partners in the tech, startup and academic ecosystems

The ability to seed and extend innovation into the greater organization to develop key talent, consistent with that of a leading technology company

Technical Leadership: the ability to choose the right technologies and inspire your teammates to deliver quality software solutions

Strong presentation skills to communicate complex concepts effectively.

Strong experience in SRE, Microservices, Cloud, Web ,Native (IOS/Android) & related Digital technologies.

Experience with relevant project and program delivery experience. Systems Administration or Engineering background preferred.

Experience with technology leadership, including solid understanding of technology selection, architecture, and full stack implementation.

Delivery experience in highly available and massively scalable ecommerce systems and services. Including Experience supporting mobile web and/ or native systems.

Direct people management experience, including leadership of diverse global teams. Experience leading senior talent, mentoring and coaching.

Experience with metrics instrumentation and leveraging digital analytics to drive experience and performance improvements. Strong experience with A-B testing and multi-variant trials.

Experience in troubleshooting & supporting mission critical 24X7 production systems, lead real-time high stake risk mitigation plan and drive timely decisions

Experience in business process transformation, user experience optimization.

Experience in Agile Process & methodologies.

Experience managing Medium to large scale ecommerce applications.

Experience building and leading a team in the development and rapid delivery of next-generation digital products

Implement MVP solutions that will drive long term technical strategy

Review, contribute to, and oversee the code and architectural patterns designed by senior-level engineers on your team

Collaborate with product managers and other partners to build a product strategy and roadmap

Collaborate with architects, other teams, product owners, and software engineers to drive the implementation of new applications

Take ideas and concepts, and visualize them in ways such that they are communicated effectively and compellingly for internal leaders, partners and customers

Understanding of ways to lead a team developing in an Agile environment

A robust portfolio of shipped code on GitHub or other open Source contributions and experience with distributed/scalable systems is a plus

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire


This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

What We Can Offer You:

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

Let's Stay Connected:

Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

Job Title: HR Operations Associate Analyst - Entry Level
Job Description:
JOB ID: 653217BR

Date posted: Sep. 25, 2023




Description:

Who We Are: At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics our products play an important role in the national security of the United States and more than 70 other countries, ensuring peace and stability around the world. Highly trained and specialized personnel and facilities are key to the company's unrivaled success in the aeronautics industry. Our team of more than 25,000 has pre-eminent expertise in advanced aircraft design and production, modification and support, stealth technology, and systems integration.

Your Impact: As a member of the Year One Experience Team, you will impact the experience of thousands of new employees’ careers from first year Interns to high level Executives. If you are passionate about how casing Lockheed Martin's unique company culture, mission, and values to our newest team members, this may be the perfect role for you! Our On-Boarding function is in the midst of creating positive large-scale change and is seeking a team member to help us continue to lead by example and implement collaborative new hire strategies while sharing the resources needed for all new employees to make a smooth and positive transition.

A Day in the Life: As the first impression of Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Headquarters, you will be essential in shaping the new employee experience beginning before day one. From coordinating incoming employees Day-1 instructions, New Employee Orientation (NEO), new employee online internal engagement, and to creating targeted e-learning content and more, you will have the opportunity to opportunity to engage in a variety of efforts within our On-Boarding Center. Although your primary focus will be to ensure an efficient, positive, and seamless transition for our employees, may also find yourself:

Contacting incoming employees prior to start date to answer questions and assist with completion of pre onboarding documents.
Executing Homeland Security procedures, I-9s and eVerify - Provide information on On-Boarding Center policies and procedures.
Open and close OBC facility, ensuring rooms are secure, computers are updated, and room prep complete.
Participating in strategic initiatives that will continue to enhance the new employee experience and further streamline the On-Boarding processes.
Developing relationships with SME’s across business functions to help ensure up to date and relevant content for our new hires.
Supporting the implementation of New Employee Orientation to ensure new hires, rehires, recalls, and transfers are supported and engaged about Lockheed Martin's mission, values, and culture.

About You: In this role, your human resources experience coupled with your ability to positively engage with those around you, will help you succeed. Your ability to seek out answers to the unknown and the passion to persevere when encountering resistance is what sets you apart. As a critical thinker, you can make a positive impact by providing data-driven people solutions that are efficient, effective, and flexible. Most likely, you'll be in your element, presenting to a variety of audiences and communicate skillfully when speaking to your work.


Basic Qualifications:



Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources or related field
Demonstrated ability and experience as a facilitator or presenter
Ability to work independently and execute projects with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated experience using relevant software tools/solutions, e.g., Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project), SharePoint, Slack, Zoom, Box, etc.

Desired Skills:



At least two years of experience in one of the following areas: On-Boarding administration, Human Resources Business Partner, Employee Relations, Talent Management, Organizational Development
Prior experience with applicant tracking systems such as Kenexa/BrassRing, processingI-9/ eVerify
Prior experience developing, recording, and producing e-learning content
Strong communication skills both oral and written and customer service orientation
Project experience, including developing project plans, identifying stakeholders, preparing corresponding communication plans, identifying milestones, deadlines, and metrics to assess outcomes/results
Continuous Improvement Training/Mindset
Change Management Training/Experience
Strong analytical skills
Working knowledge of Lockheed Martin policies and procedures

Clearance Level:

None


Other Important Information You Should Know




Expression of Interest:

By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.


Ability to Work Remotely:

Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.


Work Schedules:

Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.


Schedule for this Position:

4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week


Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.


At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility.

If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you’re invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.


Experience Level:

4 yr and up College


Business Unit:

AERONAUTICS COMPANY


Relocation Available:

Yes


Career Area:

Human Resources


Type:

Full-Time


Shift:

First



At Lockheed Martin, we apply our passion for purposeful innovation to keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges.

Mission-Focused Innovation: From aerospace to outer space to cyber space, you can solve the world's most complex challenges for our customers.

Foundational Values: Our culture of performance excellence, ethics, teamwork and inclusion is embedded in everything we do.

Diverse Career Opportunities with Meaningful Work: Grow your career and skills for life. Our technology-driven learning platforms and programs enable your development and agility.

Your Health, Your Wealth, Your Life: Our flexible schedules, competitive pay and comprehensive benefits enable you to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

Empowered to Be Your Best: Use your strengths to make a difference in the lives of one another, our customers, our communities and our planet.

Commitment to Sustainability: We foster innovation, integrity and security to preserve the environment, strengthen diverse communities and propel growth.

Here, the possibilities are endless because we offer:

Flexible Schedules, dependent on role
Levels: Student, Entry, Mid, Senior, Management
Locations: Nationwide & OCONUS Positions

Let’s take a closer look at the role of a Director of Financial Planning & Analysis to determine if this opportunity is right for you!
The Director of Financial Planning and Analysis is responsible for directing all company financial planning and analysis functions, transforming operational data into insights for senior management in support of short and long-term financial goals. The Director of FP&A will be responsible for preparing and providing timely and relevant financial analysis, key performance indicators (KPIs), business plans, and working models to identify opportunities and gaps needed to make informed business decisions. Success in this role will be achieved through effective cross-functional business partnerships with senior leadership and providing strategic finance support and thought leadership in support of company goals, strategy, and objectives. This role reports to the Senior Vice President of Finance, Accounting & Compliance.
Here’s more of what you will do… (OK, not all in one day!)
A Director of Financial Planning and Analysis can be expected to perform the following tasks in this role as a routine part of their job:
Conducts in-depth, insightful, and timely financial analysis, including variance analysis, profitability assessments, and scenario modeling.
Identifies trends, risks, and opportunities within the financial data and provides actionable insights to senior management.
Develops key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial metrics to monitor and drive the company's financial performance.
Develops, generates, and delivers reports and dashboards in support of day-to-day operations and strategic decision making.
Leads development of dashboards in support of monitoring and tracking financial performance; Levels: market, enterprise, hometown, business unit, portfolio, supplier, channel, and customer segment.
Understands reporting needs of customers and business units through cross-functional collaboration.
Creates effective strategies to collect internal and external relevant data, analyze information, conduct research, and implement analytics solutions to drive business performance.
Communicates analytic results to business using static and dynamic graphic displays of data, written reports, and presentations.
Leads development of monthly, quarterly, annual, and long-range volume forecasts and business plans (i.e., development and compilation, process, timeline, and presentation).
Guides the exploration of statistical and predictive analysis techniques in the development of forecasting models for use in business plans.
Ensures regular evaluation of selected forecasting models for accuracy (error).
Fosters strategic partnership development of FP&A team with Brand Management leaders to help guide strategic portfolio profitability decisions.
Supports the Project Management Office (PMO) by tracking, analyzing, and providing financial information and insight for strategic initiatives and projects.
Manages collaborative development of optimal portfolio pricing strategies by customer channel and portfolio line of business.
Collaborates with Brand Management team on price strategies through use of market price point data, price sensitivities, price indexes and price elasticity models.
Identifies pricing opportunities through insights that will drive growth within customer segments and portfolios.
Guides development of competitive market intelligence analysis to partner with Brand Management and Sales teams in delivering fact-based selling stories for high value customer sales calls.
Owns key relationships with syndicated data consultants, ensuring competitive market data needs of the organization are met and routinely evaluated for effectiveness.
Partners with CIO and technology leadership team to develop and execute company data governance and data management strategies.
Ensures data accuracy, integrity and consistency in all reports and analyses.
Drives continuous improvement in financial processes and tools, reporting methodologies, and analysis techniques.
Implements best practices and leverages emerging technologies to improve processes.
Builds cross-functional working relationships and provides financial reporting, guidance and leadership to all areas of the organization (i.e., Sales, Brand, Operations, and other Shared Service departments).
Motivates and provides positive leadership to FP&A team. Mentors, coaches, supports and provides guidance to FP&A team members in their roles, career path and professional development.
Fosters an optimistic culture of excellence, collaboration, continuous improvement, and continued learning.
Provides opportunities and guidance that enables the transfer of learning into effective practice for team members.
This list is not all inclusive of other tasks and subtasks that may be necessary in performing this role, but rather an overview of the role’s primary work tasks.
Here’s what you must have to be considered for this role…
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field
Ten+ Years Progressively Responsible Experience in Financial Planning, Accounting, or Business Analysis with at least three years leading annual forecasting process
Experience using Analytical Software in Predictive and Statistical Applications; Advanced Technical Expertise; Financial Systems/Applications; Database Querying
Highly proficient/Expert level in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools (Microsoft Power BI)
Strong Communication, Presentation and Relationship Building Skills (both up and down in the organization)
Strong leadership skills and experience mentoring a developing a high-performance team
Here’s what we hope you have…
MBA or CPA designation
Five+ Years Experience Leading and Developing Analyst Teams
Experience Implementing and/or Using SQL, Python, R, Alteryx or Other Statistical Analysis or Programming Software
Workday Financials Experience (including Prism and Accounting Center)

Job Title: Senior IT Business Relationship Management, Neuromodulation
Job Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

About Abbott

Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.

Free medical coverage for employees* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO

An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution

Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.

A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.

A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

The Opportunity

Based in either Austin or Plano, Texas, is an opportunity for a Sr IT Business Relationship Manager, Neuromodulation to join our team. We’re looking for an experienced Business Relationship Manager to support the Neuromodulation business, which is a unit within the Medical Devices Division. The successful candidate will be able to partner with business leaders to develop and refine their IT strategy, navigate the IT organization to successfully deliver technology projects, and support the successful completion of their critical technology-dependent goals.

What You’ll Work On

The Sr. IT Business Relationship Manager, Neuromodulation will be responsible for:

Managing the IT portfolio for the Neuromodulation IT business

Support the development and execution of the business IT strategy through successful, consistent, and predictable delivery of programs, projects, and applications.

Understanding the core business processes across the Neuromodulation business.

Develop an understanding of existing and emerging technologies that support core business processes and have an awareness of relevant regulations that impact technology.

Align resources and priorities within broader Abbott IT as well as the Neuromodulation business to ensure successful delivery against corporate goals and obligations.

Developing IT Capital and Expense financial projects, planning, and oversight for the relevant IT portfolio.

Partnering with business leaders to eliminate redundant systems and automate manual operations where appropriate, while implementing best practices.

Resolving issues raised to governance committees of projects and ensure that projects remain in scope where appropriate.

Act as a champion of change for technology innovation with functional partners, influencing stakeholders and partners towards successful implementation of IT projects while maintain focus on business goals.

Collaborating with key Abbott divisions to support cross-divisional business initiatives and explore IT synergies and efficiencies.

Managing conflict, prioritizing efforts, and negotiating through differences between functional business leaders and other IT stakeholders.

Support partner to the Director of Neuromodulation IT for alignment of the IT strategy, delivery and support of projects that deliver value for Abbott.

Support the maintenance of a robust technology roadmap which covers all areas of business unit in alignment with business requests and IT delivery functions.

Be a champion of change and innovation. Stimulates creativity and innovation in others. Open to new ideas. Supports those who initiate change and take risks. Promotes a Global Perspective.

Constant awareness of evolving regulatory requirements and their applicability to the business process and IT portfolio and influences the IT stakeholders and partners in addressing these evolutions in the most efficient way.

Develops, proposes, sells and implements innovative solutions to improve business outcomes in support of the business strategies.

Partner and collaborate with key IT staff of other Abbott divisions to support cross divisional business initiatives and explore IT synergies and efficiencies.

Provide structured ongoing governance of new demand received by the functional business in Neuromodulation.

Closely support and/or lead critical IT initiatives for the business unit.

Support the management of IT budgets, project capital/RCE expenditures and ROI.

Continually drive opportunities for cost reductions and cost avoidance.

Responsible for all aspects of people leadership for people reporting into this tole; setting expectations, coaching, counseling, developing, evaluating, feedback, hiring, discipline and separation. Determine necessary skills set.

Confronts and deals with people issues in a constructive and timely manner. Responsible for morale of team and promotes cohesive attitude.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration or another discipline relevant for the healthcare industry or equivalent experience.

Healthcare industry experience

At least 8+ years in Business Relationship Management or IT Project Management or Business analysis experience focused on Change and stakeholders’ management.

Strong communicator both written and oral; required.

Scope identification & formation, project deliverable authoring/ formation across PMI phase gates

Preferred qualifications:

Salesforce Program/ Project Management experience (8+ years of experience, leading CRM projects); preferred

Strong presentation skills to senior leaders and financial tracking; preferred

Strong stakeholder management at the Director, Sr. Director, Divisional VP levels to influence without direct authority; preferred.

Apply Now

Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.


The base pay for this position is $118,000.00 – $236,000.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

Performs highly advanced (senior-level) consultative services and technical assistance work in the Division for Laboratory and Infectious Disease Services (LIDS) under the direction of the Technical Resources Director for LIDS. Coordinate with LIDS programs and HHSC IT to plan, develop, implement, and oversee major IT projects. Analyzes LIDS program requirements, and procedures, and develops strategies for improving IT-related program operations. Coordinates and oversees projects and applications within the LIDS IT portfolio and oversees and monitors project progress. Identify issues and risks on projects and initiatives. Prepares summaries and briefings for senior management on major projects. Coordinates and completes LIDS and agency assignments on IT procurement, IT project, and capital authority requests working with program managers, IT, and Budget for accurate summaries of needs and appropriate actions. Works under minimal supervision, with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.



Essential Job Functions:
(30%) Project Management (PM) Oversight of IT Projects: Works with division and section executives to define and prioritize IT projects for the division. Coordinates with LIDS leadership, Section IT liaisons, IT, Budget, and Information Resources to identify, define and analyze business/system requirements. Assist with the coordination and implementation of IT projects currently in flight and oversee the delivery of services. Assist with identifying and prioritizing business needs, ensuring alignment with agency goals. Identifies potential project risks and escalates as appropriate. Maintains an open issue/resolution list. Records and updates project issues and resolutions and ensures the retention of documentation in a shared location. May act as a PM when one is not provided, or once the project transitions to operational support and maintenance. Point of contact (POC) for the division on priority and complex projects. Train, lead, assign, and/or prioritize the work of section IT Liaisons as needed. Follows up frequently with IT staff to ensure issues are resolved.
(20%) PM Framework/IT Governance: Serves as senior technical consultant for LIDS programs in identifying issues and opportunities and facilitates appropriate action regarding information resources & capital authority. Provides highly advanced technical support to managers to plan, implement, manage, and monitor projects, programs, and services related to IT, & capital authority. Provide guidance to managers in the development and integration of new procedures to improve programs, and advises and interpret policies, procedures, rules, regulations, and standards of DSHS, Department of Information Resources, Health and Human Services Commission, and other relevant agencies. Identify opportunities to utilize existing or future technology to meet business needs. Provides project management consultation to project sponsors, works with managers to improve operational efficiency, and spearheads quality improvement efforts and special projects as needed. Work with HHSC IT and Program staff (SMEs) to draft Governance Intakes, Project Business Cases, Workbooks, and other required documents to initiate IT projects, as well as draft PIRBOs (Post Implementation Review of Business Outcomes) for completed IT projects.
(20%) Communications: Serves as LIDS IT liaison to all areas of HHSC Information Technology (e.g., Governance, Project Management, Management Services, Application Development, Procurement, Business Operations) and with the Budget Section on IT procurement, capital authority issues, and project work plans. Communicates both on a complex technical level and a non-technical level as needed with others (internally and externally) to provide, exchange, or verify information. Answers inquiries, address issues, and resolves problems and/or complaints. Takes the lead on completing division assignments concerning IT-related matters and coordinating with programs to assure the accuracy and validity of information. Keeping upper leadership aware of the progression of status, and prioritizing scope as needed. Communicate changes and division needs with section IT Liaisons. May lead or participate in division meetings providing updates on completed or planned activities.
(15%) Policy/Procedure/QA: Analyzes LIDS business processes to identify opportunities and develop strategies for improvement. Identifies problems in IT-related program operations across LIDS and seeks solutions. Analyze policies and procedures to determine the impact on processes and existing systems. Identify issues concerning technical limitations and key product requirements. Stay up to date with new or changing IT policies/procedures as they relate to LIDS IT applications, related support, governance, and procurement, and troubleshoot as needed.
(10%) IT-Related Issues: Consult with LIDS staff on software/hardware purchases, review software/hardware justifications, and makes recommendations to managers. Keep track of Software renewals, and projecting hardware needs. Provide guidance and assistance to LIDS staff on the resolution of IT-related issues. This may include communication with IT Help Desk to facilitate removing hurdles to complete the resolution.
(5%) Miscellaneous: Performs related work as assigned. Other duties as assigned include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency's obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.




Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of computer systems and applications for data management
Knowledge of public administration and management techniques
Knowledge of program planning and implementation
Knowledge of Project Management practices, principles, and processes
Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies

Skill in business, program, and systems analysis
Skill in developing goals and objectives and developing procedures to monitor and evaluate progress
Skill in coordinating and complex problem solving
Skill in writing analyses, documentation, and reports
Skill in identifying problems, evaluating alternatives, and negotiating and implementing solutions
Skill in translating complex technical information verbally and in writing for non-technical audiences

Ability to prepare concise reports
Ability to develop and evaluate policies and procedures
Ability to write and revise standards and procedures
Ability to assess and manage priorities
Ability to organize and present complex information to a variety of audiences verbally and in writing
Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and effectively
Ability to work in a team-approach collaborative environment
Ability to apply a critical and analytical approach to problem solving
Ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts
Ability to plan, organize, schedule, and monitor completion of assigned projects
Ability to work independently and deliver results in an environment of broad, consultative management



Registration or Licensure Requirements:
N/A



Initial Selection Criteria:

Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university required, with major course work in a field relevant to the posting is generally preferred.


Preferred minimum of four or more years’ experience in the field of IT with two years of related IT Liaison or Business Analysis experience.


Minimum one-year experience in project management/project coordination.





Additional Information:
All applicants selected for an interview will be required to submit a writing sample and will conduct an in-basket exercise. Due to budgetary limitations, full salary range may not be offered.

Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

There is no direct military equivalent.

There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. Your Education

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Enterprise Products Partners L.P. is the largest publicly traded partnership and a leading North American provider of energy services to producers and consumers of natural gas, natural gas liquids, crude oil, refined products and petrochemicals. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, Enterprise Products is ranked 62nd on the FORTUNE 500 and has more than 6,500 employees. Enterprise’s large, integrated portfolio of operationally and geographically diverse assets, highlighted by its 50,000-mile pipeline network, serves as the foundation for organic growth opportunities. As a provider of largely fee-based services, Enterprise is less susceptible to commodity price fluctuations and offers stable sources of revenue. The partnership’s service offerings include onshore and offshore energy gathering, processing, storage, fractionation, terminalling, transportation and marketing. Additionally, energy professionals are discovering rewarding opportunities with Enterprise Products by putting their skills to work in exciting new growth areas, developing markets and pursuing innovative solutions for meeting the needs of customers and promote energy security for the country. Make the most of your talents in a fast-paced environment driven by people who strive for achievement. Enjoy corporate strength, stability, and a rewarding career at a growing industry-leading and diverse operating company with a track record for success. Tap into the professional possibilities of Enterprise Products Company.

Equipment performance (failures).
Management information will be in the form of monthly, quarterly, and annual reports to corporate and field management.
Special projects and reports.

Experience at an intermediate level in the following Microsoft applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio, Outlook, and Project are required.
Midstream energy business (gathering and processing, pipeline, fractionation or storage) or related field is preferred.
Ability to quickly learn new applications such as Oracle, PI, and others.
Ability to interpret, organize, chart, graph and present large amounts of data into useful management information.

Job Category
