Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Business Technology sets the new standard of enterprise IT. Built on the foundation of our core values - Trust, Ohana, Innovation - we own more than the traditional IT components with a heavy focus on working closely with our business partners for amazing outcomes. Our goal is to deliver technology that is centered around our business and our collective success. We are responsible for technology strategy, Salesforce on Salesforce, customer and partner enablement, applications engineering, infrastructure, collaboration, enterprise operations, architecture, and program enablement. We lead the world’s foremost Salesforce implementation and enable our global Ohana to do their best work by using our platform.

Salesforce IT accelerates the success of the Salesforce family through the best implementation of Salesforce on the planet. We value Trust, Scale, and Integration. We relentlessly pursue these values with the help of modern, lean, and self-governing Scrum teams. As part of Salesforce IT, you will play a key role on a hard-working, creative, and lively team. You will make a significant difference in product discovery and delivery. Come grow with us in an environment where professional development is encouraged, volunteerism is the norm, and innovation is a daily occurrence.

Role Description

The Solution Architect is responsible for optimally designing and handling the delivery of cloud based solutions and technologies. Our technology stack is largely based on Salesforce products and APIs, with a specific focus on custom Force.com solutions, Lightning and Aura components, Mulesoft integration patterns, and Heroku. The Solution Architect role also requires a comprehensive understanding of the cloud-computing ecosystem. Our Architects typically specialize in a Salesforce platform (Sales, Service, Community, IoT, Einstein, Marketing, and Commerce Clouds) with the ability to develop solutions across multiple platforms.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with Delivery Managers, functional Solution Architects, and directly with business partners to architect technology solutions to drive successful business outcomes;
Design ground-breaking technical solutions and work directly with customers to meet their business requirements in accordance with industry standard processes;
Clearly articulate business architecture (mission/vision, capability models, capability assessments) and technical architecture (current and future state diagrams, solution standard processes, reference architectures, design patterns).
Lead and mentor development teams on projects;
Implement sound development practices and ensure the quality delivery of enterprise solutions;
Serve as a trusted advisor to internal business partners;
Work collaboratively exercising strong communication skills, especially in instructing complex concepts;
Continuously provide standard processes to ensure the customer receives desired returns on investment
Identify and lead internal critical initiatives to grow our internal consulting practice; Serve as an active contributor to the overall knowledge-base and expertise of the architectural community.



Qualifications and Skills:

10+ years relevant experience preferred
3+ years of relevant business analyst/product owner, technical lead or architecture experience preferred
Experienced knowledge of Object Oriented programming
A related technical degree required
Multiple SFDC certifications preferred
Good understanding of a complex business, application, security, infrastructure or enterprise architecture domain
Hands-on expertise driving and completing business process modeling, POC's, Pilots and solution implementations
Extensive experiences with integration platforms supporting critical, large volumes
Good understanding of a specific business, application, security, infrastructure or enterprise domain within the enterprise including business processes and solution capabilities
Good understanding of architectural landscape, including:
Knowledge of at least one major architectural area (WebDev, AppStore, Business, Integration, Data, Security, Infrastructure, enterprise, etc.)
Familiarity of ALL other major architectural areas
Has acted as a lead business, technical or solution architect in a specific functional/technical area or enterprise architecture disciple in the past
Good understanding of Salesforce product architecture
Ability to architect and support delivery of solutions using a major technology employed in IT: Java, Force.com, Front-End technologies/CMS (Object Oriented Javascript, CSS), SOA-MuleSoft, Ruby, IAM, SSO, Encryption and good understanding of remaining technologies, Architecture tool like Truox, Graffel, Erwin, etc
Experience/Knowledge of CPQ, Salesforce Revenue Cloud and Sales Could is a plus
Stays ahead of technology trends for a specific business, application, security or infrastructure domain
Ability to mentor and develop junior team members
Ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment
Ability to be a great teammate, motivate people, ensure accountability and achieve results
Ability to efficiently communicate status and risk to the team and manager

PASSION: Passionate about Customer Success
BEGINNERS MIND: Always learning; approaches each interaction with open mind; great listener and hands-on

Overview and Summary:
We are Automotive Business Scientists. We empower our clients to turn overwhelming industry data into discovery, action and measured success. We are unique market leaders because we find and examine possibilities through the clarity of a scientific lens. To solve the toughest client challenges, we need curious, creative and dedicated people to join our team. Position preference is for candidates local to the Dallas-Fort Worth area; however, consideration will be given to exceptional remote candidates who can contribute effectively to our team. All candidates must be available to travel in person to the Dallas office a minimum of three to four times per year.

We search out individuals who align with our core values and who adhere to the highest standards of integrity and ethics in everything they do. Our company is filled with the brightest minds and the biggest hearts at every level. We recognize that personal success takes on many different forms of the course of our lives – both professional and personally – so we provide a myriad of benefits and programs focused on Wellbeing, Growth, Community and Recognition. One size does not fit all, so we encourage every Urban Scientist to discover their own formula for success. If this sounds like the kind of company you would like to work with, Apply Now!

Position Overview: This position supports the delivery of Sales Performance - Urban Science client services on an account team. The position is focused on both technical & client handling skills, with a heavier focus on client handling and relationship building. While assisting in fostering client relationships, the incumbent will assist in monthly updates, quarterly updates, client ad-hoc support, client market study consultation, client training, etc. The role may be required to collaborate with Solution Engineering & Implementation (SEI) teams to successfully deliver Sales Performance-related solutions that meet the client’s business requirements at the direction of the Sr. Manager. This role has current Hybrid Workplace flexibility local to our Plano, TX office or our Long Beach, CA office. Candidate must be available and willing to work in person in Plano or Long Beach up to two days per month, and must be available to travel in person to the Dallas office a minimum of three to four times per year, which may be adjusted as required by the demands of the work.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
University degree required; technical background strongly preferred (i.e., engineering, applied math, statistics, applied science, information systems, operations research, etc.) from an accredited college or university, or equivalent foreign institution. Non-technical degrees will be considered if candidate possesses appropriate level of analytical and technical knowledge required for the role.

URBAN SCIENCE is committed to providing an employee experience that is inclusive and welcoming and recognizes that having a wide range of perspectives and world views breeds better outcomes. We work to ensure that policies, practices and procedures relating to hiring, training, development, career opportunities and salary are administered equitably. We assure that we operate in accordance with all applicable employment laws and hold our employees accountable to do the same. We do not discriminate in any aspect of the employment relationship based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, disability, weight, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, or other protected characteristics.

Base Salary Range: $57,700.00 - $70,380.00 + discretionary bonus potential. This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
With limited guidance, plans organizes, develops, and delivers client-requested reports, deliverables, and projects on time, adhering to client-requested specifications.
Designs, creates, and manages client databases, utilizing Urban Science proprietary software, ensuring accurate and high-quality data.
Serves as a contact for, and develops relationships with, the client in order to assist in effectively responding to client requests and inquiries.
Acquires and maintains a thorough understanding of client data for assigned projects in order to properly create client deliverables.
Assumes responsibility for accurate and high-quality data being utilized on assigned projects.
Accurately performs application coding and testing functions associated with the development of custom client software.
Tracks, processes, analyzes, and verifies data to improve accuracy and quality.
Use technical skills to accurately monitor, update, and maintain Urban Science's internal software systems.
Attends project meetings to document meeting notes and stay up to date on project deliverables.
Partners with internal teams to ensure that software is properly installed, set up, and functioning at established quality levels.
Adheres to quality control standards for Urban Science and client organizations.
Coordinates with individuals or teams to complete analyses, tasks, and projects on time and with high quality.
Proactively communicates with management to provide updates and report issues in a timely manner.
Actively works with the manager to understand and implement solutions to improve NPS (client satisfaction).
Actively supports and participates in required Urban Science training programs to achieve targeted development objectives.
Works with manager in completing own annual goal setting and performance review in a timely manner.
Provides training and coaching to Analysts as directed and assumes responsibility for reviewing the accuracy and quality of their work.
Works with manager to prioritize other duties as assigned

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Database: Requires strong technical proficiency with SQL, including the ability to write complex queries, optimize performance, and troubleshoot issues. Experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), including designing, developing, and maintaining ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes. Proficiency in either C# or Python for scripting and automation tasks related to data manipulation and integration. In-depth knowledge of relational database concepts, data modeling, and database management systems (DBMS). Experience in database administration tasks such as performance tuning, indexing, and maintaining data integrity. Familiarity with data warehousing principles and practices.

MS Office: Requires demonstrated intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel for charting and graphing of data, writing formulas and utilizing functions, and filtering, sorting, and formatting of data via various Excel tools such as Pivot Tables and slicers. Requires knowledge of MS Word and PowerPoint.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
University degree required; technical background strongly preferred (i.e., engineering, applied math, statistics, applied science, information systems, operations research, etc.) from an accredited college or university, or equivalent foreign institution. Minimum of 2 years related work experience required

Position title: Sr. SAP Vistex Business Analyst

Work location: Irving, TX (Hybrid role)

Current Need

We are looking to add a Sr. SAP Vistex Business Analyst to join our SAP AMS team. The position is hybrid, located in Las Colinas, Irving, TX.

Position Description

Responsible for leading a team of SAP Vistex technical & functional consultants and managing the outcomes in various SAP applications & processes.
Core member of SAP application maintenance services team responsible for delivery of new SAP service functionality
Partners with other team members to design and develop functionality that address business functional requirements.
Makes and tests configuration changes to SAP modules to reflect the functional design decisions that were made.
Responsible for value-stream identification and end-to-end traceability documentation
Validation & acceptance of MSP deliverables for complex Vistex processes (such as Contracts, Chargebacks, Rebates & Incentives) & Integrations with multiple IT teams. Provide guidance & ensure standards of delivery by the MSP for optimized and effective outcomes.

Must have skills and Responsibilities:

Multiple lifecycle Vistex implementations or 4+ years SAP Vistex experience
Solid understanding of the Vistex business processes such as Contracts, Chargebacks, Billbacks, Rebates, Incentives.
Solid understanding of the Vistex MDM such as Vendor Master, Customer Master, Material Master, etc and the syndication processes.
Experience working with MSP resources onsite and offshore - both development and quality assurance.
Expertise and demonstrated experience in test life cycle management which includes organizing and managing all phases of the test process, planning tests, executing tests, and defect management process.
Demonstrated experience in solutioning using multiple disparate platforms/applications (SAP & non-SAP) to meet needed outcomes and support of the same.

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies - ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry's technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Job Title: Business Analyst Supervisor (IT Business Analyst IV)
Job Description:
Business Analyst Supervisor (IT Business Analyst IV) (00037173)
Organization: TEXAS EDUCATION AGENCY
Primary Location: Texas-Austin
Work Locations: Texas Education Agency 1701 NORTH CONGRESS AVENUE Austin 78701


Job: Computer and Mathematical
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full-time
Standard Hours Per Week: 40.00
State Job Code: 0224
Salary Admin Plan: B
Grade: 27
Salary (Pay Basis): 6,681.16 - 8,990.33 (Monthly)
Number of Openings: 1
Overtime Status: Exempt
Job Posting: Oct 20, 2023, 1:01:12 PM
Closing Date: Ongoing
Description


MISSION: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) will improve outcomes for all public-school students in the state by providing leadership, guidance, and support to school systems.

Core Values:

We are Determined: We are committed and intentional in the pursuit of our main purpose, to improve outcomes for students.
We are People-Centered: We strive to attract, develop, and retain the most committed talent, representing the diversity of Texas, each contributing to our common vision for students.
We are Learners: We seek evidence, reflect on success and failure, and try new approaches in the pursuit of excellence for our students.
We are Servant Leaders: Above all else, we are public servants working to improve opportunities for students and provide support to those who serve them.

The posted salary range budgeted for this position is between 6,681.16 and 8,990.33 monthly. New hires will be typically brought into the agency at a starting salary between the posted minimum and the average pay of employees in their same classification in the Office of Technology unless the average pay exceeds the midpoint for the state position’s classification salary group. Offers will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience and qualifications and will thoughtfully consider internal pay equity for agency staff who perform similar duties and have similar qualifications. The top half of the posted salary range is generally reserved for candidates who far exceed the requirements and qualifications for the role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Business Analyst Supervisor position at the Texas Education Agency (internally referred to as the PMO Business Analyst Supervisor) works on multiple applications that serve teachers and school districts, gather student and school data, manage funding, and provide compliance oversight (such as the Foundation School Funding, and Educator Certification) for all Texas public schools. These applications help TEA improve outcomes for all of Texas’ 5 million plus students.

The PMO Business Analyst Supervisor serves as the conduit between the program/customer community and the software development team. Work involves managing and overseeing the gathering, development, and documentation of user requirements; mentoring team members; the review, assessment, and development of business processes; the performance of post-implementation support of systems; and support of the systems development life cycle. Supervise the work of up to three (3) direct reports. This position will report to the PMO Business Analysis Manager and works under the Senior Director of Data Standards, Data Quality, and Business Analysis within the Office of Information Technology.

Flexible work location within the state of Texas may be considered for qualified candidates.

Please note that a cover letter, resume, and short answer responses are required attachments for applying to this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Applicants who are strongly being considered for employment must submit to a national criminal history background check.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Oversight – Supervises, oversees, assesses, and reviews user requirements and deliverables to automate or improve software systems. Oversees and analyzes policies and procedures to determine their effect on automated systems, functional areas, and team effectiveness.
Mentoring – Supervises and mentors staff on policies, processes, and procedures. Proactively identifies and mitigates potential project or staff risks. Provides assistance to developers, systems analysts, or customers on software systems; and provides production support as needed.
Elicitation & Analysis – Elicits requirements using joint application development (JAD), interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints. Analyzes user needs, business processes, pain points, and computer system capabilities to automate or improve existing systems.
Requirements Writing – Transforms information from elicitation sessions into business and functional requirements, use cases, user stories, and software requirements specifications documents, per standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.
Managing Work - Uses initiative and independent judgment to actively participate in the software development lifecycle, including managing deadlines, following change control procedures, tracking requirement status, coordinating UAT, and maintaining requirement traceability.


Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university
Experience: At least five [6] years of experience as a dedicated business analyst:

eliciting requirements from interviews with customers
writing system requirements documents for large and complex project(s);
leading a complete and detailed analysis of business processes is required.
And at least one [1] year of experience working as a Lead BA, or in a lead or supervisory role.
Substitutions: Each additional year of related experience above the required minimum may substitute for education on a year-for-year basis
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with software development life cycle and systems development life cycle concepts
Experience with contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice
Understanding of requirements engineering according to software lifecycle methodologies in a team environment, including Agile
Experience and skill in analyzing and evaluating complex information technology programs, policies, and issues
Experience and skill in developing creative solutions to complex problems and issues
Interviewing and listening skills to talk with individuals and understand their needs and elicit the essential requirements information
Analytical and supervisory skills to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding
Facilitation and observational skills to lead requirements elicitation workshops
Writing ability to communicate information effectively to program area customers, managers, and technical staff
Organizational skills to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with a rapidly changing environment
Interpersonal skills to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholders. May lead and/or participate in developing corrective actions plans for projects or programs
Ability to research and provide special project support to users
Understanding, experience, and development of use cases
Ability to work on and supervise multiple projects at the same time and work constructively as part of a team or teams to coordinate with developers and business users to analyze system characteristics
Ability to communicate technical concepts to professional, non-technical clients or program areas
Belief that all Texas students can achieve at high levels and are able to succeed in college, career or the military.
Business analysis certification from industry standard organizations, such as International Institute of Business Analysis, is beneficial

As an equal opportunity employer, we hire without consideration to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age or veteran status, unless an applicant is entitled to the military employment preference.

Professional Solutions Delivered, LLC (ProSoDel) is a total solutions provider for government and commercial customers in the areas of Program Management, Logistics and Information Technology Support Services. We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our team of professionals in support of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

Essential Duties & Job Functions:

In this role, you will manage the delivery of stakeholder and business partners initiatives on the ServiceNow platform.
This position will interact with various levels of management, internal service teams, and third-party vendors in order to support customers within the Department of Veteran's Affairs.
You will identify and solve for core business problems by turning high-level business requirements into clear, well-defined User Stories and Acceptance Criteria.
As needed, you will perform gap analysis of current and/or desired processes to ServiceNow’s OOB functionality and conduct “walkthroughs” of proposed solution to align stakeholder expectations.
You will collaborate with ServiceNow product owner, process owners, platform architect and engineering leads, and PMO to develop and maintain ServiceNow product roadmaps that aligns with the organization’s strategic objectives while balancing platform technical manageability and business needs.
You will support project team in creation of non-project management, pre-release artifacts (i.e. process flow diagrams, design mockup, UAT test plan and scripts, etc.). You will plan and develop user enablement content (i.e. operating procedures, how-to documents, training materials, feature release note, etc.).
You will define, setup, and supervise project benefits realization through regular reports and dashboards.
You will conduct periodic business review with team members to communicate realized value, identify improvement opportunities, and strengthen long term partnership.
You will serve as a liaison between the internal customer and development team by promptly respond to inquiries and effectively communicate ServiceNow PPM program status to stakeholders and management.

Abilities:

Possess written and oral communications skills, to include public speaking.
To develop strong remote team and client relationships
Possess excellent supervision/management, analytical, and organizational skills
Demonstrate ability to manage multiple projects on tight deadlines and to prioritize appropriately.
Demonstrate the ability to work collaboratively to achieve objectives.
Possess a solid track record of delivering excellent customer service.

Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations)

United States Citizen
Education:
Bachelor's degree with 6 years’ experience in relevant field, or
Associate's degree with 10 years' experience in relevant field, or
High school diploma with 16 years' experience in relevant field.
Clearance: T2
5+ Years of total IT experience as a Business Analyst
4+ years of experience eliciting requirements and conducting business process reviews/documentation while applying detailed knowledge of ServiceNow to design an optimal solution (maybe non-required)
Experience implementing systems using Agile methodology
Experience working with US Federal Government customers

Non-Required Qualifications

Certified System Administrator (CSA) or other ServiceNow certifications is highly desired
Experience with the ServiceNow Project & Portfolio Management (PPM) application
Experience with the Department of Veteran's Affairs
Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), Project Management Professional (PMP), Agile SAFe, and/or SCRUM Master certifications

As a Manager - Business Development, you will manage research, analyze, and development new business opportunities. You will be responsible for creating effective business plans to generate revenue, increase product lines, expand into new markets, and improve customer satisfaction. You will analyze and monitor business growth and decline, as well as provide possible solutions and new ways to strengthen the Company's competitive position within the industry.

Responsibilities:

High School Degree or Equivalent required; Bachelor's Degree - Business Administration preferred.
5 years required of experience directly related to position.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong business analysis, financial modeling and negotiation skills.
Ability to initiate and develop relationships with key decision makers inside and outside company.

Ability to analyze financial and operational data, statements and projections.
Ability to identify and cultivate external resources.
Ability to establish relationships of trust.

6+ years preferred of experience directly related to position.
6+ years preferred of financial analysis, sales, negotiation.
Knowledge of Wesco’s existing business lines, strengths and challenges preferred.

Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements

The Epic Business Systems Analyst II ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Systems Department. This role supports the Epic applications deployed within the Harris Health System.

Work Experience: Two (2) years within IT OR One (1) year Hospital/Health Care Organizations.

Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)
Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)
Writing / Correspondence
Writing / Reports

Healthcare Information Technology experience.

Why Alamo Group?

Founded in 1969, with its Corporate Headquarters in Seguin, TX, and 32 manufacturing locations in the U.S., Canada, England, France, The Netherlands, Australia, and Brazil, Alamo Group Inc. has been a leader in the design, manufacture, distribution, and service of high quality equipment for infrastructure maintenance, agriculture, and other applications. Seguin is located in South Central Texas along the Guadalupe River, a short distance from San Antonio, TX (25 miles), Austin, TX (50 miles), and many other small/mid-sized cities that offer a unique blend of cultural, entertainment, educational, and recreational activities.

Alamo Group offers competitive pay and a wide range of employee benefits including:

And much more!

Requirements:

Under moderate direction, this position is responsible for maintaining and supporting the Enterprise application business intelligence software, including creating or modifying data warehouses and implementing business intelligence capabilities. In addition, this position will create and maintain dashboards, reports, and web-based applications and interfaces as specified in programming requests.

Develop, maintain, and support Alamo Group Inc. enterprise dashboards in the Power BI environment

Facilitate clarity on enterprise data model, updating data architecture in line with the model
Closely partner with the Operations Financial Analysis teams to help automate, refine, and help the team migrate from legacy processes to a robust cloud environment
Develop, format, and communicate insights from the data for financial and operational reports.
Train others to use and create reports, dashboards, and other data representations
Help shape the presenting data in a meaningful way
Document data and analytics standards, processes, and procedures
Engage in a team environment and complete well-defined tasks to support team goals
Contributes routinely to documentation, backlog refinement, and user stories
Perform additional duties as required or assigned

The ideal candidate will have/be:

Familiar with Data Visualization Online/Server Environments, especially Microsoft Azure and related tools
Proven experience in applying well-developed problem-solving skills (quantitative, conceptual, analytical)
Advanced MS SQL/Python/DAX Knowledge
Experience with Microsoft Azure analytics, AI, machine learning, developer, and database tools
Advanced in MS Office Products
Proactive thinking, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Ability to identify and resolve systems problems and work and deliver results in assigned timeframes
Knowledge of ERP systems, API and web services architecture, and development lifecycle processes
Hands on and results-oriented with a commitment to providing a high-quality service and excellent troubleshooting/problem solving skills
Must be able to work with business partners, project managers, third party developers, IT business analysts and subject matter experts in a professional and collaborative manner to define strategies and implementation approaches
Must be able to work independently in a team environment with local and remote teams.
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
Ability to reason and use good judgment
High attention to detail
Ability to organize and prioritize work
Frequent sitting for extended periods of time. Standard office environment. Occasional lifting/carrying of equipment and/or reports, manuals, etc.
Able to work irregular and/or extended hours including weekends and holidays, including some late night or weekend hours for system/program problem resolution, data recovery or system conversions
Demonstrated ability to exhibit and model: Alamo Group's Core Competencies:
Leading Change / Change Management:Ability to drive improvement of the team, division, and corporate goals and objectives through people. Ability to balance change and continually strive to improve business performance.
Leading People / Teamwork:Ability to design and implement strategies that maximize employees' potential and foster high ethical standards in meeting the team, division, and corporate objectives.
Communication:Ability to explain, advocate, and express facts and ideas in a convincing manner, and negotiate with individuals and groups internally and externally. The ability to develop internal and external networks and identify the issues that impact the work of the organization.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or a related discipline from a four-year college or university required. Master's degree preferred

2+ years of business intelligence and report writing experience required.

Working Conditions:

This position will generally work in an indoor office environment with frequent sitting for extended periods of time. Occasional lifting, pushing, or pulling of 10 pounds may be required to perform routine administrative duties. Requires sufficient manual and visual dexterity to operate standard office equipment.

Job Summary
Reporting to the Assistant Director for Systems Operations, the 3rd Party Systems Administrator is responsible for third-party system configuration and maintenance. This includes enabling and setting up system configurations, evaluating integrations, supporting system upgrades, optimizing existing configurations, troubleshooting issues, and producing system configuration documentation.
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in related field
Three (3) years or more experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations.
Three (3) years or more experience providing customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes.
Six (6) months or more experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit utilizing an ERP or third-party application.
Equivalent combination of experience/education may be considered.
Preferred Education and Experience
Five to seven years of experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations
Five to seven years in customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes
One year to three years of experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit
Master’s degree in a related field
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Provide administrative support and system maintenance for third-party applications (configurations, access updates, data issues, workflow updates, liaison with third-party applications contacts)
Analyze and review system data to maintain timeliness of system operations and identify any possible issues or areas of improvement
Troubleshoot production data and configuration issues related to third party applications
Provide third-party system data and configuration support during system upgrades
Produce job aids and training documentation for third-party systems
Work with stakeholders and module owners to optimize and troubleshoot third-party system configurations
Assist stakeholders, module owners, and business process analysts with understanding integrations between the third-party applications and the ERP system
Generate reports from third-party applications to provide data to functional areas
Participate in enhancement projects involving third-party systems
Physical Activities Working Conditions Additional Information

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. Position Summary

This role is responsible for supporting the development of a vision, roadmap and solution for enterprise Pharmacy Benefit Management products that achieve outcomes and deliver value.
It requires strong relationship management and influencing skills and the ability to partner cross-functionally with key stakeholders to deliver on commitments.
Participate in product discovery activities, deeply understanding the business, the consumers, the market and working with the team to innovate, test and deliver value.
Supports product strategy for the entire life cycle management of a technology/digital product, including purpose, definition, design, planning, development, prototyping and testing. Applies design thinking techniques (e.g., user journeys, wire-framing, prototyping) in order to define product features; develops the roadmap based on effort sizing and overall value to the business.
Facilitates the capturing of consumer and business needs through the creation of user/technology stories for the engineering team to deliver business value
Evaluate current product state to identify opportunities through customer needs, product analysis, digital data and stakeholder conversations.
Provide product demos to inform and gain adoption.
Keep a close pulse on the voice of the customer, identify insights and propose solutions to address problems and maximize latest opportunities.

Required Qualifications

3+ years in healthcare and/or insurance

High technology and data acumen

3+ years experience problem solving and consulting within complex environments

3+ years experience facilitating cross-functional teams’ efforts

Clear and concise oral and written communication skills and strong interpersonal skills

2+ years experience working in an agile environment and leading decentralized teams

Ability to make informed decisions in a high-pressure environment

Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences

Ability to travel up to 4-6x per year

Agile Certification e.g. SAFe® 5 APM or equivalent

Experience in Pharmacy Benefits Management

Relevant Master’s degree

1+ years of mentoring and coaching colleagues

Education

Bachelors Degree or Relevant Experience

Will accept 2 years experience per 1 year college plus required years of product management experience

Pay Range

$90,000.00 - $180,000.00

This is a key role on the Business Systems team as it builds best-in-class Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Quote-to-Cash (QTC) practices that will scale as the company grows. This is a highly cross-functional role, serving as the bridge between multiple teams supporting product launches and improving the quoting/contracts business processes. We are seeking an analyst with strong technical skills, as well as solid business analysis and relationship management capabilities. The individual should have experience managing others or small to mid-size engagements, as well as managing relationships with business partners at various levels of an organization. The candidate needs to be a self-motivated and energetic individual who can meet the challenges of a fast-paced environment.

Your impact

Identify and spearhead continuous improvement initiatives utilizing technology and process automation; drive process improvements and systems solutions, gain buy-in from team members and leadership

Serve as quote-to-cash process and systems subject matter expert to strategic business initiatives; ensure systems and process impacts are appropriately considered

Drive CRM requirements alignment across the organization; help build and establish scalable processes and explore appropriate automation opportunities, reporting applications to fully leverage technology and tools

Project manage initiatives, providing coordination and alignment cross functionally between stakeholders. This includes requirements definition, cross-functional coordination, resource planning & budgeting, and delivery against key milestones

Partner with internal audit function to establish, test and document key application controls and ensure risk mitigation and compliance.

Act as first point of contact for troubleshooting Third Party Vendors, managing integration related issues/tickets, and reviewing/implementing future system upgrades

Qualifications

BA/BS degree, Master’s degree in Business /Accounting/Finance/Information Systems or related field preferred.

5+ years of proven business systems analyst experience in fast paced environment.

3-5 years of leading process improvement initiatives leveraging financial systems automation

Must have

Experience with quote-to-cash, financial reporting, and related CRM requirements

Experience leading financial systems implementations including requirements gathering, design, build, test and roll-out; with the project planning/management and documentation skills

Strong leadership and project management skills including effective communication, facilitation, ability to build and drive cross-functional partnerships

Experience implementing IT controls and SOX compliance preferred

Knowledge of various SDLC and process methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall, etc.)

The position of Analyst, Audit & Business Controls could be based out of any of our locations! (Hybrid)

Summary
The Internal Auditor is responsible for participating in the performance of moderate to complex-level professional business assessment projects that include internal auditing, business process assessment, improvement projects, and data analysis. Includes high visibility and exposure to Senior Management, and works under the general direction of relevant Project Managers, the Audit Manager, and the Internal Audit Director. Will conduct financial, operational, process, information technology, and/or compliance review projects, as well as provide consulting services to organizational management and staff. Must maintain all organizational and professional ethical standards, and interact with both internal and external stakeholders.




What You’ll Do

Provide timely delivery of high-quality audit assignments by planning, organizing, and completing applicable audit work assignments
Participate in the identification and evaluation of the assigned organization’s risk areas and provide relevant input in the development of individual project audit scope and the annual audit plan
Participate in the planning of individual audits including risk assessment activities, mission letter and planning package preparation, defining risks, documenting controls, and developing control tests resulting in documented, executable audit programs
Collect, analyze, and evaluate business data and process information in support of business process evaluations, risk assessment activities, and audit assessments
Perform process walkthroughs and audit procedures (tests), adequately complete working paper documentation, organize opening/closing meetings and materials, and prepare information requests for clients
Communicate results of audit and consulting projects via written reports and oral presentations
Develop and maintain effective relationships with business clients and other team members through individual contacts and group meetings
Pursue professional development opportunities, including external and internal training and professional association memberships, and share information gained with co-workers
Conduct special examinations at the request of the Director Internal Audit or Audit Manager
Other duties as assigned



The information contained in this job description is intended to describe the essential job functions required of those assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job. Please note that management retains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, integrity, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Rexel USA.




What You’ll Need

High School or GED
4 Year / Bachelor's Degree with a focus in Business Administration (Finance, Accounting, or Auditing) preferred
2+ years of experience in Auditing, Finance, Accounting, Operations, or Electrical Distribution
Certification as a CIA, CPA, CA, CMA, or CISA preferred but not required

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Basic knowledge and skill in applying internal auditing and accounting principles and practices, management principles, and preferred business practices
Basic knowledge of the International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing and the Code of Ethics developed by the Institute of Internal Auditors
Working knowledge of management information systems terminology, concepts, and practices
Basic abilities to analyze complex data, evaluate information and systems, and draw logical conclusions
Demonstrated ability to identify trends, patterns, or missing elements within specific business situations and identify possible solutions. Ability to immediately assess presented information and probe deeper to identify root cause of the issue
Maintain composure under pressure while meeting multiple deadlines
Effectively use spreadsheets, presentations and other business software to prepare reports, memos, and summaries to communicate critical business risks or process gaps
Ability to engage with business software and leverage business analytics tools to access relevant data, identify relevant trends, and generate actionable conclusions
Effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills and presentation skills
Ability to develop practical business solutions to complex problems or internal control issues
Ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships to work effectively in a professional team environment
Ability to travel up to 50%

Overview:
ANALYST, BUSINESS PROCESS 3


The Opportunity

Daikin Comfort Technologies Manufacturing, L.P. is seeking a skilled individual for our Analyst, Business Process 3 position at our DTTP - Waller, TX location. The Business Process Improvement (BPI) Analyst will be responsible for curating, maintaining, analyzing and reporting analysis/findings for the Warranty Analytics team. Furthermore, this person will also ensure and elevate the accuracy of the underlying data and processes through testing and validation routines and correcting any issues that may surface. He/She will also be responsible for building reports/applications using the Office 365 Power Platform. If you meet the qualifications listed below, then we invite you to apply for our open position by visiting our website at http://careers.daikincomfort.com and submit your resume.


About DTTP

Daikin Texas Technology Park- has a footprint of 4.23 million square feet under a single roof, and is the third largest factory in the United States. Opened in 2017 as the manufacturing, logistics, and engineering center for Daikin's American subsidiary Goodman, the plant makes heating and air conditioning products sold under the Goodman, Amana, and Daikin brands.

Why work with us?

> Benefits are effective on day one for all full-time direct hires

> Training programs are available to help guide team members and develop new skills

> Growth Opportunities - there are immense opportunities to grow your career

> You will be part of a Global Company - our family brands are backed by Daikin Industries, Ltd.



Responsibilities:
May include:

Business Analysis

Apply process methodologies and gather requirements as required to identify, measure, design, and implement business process improvements. Process mapping, data gathering and analysis, interviews, and workshops are common techniques used by the analyst working directly with functional business teams and IT to improve business functionality, accuracy and quality.


Data Gathering, Information analysis

Lead meetings with process owners throughout the organization to identify key performance data, issues, and areas for improvement. Use office software, databases and other systems to extract data and provide metrics to process owners and management. Use data to identify areas for improvement and set goals for the improved processes. Work with IT to manage current systems and design new programs for the capture and reporting of data from various business systems.
Curate and maintain data and processes
Perform continuous sourcing of internal and external data that could be used in analyses
Produce requested queries, analyses, and reports in a timely manner
Produce reports and applications using Microsoft’s Power Platform (Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps)
Be self sufficient when it comes to data queries and report development
Be resourceful when trying to gather data and utilize all of the resources at their disposal

Identify, Design, and Manage Development of Proposed Business Solutions
Design proposed solutions and present business case and metrics with the project team.
Use standard project management techniques to plan and implement solutions.
If applicable, build improved tools, systems, and process designs, this may involve the coordination of multiple people and resources in different departments to provide a complete solution utilizing a variety of technologies as needed, including: Workflow, ERP, SQL, Reporting, MS Office products.


Testing, Training, and Documentation

Coordinate and assist in testing and training activities for new solutions. This may include developing test scripts and training materials, leading presentations and meetings and working with individuals in groups in multiple departments in the organization. Work with process owners and coordinators to ensure their departments have planned the resources needed to effectively use the new processes and systems. Document changes to existing procedures and systems.

Solution Implementation
Implement improved processes and systems as required and schedule with IT for implementation of software solutions. Implement metrics and performance tracking. Follow up with process owners and business leaders to ensure implemented tools, designs and systems are working as expected.

Administrative
Work with department leads, application owners(coordinators) and end users to resolve issues and provide training, instruction and support as needed. Follow up with departments and application managers to monitor new processes and identify further areas for continuous improvement. Work with external vendors to resolve product issues.
